Mr. Meng T. is the 49 year old village bank president. He and his wife, M.. Chhun Bunthon, are cooks who are hired to cook at wedding ceremonies, festival ceremonies, parties, etc. This couple has eleven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are laborers at pig breeding businesses. Four are attending the local school and the remaining stay at home because they are too young to work or study. Mr. Meng T. is requesting a loan to buy sugar cane to make juice and start a business to earn more income. 

Six members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane to make juice and start a business to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Seam P., 42, is married with four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She sells fried bananas to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 5 per day, and her husband makes US$ 5 selling wood. All of their children are students. Seam P. would like to request a loan to purchase land so she can start cultivation to have an additional profit to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase land to expand cultivation

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
K. is 48 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. He is the father of six children: two of them are married and live separately, and the other four are students and still need his help. He is married to Yoe, 50, who earns a living planting vegetables behind her house.

K. owns a set of video equipment providing a film show to the local people during ceremonies and parties. He is famous for his good service. Recently because his old electric machine is broken very often, he decided he needs to change it. So K. is taking a loan of US$ 500 to buy a new electric machine for his business. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. K. was not available for the photograph but his wife was photographed instead.

loans.use: To buy a new electric machine for his business

loans.name: Pes

texts.en: Pes L., 35, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are dealers who typically make US$5 every day. They purchase cows in their village and sell them at the Vietnam border. They would like to request a loan of US$1000 to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. owns a small parcel of land. She uses it to plant rice to support her family. Her husband, Larry T., is the one who manages the farm. To ensure a better yield, they check their farm every day; they remove the weeds and watch so the birds do not eat the rice. She is 36 years old and has three children who are students. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. The loan will truly help her have a better yield. She is also interested in looking for some other line of business to augment their income. In that way, she believes, she could well support the needs of her children.

CEVI helps her sustain her business. Now she enjoys having credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Ana Valente Mazive

texts.pt:
Ana nasceu em gaza,tem 51 anos de idade e casada e mae de 12 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 5 aos 33 anos de idade dos quais 8 são rapazes e 4 são raparigas, os 7 mais velhos são empregados e os restantes 5 encontram se a estudar.

Ana perde  seu pai logo apos a nascencia,  sendo assim a sua mae junta se com o segundo esposo e teve que deixa la sob cuidados do seu irmao mais velho. Mais este a maltratava e ela so consegue fazer a 1 classe do antigo sistema. Quando tinha 10 anos esta foge com a sua amiga para maputo a procura de emprego onde vem a trabalhar como empregada domestica durante 5 anos, sai de maputo a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia  quando juntou se com seu esposo que era trabalhador da petromoc em namaacha. Este da lhe um fundo e ela inicia com a criacao de pintos,e criadora a mais de 10 anos tem metido no maximo 300 e no minimo 200 pintos  gasta 20.000.00mt e tem um lucru  de 7.000.00mt mensalmente consegue poupar 2.000.00mt e 1.000.00mt aluga capoeira, pois para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que e orfao de pais.

Este e o primeiro emprestimo de ana na hluvuku e kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt ,para compra e criacao de pintos  e tem a certeza que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado pois para alem dos frangos conta com a ajuda do seu esposo. Tem como objectivo construir a sua propria capoeira e tornar se uma grande criadora de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana was born in Gaza, Mozambique. She is 51 years old, and is married with 12 children between 5 and 33 years of age -- 8 sons and 4 daughters Her 7 oldest children are working, and the other 5 are in school. Ana's father died after she was born, so her mother married a second time and had to leave her in her older brother's care. But he abused her and she only managed to get through what was called first grade in the old system. When she was 10 years old, she ran away with her friend to Maputo to look for work. She worked as a domestic servant there for five years, and then left Maputo for Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland, when she met her husband, who worked for Petromoc in Namaacha. He gave her funds for her to start raising chickens. She's been raising them for more than 10 years. She has between 200 and 300 chickens. She spends 20,000 mt, and earns 7000 mt a month. She manages to save 2000 mt and rents a hencoop for 1000 mt, so that in the future her two children will be able to take care of her nephew, whose parents are dead. This is the first loan Ana will receive from Hluvuku and Kiva. These 15,000 mt will be used to buy and raise chickens, and she is certain she will repay the loan early because besides the chickens she also has her husband's help. Her goal is to build her own hencoop and become a large poultry producer.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks to raise poultry

loans.name: Peme

texts.en:
Peme O. is a rice grower. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. She started her business in 1991, using a 2-hectare plot that they rented from their friends. Her husband, Jerry O., is also a farmer. They work very hard to support the needs of their family. Aside from rice, Peme also grows pigs. They got themselves into hog raising because, aside from the fact that they enjoy the work, they earn a lot of money from their pigs. The income has helped the family to pay the tuition, books and other school costs of their children.

Peme is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides. She is also willing to venture into another line of business. In this way, she could support her family well. CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start their own business. They provide not only credit but also training and insurance coverage to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ronald's Group

texts.en:
K. Ronald is a member of Nezikokolima group in Mayangayanga. He is a businessman with a retail shop in the trading centre that sells mostly bean seeds, maize seeds, sugar, bread, sodas, cooking oil and many others, all of the products which he stocks in large quantities.

Ronald has benefited from his lending group in that he is able to have variety in his shop hence able to make a weekly profit of about 100,000 Ushs. As a result, he has bought a motorcycle that helps with his business as well as for transportation business. He needs a loan to help with restocking his retail shop.

loans.use: buying more goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Gbenade

texts.fr: Monsieur A. réside dans le quartier de bè ahligo qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, il est marié et a un enfant, sa femme est une revendeuse. Il est un frigoriste, il a associé à son activité le commerce de réfrigérateurs et de bouteilles de gaz. A. a commencé son activité seulement en 2007, son stock de marchandises a un peu diminué, il demande à wages un prêt pour acheter 10 bouteilles de gaz PM et 20 tuyaux flexibles.
texts.en:
Mr. A. resides in Bè Ahligo, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. He is married and has a child. His wife is a retailer, and he is a refrigerator specialist. To this work of his, he has added commerce in refrigerators and bottles of gas. He began in this business only in 2007. His stock of merchandise has shrunk a bit. He’s asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 bottles of PM gas and 10 flexible tubes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottles of gas and flex tubing

loans.name: Mrs. Phen Yoeng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phen Y. is the 46-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land wheR. she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing moR. vegetables to R.-sell to earn moR. income to support her family. Mrs. Phen Y. is a widow with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Purchasing more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo A. owns a small parcel of land. He is 56 years old and has 3 loving children. He dreams of having a good life for the family. He wants his children to graduate college to be able to find better jobs in the future. When he is not busy in his farm, he drives a tricycle (a local three-wheeled vehicle) to earn additional income. His wife, Cecilia,is a beautician. Together, they work very hard to sustain their family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will definitely help him improve his yield. He is also looking for some possible income areas to help his family still more. CEVI provides their clients a chance to have their own businesses. They help provide credit, training and insurance coverage to help their clients' small businesses grow.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Kyambadde Aidah Group

texts.en:
Kyambadde A. is 32 years of age; she is married with 8 children. She owns a house with 5 rooms and that is where she lives with her family. She does not have water in her home, neither does she have electricity. She has to fetch water from a nearby spring. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding her children.

Kyambadde A. sells charcoal from her home and she works seven days a week. She receives about 30 customers a day; she sells her charcoal both retail and wholesale. She has done this business for 10 years now.

The challenges she faces in this business are that since she has to collect the charcoal from the villages, the distances are very far and when it rains it is very difficult to access the village roads because most times they become impassable.

She has worked with MCDT for eight years and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she needed some capital for her business. She wants to use this loan to invest in her business and her aspiration is to start up a retail shop.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Thiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiem V. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Hang Chha, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to provide a better life for their family.

Mrs. Thiem V. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work and thus reduce her expense for motor taxis. She is a 60-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work

loans.name: Zohirdzhon

texts.ru: Клиент Курбонов Зохирджон проживаюший в городе душанбе, холост, образования среднее техническое. Сам клиент занимается мантажом свадьб и разных мероприятий. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. На полученные от нас деньги клиент хочет купить более мощьный компьютер для дольнейшей работы.От полученной прибыли клиент хочет женится.
texts.en:
Client Zohirdzhon K. lives in Dushanbe. He is a bachelor and has a secondary technical education. The client creates montages of weddings and different events. He creates them at his home. The client would like to use the money from the loan to purchase a more powerful computer for future work. He would like to use the profits to get married.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new computer

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr:
Né en 1965 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin, K. Donatien réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Donatien est père de six (06) enfants dont cinq (05) sont scolarisés. Donatien est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. L’électronique étant une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens, Donatien ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et se faire  plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour rendre plus performant son atelier que Donatien sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin, Mr. K. Donatien resides in the 3rd district of Porto-Novo. He is the father of six children, of whom five are in school. Donatien is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers and for earning enough to meet his various responsibilities. Thus, in order to make his workshop more competitive, he’s requesting a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en: U. Ergash lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has eight children who help him take care of the family's flock. The flock consists of 3 milking cows and 12 rams. Ergash has worked in livestock for 30 years. He has the skills needed to increase the family's income from the livestock business. Ergash wants to buy a young pedigreed bull from Kyrgyzstan to increase the flock. He has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Ahmadboy

texts.en: M. Ahmadboy first applied to MicroInvest in 2006 when he decided to purchase a pedigreed bull. He heard from his brother about the MicroInvest loan procedure and decided to take a business development loan. Today he has a good flock of two cows and nine rams. He dreams of having a big flock because he is the father of two boys and he has to think about the future when his sons marry. Ahmadboy also works on the collective farm but his general income depends on the livestock business. Ahmadboy has worked in the livestock business for 10 years so he has good skills. He is applying to KIVA for a loan of 3000 TJS for 9 months to purchase a pedigreed bull. He invites you to visit his home and he wishes all the best in the future.

loans.use: Purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Toussaint

texts.fr:
Né en 1955 à Abomey, A. Toussaint réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. AÏDOTE Toussaint est père de six (06) enfants dont quatre (04) sont scolarisés. Toussaint est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. Mais l’électronique est une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens et Toussaint ne dispose pas de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre d'acheter le matériel nécessaire pour son travail. Pour rendre plus performant son atelier afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle Toussaint sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1955 in Abomey, Mr. A. Toussaint lives in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. Toussaint is the father of six children, of whom four are in school. He is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers he has. To make his workshop more competitive, so as to satisfy his customers better, he’s requesting a loan. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronics equipment

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.en: K. Bifotima has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003 and she recommended herself as a serious and reliable client who trusts our loan programme. Bifotima is engaged in the commercial service and trade. She sells children wear that she brings from Istaravshan. Bifotima has a good assortment and she has repeat clients. Bifotima is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 100 STJ for 2 months just to pay the trade outlet rent.

loans.use: To pay the trade outlet rent.

loans.name: Marvis

texts.en: Marvis O. sells jewelry. She travels to Togo and Ghana to purchase her jewelry to sell in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She has applied for a loan for 140,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelery to sell

loans.name: Khujakul

texts.en: K. Khujakul lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. Khujakul works in the school but the general family income depends on the livestock business that Khujakul has worked in for 40 years. He applied to KIVA for a business support loan of 3800 TJS for 9 months for the summer cow barn building. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: summer cow barn building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Tuichiboy

texts.en:
A. Tuichiboy is a very courageous man who manages tough jobs like raising sheep and agriculture. He's the father of four adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of sheep to breed them on his property. His greatest goal now is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Tuichiboy is requesting a loan from IMON International to purchase sheep so that he can breed them.

More about Tajikistan Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Although the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. History of IMON International Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchase sheep to breed in order to expand the business

loans.name: Awori Patricia Group

texts.en:
Awori P. is 49 years old, and she is married with two children, ages 24 and 26 years. She and her family stay in a one-room house. She also looks after an additional family member in her house. She provides three meals a day for her family. Her greatest expense each month is rent for her shop. She has a retail shop in a market near her home. She also works 6 days a week and she has over 10 customers a day. She has had this business for 3 years.

She has been with MCDT for 6 years, and she has received 12 loans so far from MCDT. She has also worked with her group for 6 years. Awori P. plans to use this loan to increase her business and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Increase the stock of items to sell in retail shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan S. is 52 years old and she is a widow with 5 children. She sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a the loan for $675 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr:
Né en 1970 à Bonou, Z. Charles réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin. Charles est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. Charles est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus qui l'aide à gagner sa vie. L’électronique est une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens; or Charles ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour acheter les équipements pouvant lui permettre de rendre performant son atelier afin de bien satisfaire le grand nombre de clients qu'il a et de se faire  plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. Afin de rendre plus performant son atelier Charles sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Bonou, Mr. Z. Charles resides in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. He is the father of two children who are both in school. Charles is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for buying the equipment enabling him to make his workshop competitive, so as to do well in satisfying the large number of customers he has. He also lacks the funds for earning enough to meet his various responsibilities. To make his workshop more competitive, he’s requesting a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: K. Muhayo was born in 1972 in the J.Rasulov region in Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Muhayo sells cosmetics in the local bazaar. She brings the cosmetics herself from Istaravshan. She sells hair-color cream, creams, and cosmetics. She wants to open an outlet in the crowded bazaar where she intends to sell perfumes and cosmetics. Muhayo requests a loan of $450 (1600 TJS) for 6 months from KIVA so she can import new goods to sell.

loans.use: Import new goods to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat, together with her husband (pictured), has a small business of selling construction supplies in their store, which they have recently expanded. They fill their store with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers who are looking to construct or build offices, houses, and so on. Muhabbat has been in business for about 11 years. She enjoys her work and has developed a stable enterprise. She is requesting a loan to help purchase a new supply of items to sell.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new supplies of items to sell in a construction supplies store.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
J. Naimjon lives in the town of Kanibadam in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person who has run a livestock farm since his youth, with the goal of supporting his family: his wife and two children. Naimjon needs to purchase calves and goats to breed them and to maximize his profits by selling their milk and meats. He sells these in his neighborhood and is thereby able to support his family. For this reason, Naimjon is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Tuichiboy

texts.en: Tuichiboy K. is 29 years old. He lives in the B.Gafurov region and he is married and has 3 children. He doesn’t have special education but, like many rural residents, he is engaged in the livestock business which brings in the general family income. Tuichiboy raises and sells livestock. Today he is applying to KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months for the purchase of a pedigree bull.

loans.use: Purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Barthélemy

texts.fr:
Né en 1964 à Porto-Novo, A. Barthélemy réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin. Barthélemy est père de trois (03) enfants  dont  deux (02) sont scolarisés. Barthélemy est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. L’électronique étant une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens, Barthélemy ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et se faire  plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour rendre plus performant son atelier que Barthélemy sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Porto-Novo, Mr. A. Barthélemy resides in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. He is the father of three children, of whom two are in school. Barthélemy is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds enabling him to satisfy the large number of customers and to earn enough to meet his various responsibilities. Thus, to make his workshop more competitive, Barthélemy is requesting a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. sells second-hand shoes. She hopes to expand her business. She travels to Cotonou to purchase second-hand shoes to sell in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with seven children. She is asking for a loan of $950 to purchase more shoes to sell. Esther says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en:
Dilovar has sixteen years of experience in producing wheat, watermelon and onions in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these crops is an established tradition. He works the fields with the support of his wife, who is also dedicated to the production. This couple has been perfecting and modernizing their production processes. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the process, such as manually weeding and using organic fertilizer and natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields to their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value. Organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. Dilovar requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his crops, such as seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He will use part of the loan to pay wages to the hired workers. The loan will greatly improve Dilovar’s income and his family's living conditions.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nabasirye Cossy Group

texts.en:
Nabasirye C. is 22 years old. She is married with two children, aged five months and four years. She rents a one-room house where she lives with her family. She doesn’t have access to piped water so she gets it from a spring nearby. She eats three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is buying food for her family.

Nabasirye C. has a retail shop where she sells mostly soft drinks. She receives about 15 customers a day. She has managed this business for one year. It is her first business and she has not faced many difficulties yet. She has been with MCDT for three years now. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is that she wanted to get capital to increase her stock. She has worked with her group for one year now, and she hopes this loan will help to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Abdugulom

texts.en: J. Abdugulom lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has seven children. Abdugulom's trade revolves around livestock. He is experienced with livestock, having been in this business for twenty years. Abdugulom has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of $325 for six months to buy another milk cow. This will allow him to open a trade outlet specializing in selling homemade sour milk.

loans.use: To open a specialized trade outlet.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine O. is 56 years old and is separated from her husband. She has five children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells secondhand bags to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of $675 to purchase more secondhand bags to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand bags to sell.

loans.name: Ikromidin

texts.en:
B. Ikromidin is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children. Like his parents, who cultivated large crops, he has been a farmer since he was a boy. He enjoys being a farmer. Like his brother, he plants crops and then eventually he or his wife takes the products directly to market to sell. This way, he does not have to give away any of his efforts to middlemen.

Farming brings Ikromidin good earnings. He tells us that to succeed, you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. Therefore, he fertilizes his crops so that he has a good harvest.

This is his fourth loan with IMON International and he is responsible with his payments. The money he is requesting will be invested in high-quality seeds and fertilizer. Ikromidin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his goals with this loan.

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia D. a  40 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses 7 enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Madame Kadia D., en plus de son activité  de préparation et de vente de la crème de mil (appelée le  Dèguè), qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa grand mère, est également  très habile dans le secteur du vestimentaire infantile. Très appréciée, elle ne cesse d’être sollicitée par de nombreux clients tant masculins que féminins.
Dans le souci de diversifier davantage ses activités et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après  4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) elle est à son 6 ème prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce  prêt Kadia D. compte  acheter, 140 litres de lait frais, 20 kg de sucre, 120  kg de mil, 3000 FCFA de glace et des douzaines d’habits pour enfant.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première (lait, sucre, mil et glace ) dans le marché de Bougouni, et les vêtements pour enfant à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali.). Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit, au marché et dans son  quartier à une  clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000 FCFA par mois et ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadia D. is 40 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, seven children, and her co-wife in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). In addition to her work making and selling cream of millet (called "dèguè"), which she learned how to do from her grandmother, she is also very adroit in the field of children's clothing. Much appreciated, she is continually in high demand by numerous customers, as many men as women.

Wanting to diversify her business more and to satisfy her customers, she decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After four group loans (solidarity loans), she is on her sixth individual loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, she intends to buy: 140 liters of fresh milk, 20 kg of sugar, 120 kg of millet, 3000 francs CFA worth of ice, and dozens of children's outfits. She gets her basic ingredients (milk, sugar, millet, and ice) at the Bougouni marketplace and her children's clothing in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the marketplace and in her area, to customers from all walks of life.

She envision realizing a profit of 60,000 francs per month, and her ambition is to open a clothing shop in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and ingredients for cream of millet

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr:
Né en 1973 à Porto-Novo, F. Comlan réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin. Comlan est père d’un (01) enfant scolarisé. Comlan est un technicien en électronique. Comlan gagne sa vie avec cette activité. Mais Comlan ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de rendre performant son atelier de travail. C’est pourquoi Comlan sollicite un crédit afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, Mr. F. Comlan resides in the 3rd district of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. He is the father of one child, who is in school. Comlan is an electronics technician and earns this living this way. But he lacks enough funds for enabling him to make his workshop competitive. This is why he’s requesting a loan, so as to satisfy his customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem J. is 46 years old and married with three children. Hatem has been working as a contractor for ten years. His business is the only source of income for the family. Hatem works very hard in order to bring in enough income. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more construction equipment. He says, "Thanks," to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: purchase more construction equipment

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.en:
J. Fathullo is married and the father of three kids. He is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing wheat and vegetables. Fathullo leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home.

Fathullo would like to request a loan of 6000 Somoni, which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers that are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this amount will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Fathullo always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
M. Fotima is 49 years old. She is married with three children. Fotima sells perfume and cosmetics at the market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Fotima dreams to expand her business, open her own store and establish contacts with the suppliers of well-known products. 

Fotima and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children so that they become highly demanded experts in the future. Today Fotima requests $1,500 in order to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish and lipsticks to increase her range of goods. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan on 4 months in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase new perfumes and cosmetics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Madumar

texts.en:
Madumar E. started his livestock business practically from scratch, but thanks to the previous loans he received from MicroInvest he has increased the size of his flock and started producing milk and yarn. He has been engaged in the livestock business for 10 years and now has one cow and 9 rams. He also works as the school's history teacher, but his love of animals brought him to livestock.

Today Madumar is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 TJS for 6 months to buy one more milk cow. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow

loans.name: Farakh

texts.en:
Farakh M. has two children to take care of and provide daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture industry since he was very young, has acquired experience and in this way is able to maintain his family. Today this gentleman needs to promptly acquire the economic resources to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for planting wheat, watermelon and onion. This was Farakh's motive for coming to IMON International to obtain the loan necessary for the purchase so that he can continue caring for his humble family that really needs his support.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab A. is 45 years old (her son appears in the picture). She lives in Hebron in Palestine with her husband and five children. She and her husband opened a grocery store to help pay for their children's education as well as the household expenses.

Rihab is asking for a $1000 loan to expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise, so that she can be well supplied and satisfy her customers. She makes all the decisions with respect to the income from her business. She has become more outspoken and has a great desire to succeed. Rihab is grateful to Ryada for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

loans.use: expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr:
Né en 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin, D. Jonas réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Jonas est père de cinq (05) enfants dont  quatre (04) sont scolarisés. Jonas est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers and for earning enough to meet his various responsibilities. Thus, in order to make his workshop more competitive, Jonas is requesting a loan.

Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Nabaterrega  Suliana Group

texts.en:
Nabaterrega S. is a 50-year-old single mother of nine, with children aged 14 to 30. She rents a two-room house where she lives with her family. She also takes care of additional family members and the family has three meals a day. Her greatest expense in a month is tuition fees for her children.

She sells chicken on a retail basis in the market and rents the space where she does business. She works seven days a week and has about five customers a day. She has done this business for seven years now and has not done any other business.

The main challenge she faces in her business is that people buy chicken seasonally, especially during the festive season. She has worked with MCDT for ten years and has received 20 loans from MCDT so far. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it lends to the poor. She will use this loan to increase her stock, and she also hopes to continue growing her business.

loans.use: increase her stock and grow her business

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.en:
Juraboy E. applied first to the MicroInvest program in 2007 and since that time he has applied to MicroInvest for other business development loans. Juraboy has been engaged in livestock for 40 years and has cows and 5 rams. He recommends himself as the executive and a reliable client.

Today Juraboy is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of $725 (2,700 TJS) for 8 months to buy a pedigree bull. He thanks Kiva for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
P. Ravshan grows wheat and vegetables. He is 46 years old and has four children. Before he worked as a driver. He was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 2000, he started managing his farm. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help send his children to school. Ravshan is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will help him increase his yield and improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine rents chairs and canopies. He also sells bags of cement. He lives in Ubiaja, Edo state, Nigeria. He is 45 years old and married with 7 children. He is requesting a loan of $950 (140000 NGN) to purchase more chairs and canopies to rent out to his customers. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more canopies and chairs

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.en:
Abdurauf A. applied first to the MicroInvest in 2009. He is married and has 4 children that help him in the livestock business. Abdurauf is a builder also, but it is seasonal work so livestock is the general family income.

Abdurauf has been engaged in livestock for 30 years. He dreams of owning a big livestock farm, so he is ready to work hard. Abdurauf is asking Kiva for financial business support of $275 (1000 TJS) for 6 months for pedigree bull purchase.

loans.use: pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan S. is 19 years old and single. With the help of his family he opened a small grocery store where he sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many others.

He would like to ask for a loan of $1,000 to expand the capacity of his commerce by acquiring supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so as to meet the needs of his family. He and his family thank you for the support that you're giving him to be able to continue growing his business.

loans.use: Purchase more and new products

loans.name: Cordelia

texts.en:
Cordelia sells foodstuffs and drinks. She hopes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers.

She needs the loan amount of N70000 to purchase a generator and a deep freezer. This, she says, will enable her meet the demands of her customers.

She is 38 years old and married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and a generator

loans.name: Mayakhon

texts.en:
Mayakhon R. is married and has three children. She runs a business selling men’s clothing at the central market of Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Her clothing sales business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Mayakhon has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 8 years. Mayakhon would like to get a loan of $1500 USD to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Mayakhon achieve her goals, sustain her success and win as an entrepreneur.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increasing the working capital of her business for the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40 year old Titi A Nguyu from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children, between the ages of 12 and 23. Titi has been running a African tradition cloth business  since 2006. Client’s business is sell African traditional cloth called “VITENGE”. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Titi currently earns about 100 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Titi thanks you for her support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: purchase stock of vitenge in bulk.

loans.name: Davlyatniso

texts.en:
Davlyatniso S. is a 47-year-old widowed mother of four children. She has been very supportive of her children since she became a single parent. Davlyatniso has sold clothes for kids at her local market for the past 15 years. Because of this, she will be able to pay for her children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell. Davlyatniso would like to use the loan to buy more bales of clothes that come with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to help all of her children to finish school.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increasing working capital for the purpose of business development

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Клиент Абдурахмонов Анварджон 35 лет проживаюший в Бохтарском районе, женат имеет 5 детей.Кормилец семьи, образования среднее.Клиент занимается торговлей в городе Курган_Тюбе уже более одного года .Торгует автозапчастями . Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погашать кредит собирается в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Client Anvarjon A. is 35 years old, lives in the Bohtar region and is married with 5 children. He is the family provider and has a high school education. He has been selling at Kurgan-Tube for over a year. He sells auto parts. Anvarjon has a sales location at the central market. He plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Dumba's Group

texts.en:
N. Dumba is the leader of the Bwavumpologoma group in Ntenjeru. She is a strong business lady who sells produce of all kinds from the villages to people in the town centers, where the prices are favorable. She buys the produce from the farmers in the villages that barely have any means to transport their produce to the market as well as growing some of them herself, though what she has is never enough compared to what she needs for a single sale.

Whenever N. has a loan, even after having accumulated savings, she is then able to buy in bulk. At times she buys from a plantation and then gets the food slowly, depending on her market, since the foods she deals in are all perishables. She has been able to buy herself a motorcycle, has cows and goats at home and she would like another loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 39 years old and married with three children. He sells provisions and drinks. Joseph lives in Ubiaja Edo State, Nigeria. He needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Salome J U. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. Salome has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She makes dresses of different types and sells them. She works at her business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. One employee assists her. Salome currently earns about $180 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to improve her business by buying more equipment and accessories. In the future, she plans to open another business. Salome thanks you for her support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and accessories.

loans.name: Salijon

texts.en:
A. Salijon is 28 years old. He lives in B.Gafurov region and works, like many rural residents, in the livestock business. Salijon is married and his young wife helps him take care of the animals. Salijon also works as
the stock keeper on the collective farm. He is young but he is skilled in livestock. Salijon has been engaged in livestock for six years and has the appropriate knowledge. Salijon wants to buy six rams to make and sell yarn in the future. He is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months. Salijon thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To buy six rams

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon E. U. is 32 years old and married with a child. Solomon sells wine and drinks and needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more stock as he hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Gul

texts.ru: Клиджаев Гул проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 15 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет увеличить хозяйство и тем самым увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможе  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gul K. lives in the region of Kurgan-Tube. He is 49 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education. He is in animal husbandry business. He has fifteen years experience in this field. He plans to get a loan to increase the headcount of cattle. This will help increase his business and also his profits. Gul will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some cloth for resale

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail is married. He owns a small store that sells car spare parts. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat clients and a stable business. Michail has been in this business for 10 years. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his clients order. Michail would like to borrow 10,000 UAH for 3 months to purchase spare parts in bulk. Michail says that short-term loans help him in his business a lot.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine sells foodstuffs, drinks and provisions.  He is 53 years old and married with six children. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Ходжиев Исматулло житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее. Единственный источник дохода его семьи является животноводство. Он покупает молодых бычков для откормки , а затем продает по более выгодной цене. Этот бизнес наиболее распрастраннен среди сельской местности. Поэтому его действия могут внести лепту в развитие животноводства. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев, с целью увеличит поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Ismatullo H. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. He is 43 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. Animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. He buys young calves for growth, and then resells them at a more profitable price. This business is very common among the villagers. By doing his business Ismatullo can contribute into the development of animal husbandry. At this time he wants to get a loan for 12 months term to increase headcount of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Cookery Sellers Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu S., Isatu S., Adama K. and Kathy K..  They named their group Cookery Women. This will be their fourth loan from SMT. Previous loans have made tremendous impacts in their lives. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 for each to enable them to strengthen their businesses further.

Isatu S. (2nd from left) is the leader of this group. Isatu is forty years of age. She was born in Kupr Kalisa, Kambia district, in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She now resides in Makeni City together with her husband. She has two children. One is in Senior Secondary School II (JSS II) and the other is in Class 2.  Her husband is a businessman. 

Isatu sells cooked rice and has been in this business for over eight years now. With this loan, Isatu will buy cooking ingredients. She will buy five bags of rice, forty barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil (the most popular cooking), fish, onions etc. 

Currently, Isatu faces no major challenges worth noting in her business. Business is going fine; she is doing well in her business and loves doing it. With this loan, Isatu and members of the Cookery Sellers Group will feel good and happy, as it will enable them to improve their businesses further.

(Note: Two women in this group have the same name, Isatu S.)

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Bibie

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Bibie H. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with two children between the ages of 4 and 10. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents cannot take care of him. Bibie has been selling an African traditional cloth called khanga since last month. She works at the business for five hours per day, eight days per week. Currently she earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. Bibie thanks you for her support!
	
Kiva partner SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth stock in bulk

loans.name: Rahmiddin

texts.ru: Собиров Рахмиддин проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возрас 32 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Уже девять лет занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmiddin S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. He has secondary education. He has been in animal husbandry for nine years. He plans to get a loan and use it to increase the headcount of cattle. He will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Lusia S. K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five. Lusia has been running a retail shop business since 2007. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, five days per week. Lusia currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Lusia thanks you for her support!
	
Kiva partner SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail store in bulk

loans.name: Godspower

texts.en: Godspower is 38 years old and married without a child. He cracks palm kernels and sells them. He needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase a machine that cracks more palm kernels, so he can expand his business. He thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one machine for cracking palm kernels

loans.name: Ighalo

texts.en:
Ighalo O. is 35 years old and married with four children. He repairs and sells second-hand refrigerators. The demand for his second-hand fridges is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

He hopes for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more second-hand fridges to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand fridges to sell

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a widow. She has two grown-up children and grandchildren. She owns a small business that sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Her monthly gross income is 15,000 UAH.

Alexandra has been in this business for 13 years. She likes selling clothing and says that this is what she can do best. Alexandra is a hard-working and very entrepreneurial person. She is always looking for new types of clothing to sell. Alexandra has many repeat clients who enjoy buying things from her.

Alexandra would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to make additional profit and help her children and grandchildren financially.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata S., Ya Kaday T. and Fatu C.. They named their group One Way. Previous loans have had meaningful impacts on their lives. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Fatmata S. (middle) is the leader of the group. Fatmata is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married to an architect and the two of them have three children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II), another is in class four, and the last is not of school-going age. Fatmata sells market food in Makeni's second largest market. She has been in the market food business since childhood. With this loan, Fatmata will buy gallons of cooking oil, a bag of onions, a carton of “margi” and two cartons of tomatoes.  

Fatmata faces no major challenges in her business. Business is going on fine and well for her. She enjoys doing her business and would like to see it grow. Her business is the only source of income for Fatmata. From this business, she and her husband pay for the children's schooling, feed the family and solve most of the household problems.

loans.use: To invest in a food-selling business

loans.name: To Me To You Group

texts.en:
This is Gbasseh B. and Abu Bakarr K.. They named their group Me to You. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. They have had several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have been a great help to the members of this group. Those loans enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve the living conditions of the members of the group. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a loan for Le 500,000 each. 

Gbasseh B. (right) is the leader of the group. She is 28 and was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children: two are in primary schools, one is in nursery school and the last is still very young. Gbasseh sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and “gara lapper” (locally dyed clothes). She also sometimes assists her business by selling second-hand clothes. Gbasseh has been a businesswoman for more than 15 years now.

With this new loan, Gbasseh will expand her business. She will use the loan to buy two barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil, three bags of rice and any other local produce she finds that would be profitable. She will also invest some into her gara lapper (dyed clothing) business. Gbasseh buys her goods from a village called Faradugu. In this village, a barter of palm oil costs her something like Le 55,000 and a bag of rice costs her Le 70,000.00. The fare to and from Faradugu costs her Le 30,000 including the goods. 

So far, Gbasseh faces no major challenges in her business worth noting. Business is going fine and smoothly for her. She loves doing her business and would like to see it grow as it is her only source of survival.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Angelina W. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 18 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them. Angelina has been running a butcher shop business since 2008. Her business is to buy the cows and butcher them. She works at the business for five hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by two employees and her husband. Angelina currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow. In the future, she plans to open another business. Angelina thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Bayiyana Regina Group

texts.en:
Bayiyana R. is a 56-year-old widow with seven children. She has a one-room house. Though she doesn’t have electricity she has access to piped water. She also looks after three children who lost their parents. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition for her children.

Bayiyana R. sells charcoal in the market from a store she rents. She works seven days a week.

She has done this business for 15 years now, though prior to this she was selling roasted chicken. The main challenge she faces while doing this business is that she pays high rent for the place she works. The rainy season also affects her business so much because most of the village roads where she collects her charcoal from are spoiled by the rains so transporting becomes difficult.

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for six years now and the reason why she chose MCDT was because she wanted to access loans to improve in her business. She has worked with her group for six years and she will use this loan to increase her stock. She also wants to see all her children finish their education

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Subira M. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with one child, who is 21. Subira has been running a shop selling clothes and shoes since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week.

Subira currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Subira thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.
