One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: Purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Government Technical Institute Group

texts.en:
These gentle men are staff members of the Government Technical Institute Magburaka, Tonkolili District, Northern Sierra Leone. Government Technical Institute, Magburaka, was founded in 1962 by the government for the promotion of technical and vocational education. They teach mechanical engineering, carpentry and joinery, block laying and concreting, automobile engineering, plumbing and sheet metal work, painting and decoration and many more. Presently, the institute has a total of fourteen staff and twenty-five students. 

The ten years old civil war tremendously disrupted the smooth running of the institute. Before the war, the institute used to have an enrollment of about 200 – 300 students. In 1997 – 2002, rebels vandalized the whole institute – buildings were unroofed, labs and libraries destroyed. However Sababu Education, a World Bank sponsored project is currently rehabilating the institute. But the project does not call for reequipping the laboratories and libraries.

Government Technical Institute Magburaka is the only government technical institute in Magburaka town. Over the years, the institute has been able to train so many technicians serving both within and without Sierra Leone. It makes good grades at the external examinations organized by City and Guilds of London Institute. The institute also serves as a consultancy and guard to the people of Magburaka. 

This is the first loan Government Technical Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

David E.A. K. is the principal at the Institute. He has been a teacher for forty-three years now.  Mr. K. (right) was born in Makurgbo, nine miles from Magburaka. He is sixty-one years of age, married to a teacher and the two of them have five children. Four of their children are in secondary schools and the eldest is already a grown-up. Mr. K. will use his loan to pay his children’s school fees and solve many of his domestic problems.

loans.use: To pay school fees for children

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en: Fedelia sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 35 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of N120000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell  .

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence Ewailefoh is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells provisions and drinks.

Florence needs a loan in the amount of N80000 to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Kyambadde Aidah Group

texts.en:
Kyambadde A. is 32 years old and married with eight children. She owns a house with five rooms and that is where she stays with her family. She does not have water or electricity in her home. She has to fetch water from a nearby spring. She has three meals a day and her greatest monthly expense is feeding her children.

Kyambadde A. sells charcoal from home and she works seven days a week. She receives about 30 customers a day. She sells her charcoal both at retail and at wholesale. She has done this business for 10 years now. The challenge she faces in this business is that she has to collect the charcoal from the villages. The distances are very long and when it rains, it is very difficult to access the village roads because most times they become impassable.

She has worked with MCDT for eight years and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is that she needed capital for her business. She wants to use this loan to invest in her business. Her aspiration is to start a retail shop.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Fatuma H J. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. Additionally, Fatuma has been running a charcoal business since 2002. She sells charcoal, which is a small, black piece of dry earth used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative!

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, six days per week. Fatuma currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal stock. In the future, she plans to increase her stock. Fatuma thanks you for her support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Christo

texts.en: Christo O. sells ice cream and drinks. He is also a laundry man. Christo is 42 years old and married with four children. He has one laundry machine but he is not able to meet the demands of his customers. He needs a loan for N120000 to purchase another laundry machine to enable him meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one laundry machine

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice O. lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 36 years old and is married with eight children. She sells gallons of palm. The demand for her palm oil is high. In order to meet the demands of her customers, she needs a loan for N50000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Titi A N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children between the ages of 12 and 23. Titi has been running an African traditional cloth business  since 2006. She sells African traditional cloth called “VITENGE”. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Titi currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Titi thanks you for her support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase stock of vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 33 years old and married without children. He has a store where he sells medicine. Demand for his medicine is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

Christopher needs a loan in the amount of N50000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fruit, like pawpaw, oranges, and coconut. She needs a loan in the amount of N60000 to purchase more fruit to sell. She says thank you to all that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Namirimu Joyce Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 60 years of age. She is single and has three children. She owns a house with four rooms, where she lives with her four grandchildren. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is food. She sells charcoal to earn a living and she does this from home. She receives about ten customers a day. She has done this business for over four years now. Her main challenge in her business is transporting her charcoal from the village, especially during rainy seasons.

Joyce has been with MCDT for four years and has received eight loans so far. She has also worked with her group for four years. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted to get loans to increase her stock of charcoal. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her children. Her aspiration for the future is to build a bigger kiosk that can accommodate a larger stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina sells utensils, rechargeable phone cards, and clothes. She is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N120000 to purchase more stock to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils, rechargeable phone cards, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells utensils and other items, like plates, spoons, coolers, and pots. She needs a loan in the amount of N70000 to purchase more utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana F. D. C., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” D. la Comunidad D. Carancas, distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; D. 82 años D. edad, tiene 9 hijos, D. estado civil casada,  no posee estudios. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años e inició su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado vacuno con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado y en la comercialización D. ganado en las ferias locales del distrito D. Desaguadero. 
Actualmente la señora Juana requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder adquirir ganado vacuno, engordarlo y comercializarlo en las ferias, para poder ayudar a sus nietos, por quien ella vela eventualmente. Asimismo ella tiene el compromiso firme D. cumplir con sus pagos, y agradece a la institución por el apoyo brindado hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Juana F. D. C. belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (“Women United”) cooperative bank, located in the Carancas community in Puno. She is 82 years old and married, has nine children, and no formal education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years, having started her livestock raising business with the first loan she received of 300.00 Peruvian soles. She invested in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, and in selling her livestock at the local markets of the Desaguadero district. Currently, Juana needs a loan of 2,000.00 soles to buy livestock to fatten and sell at the markets so she can help her grandchildren. Concurrently, she is firmly committed to make her payments and is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided to date.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia I. U., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 25 años de edad, sin hijos, posee estudios de superior completa (enfermería técnica). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1.5 años, su negocio es la comercialización de golosinas, para lo cual inició con un préstamo de S/. 500 nuevos soles, en la compra de capital de trabajo. 
En el momento refiere tener la intención de ampliar su negocio, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo mas mercadería (galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, etc), con ello generará mayores ingresos y ampliará su mercado, finalmente esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Alicia I. U. belongs to the “El Comercio” Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito province, in the state of Puno. She is 25 years old, has no children, and has completed her studies as a nursing technician.

Alicia has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last year and a half. She has a business selling sweets. She began her business with a working capital loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $163). She is currently seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (US $650) to expand her business. She plans to purchase more merchandise (cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc.), and will thus be able to increase her income and expand her shop.

Finally, Alicia is prepared to repay her loan on time, according to the expectations of her group.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to purchase more merchandise (cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 25 year old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Hassan owns a barber shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassan first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. He decided on his business because of his experience and in order to increase his family’s income.

Hassan is requesting a loan for $800 from Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to purchase beauty products and a new seat for his salon. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a new seat for his salon.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is 43 years old and married with six children. She lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells provisions and drinks. She needs a loan in the amount of N120000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 52-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has owned a clothing shop for 20 years. He also sells lingerie.

Mouhamad requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he sells nice clothes and is aware of fashion. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When Mouhamad first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. He decided on doing his business because he had to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
La señora Juaquina H. D. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, en el distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 66 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. frutas al por mayor y menor, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir frutas en cajas (plátanos, tunas,  peras, etc.).  
Ella viene solicitando actualmente un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir mercaderías para su negocio, es decir fruta según la época y temporada (plátanos, sandías, etc.) asimismo desea adquirir gaseosas según lo que le pidan sus clientes; ella desea continuar trabajando con Manuela Ramos hasta que la vida le siga dando fuerzas; asimismo su anhelo es comprarse ganado para D. esta manera asegurar su vejez..
texts.en:
Juaquina H. D. M. is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (“United Women”) Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito province, in the state of Puno. She is 66 years old, married, has two children, and has completed secondary school.

Juaquina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for six years. She buys and sells fruit wholesale and retail. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase cases of fruit (bananas, prickly pears, pears, etc.).

She is now requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles, which she promises to repay in three monthly installments. With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her business, specifically fruit according to the season and time of year (bananas, watermelon, etc.). She would also like to purchase soft drinks, as her customers have requested them.

Juaquina wants to keep working with Manuela Ramos for the rest of her life. Her dream is to purchase cattle to proviD. security in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business (bananas, watermelon, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass U. buys and sells cashew nuts in bags. He is 32 years old and married with one child.

He hopes for the loan amount of N1400000 to purchase more bags of cashew nuts to sell.

U. lives in Jattu in the Edo state of Nigeria.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cashew nut to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel H. H., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 6 hijos, con estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, inició su negocio tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, a fin de mejorar su capital de trabajo. 
En la actualidad tiene la necesidad de tener un mayor capital, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los que lo invertirá en comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar y entre otros para poder surtir su tienda asimismo es consciente de pagar puntualmente sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo y agradece a movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Isabel H. H. is a member of the “El Comercio” Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito province, in the state of Puno. She is 36 years old, married, has six children, and completed her second year of secondary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years. She first asked for a loan of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles as working capital to start a small grocery store. She currently needs more capital, and so she is requesting 3,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sacks of rice, sugar, and other items to fully stock her shop.

Isabel will conscientiously repay her loan on time, according to the expectations of her group. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in sacks of rice, sugar, and other items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Semakula Regina Group

texts.en:
Semakula R. is 37 and married with four children. She owns a house with three rooms. She also looks after additional family members. She has three meals a day. Her greatest expense in a month is school fees for her children.

She has a retail shop and works seven days a week. The place she works from is her own. She receives 20 customers a day and she does her business on a retail basis. Prior to that she had a pay phone that she was operating. She has not had any main challenge so far in this business.

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for four years now and she has so far received eight loans from MCDT. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the low interest rate on their loans. She will use this loan to increase her stock. Her aspiration is to expand her business further.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.en:
Pelagio Bordón works as an upholsterer in Itá, Paraguay. He primarily works repairing seats in cars, trucks, motorcycles and the many buses that pass through Itá on a daily basis.

His work is well known in town, and he said he gets most of his customers through word of mouth. He is also known for his ability to work quickly. Pelagio stated that he never needs more than a day to complete a job, and often he completes his work in much less time.

While he said he has seen a slowdown in business due to the current economic situation, Pelagio is focused on helping his business grow and he remains confident that he will continue to be able to support his six children.

Pelagio is requesting this loan to purchase more material, mostly synthetic leather, at better prices in order to be prepared for large jobs.

loans.use: The purchase of material to be used in the repair of seats in trucks and buses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa G. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 28 años de edad, con 1 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de 300 soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para invertir en mayor mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, aceites, etc) y convertir su negocio en un establecimiento de mayor capacidad, de esta manera ampliará sus ingresos y una mejora en la calidad de vida de su hijo. Finalmente refiere cumplir con sus pagos de manera puntual, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa G. C. is a member of the communal bank called El Comercio in the district of Desaguadero, Chucuito Province in Puno. She is 28 years old and has one son. Rosa completed secondary school and has been working with Manuel Ramos for 3 years now. She began her grocery business with an inicial loan of 300 soles, which she invested in inventory. Today she is requesting a new loan to purchase stock, including rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, cooking oil, and other products at wholesale prices, She wants to build her business, increase her income and improve the quality of life for her son. She is able to make her repayments on time in accordance with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her business such as rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, cooking oil, etc and continue to grow her business

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells spare parts for motorcycles. He is 26 years old and single. He needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John S. is 41 years old and married with seven children. He sells crates of drinks.  He needs the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Daniela  Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Daniela tiene 47 años de edad, con cinco hijos  tres de ellos trabajan y dos están estudiando, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es maestro de obra de la construcción. Ella tiene una pulpería que comenzó con dinero que su esposo dio, el cual ahorro ya que muchas veces los ingresos son buenos. Con esta solicitud de crédito es su octavo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de productos diarios como pollo, carnes, granos básicos para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad, gracias a Afodenic ha podido desarrollarse en su negocio y en su vida personal lo cual espera poder seguir siendo socia y aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
Daniela is 47 years old and has 5 children, 3 of them are already working and 2 of them are still studying at school. They live in the neighborhood called Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. Her husband is a supervisor for a construction project. Daniela has a small general store which she started with money from her husband. The business usually has good income. This new loan request will be her eight investment in products such as chicken, meat and cereals and grains to offer her customers a good variety. Thanks to Afodenic, she has been able to develop her business and her personal life. She hopes to continue to be a member of the communal bank and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small store and purchase stock including chicken, meat and dairy products

loans.name: Estanisla

texts.en:
Estanisla B. has owned and operated a small store in her neighborhood in Itá, Paraguay, for about four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise and goods for the store, which is already one of the best-stocked in the area. She hopes to have enough capital to buy her standard items, like sugar, noodles and beer, in bulk. But she also makes sure to have “de todo un poco” (a little of everything).

Estanisla and her husband, who travels throughout the region as a salesman, work very hard to support their 11-year-old son. She stated that while sales have slowed a bit because of difficulties in the economy, she overcomes this by working harder. In addition to attending to her store, she goes door-to-door with her products to reach clients who wouldn’t otherwise walk by her street. She says these efforts make up for any sales she loses at the store.

Estanisla says she is always trying to grow her business, and with the loan she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, she is confident that she will continue to do so.

loans.use: Merchandise such as sugar, noodles and beer

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Fátima se dedica ala venta de ropa y cosméticos vende al contado y al crédito a la quincena, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa reconciliación, su esposo es ingeniero químico. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con fondo de su liquidación de su trabajo y con ayuda de su esposo pudo comenzar. Su proyecto con este crédito es la construcción de un cuarto con el objetivo de alquilarlo para obtener otros ingresos, este es su quinto ciclo de préstamo que esta muy contenta con Afodenic por ser parte de sus metas adquirida. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fatima works selling clothing and cosmetics by request and on credit. She is 34 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliacion. Her husband works as a chemical engineer. When Fatima began her business she used money from her previous job and money from her husband to start. She would like to use the money from this loan to construct another room in her house which she can rent out to earn more income. This will be her fifth loan and she's pleased with Afodenic for their support. In the future, she would like to continue to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to construct another room on their house,  which they can rent out to generate additional income.

loans.name: Celia Gricelda

texts.es:
La señora  Celia Gricelda F. Q., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 2 hijos, posee estudios superior incompleta (obtetriz).
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años e inicio su compra y venta de garrafas de gas y golosinas con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital de trabajo en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar un mayor capital de trabajo, ya que con ello comprara 20 garrafas y varias cajas de golosinas (sublime, galletas, yogures, etc.) y se compromete cumplir con sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the communal bank called El Comercio, in the district of Desaguadero in Puno. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She was able to complete some of her higher education. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years now, starting with the purchase and sale of sweets and beverages with her initial loan. Celia needs a new loan to invest in her business and purchase crates of sodas, and cases of sweets and snacks including crackers, yogurt, etc. She is able to comply with her loan repayments according the rules of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell, including crates of sodas, and cases of crackers, sweets and yogurt

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William A.-Ansah is 49 years old. He is married and has to six children, - three males and three females who are all currently in junior high and primary school. His wife works with him. William lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. 
William owns a palm plantation. He does not sell the raw harvested palm fruits but adds value to it by producing palm oil. However, he procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production. He distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce in bulk and distribute to his increasing number of customers. He aspires to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Burlacu

texts.en:
Burlacu Z.’s business is family one. Together with her husband she is involved in raising pigs, sheep and cattle, as well as the manufacturing and marketing of meat and dairy products.

The loan requested will be directed toward buying 10 sheep and eight pigs. Zinaida already has 10 sheep and wants to increase their number up to 20 head. They have 3 hectares of agricultural land that is cultivated with lucerne (a crop in the legume family often used for fodder), barley and maize. During winter, feed is purchased, but in summer the animals graze the field.

In the future, Z.'s plan is to increase the number of heads and production output and to improve profit.

loans.use: Buying 10 sheep and eight pigs

loans.name: Graciela Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Graciela G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y esta al cuidado de 05 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas materiales para sus tejidos al por mayor (lanas de diferentes tonalidades), con ello podrá tejer chompas, chullos y otros que entrega a los intermediarios en la Feria Juliaca, su anhelo es formar una asociación de artesanas para poder vender sus productos de manera directa y sin intermediarios a los mercados de la región y poder exportar sus productos, asimismo quiere educar a sus hijos y verlos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the communal bank called Flor Andina in the district of Plateria, Puno province. She is 41 years old and widowed. Graciela takes care of 5 children. She was able to complete her secondary education, and has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She works in handicrafts, (knitting). With her first loan, she purchased wool for her handicrafts. Today she needs an additional loan, which she will repay in 4 payments. She will use the money to invest in materials needed to make her blankets, ponchos and other hand knit goods which she sells through vendors at the fair in Juliaca. Her goal is to form an artists association where they can sell their goods directly, without intermediaries, in the regional markets and for export as well. She also wants to be able to provide an education for her children so they can have good professions in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make her hand knit goods

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Doña Petronila tiene 63 años de edad, con cuatro hijos mayores de edad reside en el barrio laureles norte, su oficio es lavar y planchar ropa ajena lo cual hace desde hace diez años para poder cubrir sus necesidades, sus hijos le ayudan con sus gasto. Sus planes es poder mejorar su vivienda ya que su piso es de tierra y no tiene división de cuarto y también hay que repellar las paredes, su casa es muy sencilla pero se siente contenta de tener donde vivir ya que muchos nicaragüenses no tiene un techo. Doy gracias a Afodenic por poder ayudarme a hacer las mejoras a mi casa y poder gozar de un techo digno.
texts.en:
Petronila is 63 years old, has four grown children, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. Her business involves laundering and ironing people’s clothes, an activity she has carried out for ten years in order to cover her needs; her children help with her expenses. Her plan is to be able to make some improvements to her home, as she currently has a dirt floor and no wall to separate the bedroom. She also needs to plaster the walls. Her home is very simple, but she is grateful to have a roof over her head as many Nicaraguans do not. I give thanks to Afodenic for helping me to make some improvements to my home and be able to enjoy a dignified dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a wall to separate a bedroom and also to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Candelaria Marina

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Marina G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio M.,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas fibra de alpaca al por mayor y poder hilarlo para elaborar sus tejidos tales como chompas, guantes, chullos, etc. es decir todo lo que le pidan sus clientes; su deseo es comprarse un carrito para transportar sus tejidos a las diferentes ferias de la región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria Marina G. M. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Flor Andina" in the M. neighborhood, Plateria district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, single and has no children. She completed middle school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuel Ramos for the past two years. She is an artisan knitter and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to purchase wool for her knits. She now needs a loan of 1000 new soles which she will pay back in four payments. These funds will be used to acquire additional alpaca fiber at wholesale which she will spin into yarn in order to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc., in other words, whatever her customers require. Her wish is to purchase a small cart to transport her knits to the various regional fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca fiber to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc.

loans.name: Buye Rose Group

texts.en:
Buye R. is twenty-nine years old and is married with four children. She lives with her family in a two-room house. She has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expense is tuition fees for her children.

She has a retail shop where she sells general merchandise to about thirty-five customers a day. She has been in this business for five years now, and the main challenge she faces is paying the delivery expenses on the goods she purchases.

She has been with MCDT for four years now and she has had ten loans so far. She has worked with her group for two years and she will use this loan to increase her stock and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Julio Del Carmen

texts.es: Don julio tiene la edad de 71 años de edad, reside en el barrio laureles norte sus hijos son mayores de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, el oficio de don Julio es de albañil, que desde muy joven ejerció este oficio. Da gracias a su papa que le enseño las técnicas para ejercer este trabajo. Este es su octavo ciclo y ha sido de mucho beneficios para su familia. Con este crédito va invertir en infraestructura  para terminar de hacer su casa ya que desea hacer las paredes de concreto por que son de tabla que están en mal estado, lo cual espera poder tener el privilegio de tener una casa bonita y segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio is 71 years old and a resident of the North Laureles town. His son are grown-ups and his wife takes care of the house. He has worked as a bricklayer ever since he was young man. He is thankful his father taught him the skills necessary to perform this line of work. This is his eighth loan cycle and his family has greatly benefited from this partnership. He will apply the funds from this loan to complete building his home -- he wishes to replace his home's decaying wooden walls with concrete structures. By doing so, he will have the privilege to own a beautiful and safe home.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build his home's concrete walls.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick E. sells drinks and provisions. He is thirty-five years old and is married with three children. He needs a loan of $675 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.en:
Anzhelika is married with a grown daughter. She lives and works in Belaya Tserkov. Her business is located in the central city market in a covered pavilion. Anzhelika sells men’s sportswear. She is very hard-working. Her consistency in business has ensured the stability of her trade which has existed for twenty years. Currently, Anzhelika has $6500 invested in this business. Her average monthly income is about $1560. 

Anzhelika is applying for the loan of $650 to stock spring inventory. She prefers selling this type of inventory because she feels more comfortable working with male customers. Anzhelika is very sociable. Moreover, she is very industrious and works even on those days that don’t seem to be very good for trading. Anzhelika is hoping to generate additional income and make some savings to pay her daughter’s college fees.

loans.use: To stock spring inventory

loans.name: Gorenco

texts.en: Gorenco runs a restaurant. Some of the food scraps from the restaurant are used to feed pigs. Last year she raised two feeder pigs for sale. Now she wants to buy ten feeder pigs, and will sell them in a meat supply business. Her future plan is to increase the number of pigs and earn more profit in both businesses.

loans.use: increase the number of pigs

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
La señora Mari, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en la Av. La Paz – Las Malvinas, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con S/.300.00 por iniciativa propia, empezó su negocio vendiendo sabanas, cortinas. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la costura, y realiza diferentes modelos en costura como calzones, pijamas, carteras; y prendas de niños, cuenta con una maquina que es su herramienta principal de trabajo, también vende y ofrece productos de belleza.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06  meses, lo invirtió comprando telas en metros, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad de variados colores y tener una mayor producción de lencería para damas. 

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Mari, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mari belongs to the Banco Comunal "Los Claveles", lives at La Paz avenue, Las Malvinas, Picota District, San Martin Department. She is 45 years old, has a live-in partner and is the mother of two children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She started a business selling sheets and drapery with 300 soles of her own money. She has been working with the Banco for 8 years. Currently she sews and her area of emphasis is underwear, pajamas, purses and children's wear. She owns a sewing machine which is her main work equipment. She also sells beauty supplies. With the loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she purchased at wholesale fabric, threads, elastics and decorations of various colors to increase her production of women's lingerie. She is more confident now than at the beginning of offering her products and at the same time more constant and responsible in the repayment of her loan. Mari would like to thank Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, elastics and docorations at wholesale for lingerie produccion.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan sells provisions and foodstuffs. He is also a commercial motor cyclist. He is thirty-eight years old and married with five children. He needs a loan of $675 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nils

texts.es:
La señora Nils I. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 307, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia, quien decidió emprender su pequeño negocio, vendiendo abarrotes. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, en un local especialmente acondicionado en su propia casa. 

Con el prestamo de S/1,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, asimismo ahora que estamos en campaña escolar comprara  útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas para mantener surtido su negocio y contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Nils, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nils I. R. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Picota". She resides at Mr. San Martin #307, Picota District, San Martin Department. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom still depends on her. She started with 300 soles and by her own initiative began her small business selling groceries. Today she sells groceries from a specially designed area of her home. The loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, will be used to buy more wholesale products, such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, canned fish, personal hygiene items, home cleaning supplies and, now that the school year is beginning, school supplies such as pencils, pens, markers, erasers, paper, etc. to stock her store and keep her clientele happy. She is solely responsible for all business decisions with respect to the store's profits. Personally, she states that she is more sociable, more sure of herself, and more responsible with regard to repayment of her loan. Nils is thankful to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products (rice, milk, sugar, toilet paper, canned goods).  To purchase personal hygiene articles and school supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married. She runs a business selling farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and agricultural chemicals, in one of the local markets of Kamenka. Valentina owns a small store in a good location at the marketplace. She is an experienced vendor, keeps track of all innovations and makes good offers to customers.

Valentina has been in this business for 10 years. Her children help her with the trade. Currently, she has about 50,000 Grivnas invested in inventory. Her working capital is about 20,000 Grivnas. Monthly profit varies from 3,000 to 5,000 Grivnas.

Valentina knows from previous years that each spring, demand for farm supplies and fertilizers increases, which induces her to purchase additional inventory for further retail sale. This time Valentina is requesting a 5,000 Grivna loan for that purpose. One of her long-term goals is to open an identical farm-supply store in the town of Velikaya Znamenka.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Dick

texts.en: P. Dick is 44 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader. He sells building materials. He needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is an entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. She sells clothing items in the central city market and travels to remote villages to sell her inventory there. She has her loyal clientele and always offers a wide assortment of merchandise for sale. Lesya has been in business for 13 years. Presently, her turnover capital amounts to 49,000 Grivnas. Her profit is about 5,000 Grivnas.

Lesya is a widow. She is raising her child herself. She has proved to be very responsible as an entrepreneur and mother always trying to provide the very best for her only child. This time Lesya is requesting a loan of 11,300 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory before the spring season. We believe this current loan will assist in the stable expansion of Lesya’s business and will help guarantee her economic independence which has always been her ultimate goal as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory before the spring season

loans.name: Amadith

texts.es:
La señora Amadith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Av. Las Paz – Las Malvinas S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Se inicio, con S/. 300.00 y fue motivada por su esposo, para emprender su negocio y empezó con un taller mecánico, en su propia casa; donde ella atendía a los clientes.

En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de Repuestos asociados en un negocio familiar juntamente con su esposo e hijo mayor, su negocio se ubica en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, siendo sus principales clientes los conductores de carros, moto taxis, moto lineales  y ciclistas de la localidad y pueblos cercanos.

Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 a plazo de 06  meses, comprara más repuestos como focos y faros  de luz y  tubos de escape para diversos tipos de movilidad, barras telescópicas para motos, llantas.  

Ella, su esposo y su hijo  toman las decisiones en la compras y  ganancias de su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Amadith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Amadith belongs to the “Picota” Community Bank in the San Martín region of Peru. She is 48-years-old, lives with her husband and has two grown-up children.

With 300 soles and her husband’s encouragement, she started her own mechanics shop and served customers in her home.

She currently runs a family business together with her husband and eldest son, selling spare auto parts from a specially converted space in her home. Her principal customers are car, mototaxi and motorcycle drivers, and cyclists from her town and neighbouring areas.

With this loan of 2500 soles to be repaid in six months, she will purchase more spare parts including headlights and exhaust pipes for a variety of vehicles, telescopic rods for motorcycles, and tires.

Amadith makes all business decisions with her husband and son, and feels more confident in the products she sells. She considers herself a spirited woman, reliable and responsible with her repayments.

Amadith is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow not only as an entrepreneur but also as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare auto parts such as headlights and exhaust pipes for a variety of vehicles.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas I. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks.  Dorcas lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Ricardo de Jesús R. Hernández tiene la edad de 47 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja en el hospital México nicaragüense del Municipio  , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están casado y uno de 17 años tiene a su cargo , el joven estudia y le apoya con la agricultura , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo y sea un hombre de buenas costumbres , don Ricardo desde hace treinta años se dedica a la actividad agrícola , el mayor problema que ha surgido durante este tiempo es la falta de financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, con este crédito es para comprar los fertilizantes necesario que requiera el cultivo para obtener una buena producción, que será de mucho beneficios para su vida personal como en el comercio.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo de Jesus H. is 47 years old and a resident of the Reparto Juan Padilla located in the town of Ticuantepe. His wife, with whom he has three sons -- two of them are married and a 17-year-old that lives with them, works at the city's Mexico-Nicaraguan Hospital to help cover living expenses. Their youngest son goes to school and works with agriculture as well. His plans for his family include improving their living standards in order to provide a better future for his son and to help him grow to be a respectable man. Mr. Ricardo has worked with agriculture for thirty years and the biggest obstacles that have risen throughout the years have been the absence of financial support to purchase supplies and fertilizers. This credit line would be used to purchase the fertilizers needed to promote agriculture growth and a satisfactory production which will be beneficial to his personal life and the industry altogether.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to increase production.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. sells provisions and drinks in Oliha Quarters in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora Anita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Av. Fernando B. Terry 3 Cdra., Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 50 años y es madre 7 hijos, 2 que todavía dependen de ella.

Se inicio con  S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, empezó con la venta de comida, atendiendo en su misma casa. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio de venta de comida en su restaurant y en las noches vende pollos a la brasa, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.

Con el último préstamo de S/1,200.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; pollos desviscerados, papas, salsa de tomates, mostaza, todo esto para la venta de pollos a la brasa por las noches y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para implementar su negocio. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Anita, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Anita belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Av. Fernando B, Terry 3 block, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 50 years old, and a mother of 7 children, 2 of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she started selling foods made out of her home. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Currently, she continues with the same business of food sales from her restaurant and she sells grilled chickens at night. Her main customers are people from her community, neighbors, and friends. With this loan of S/ 1,200, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she would like to invest in the purchase of daily food prepartion items such as rice, sugar, chicken, potatoes, tomatoes, mustard, and everything that she needs to sell grilled chicken at night which includes tables, chairs, glasses, and pans in order to establish the business. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Today she feels like an independent woman, more responsible with her monthly payments. Anita would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase preparation items for the sale of food.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with one child. Her family lives in Ordzhonikidze. Nina runs a small business in the central city market selling clothing. Her vending spot is well-known for the wide variety of her inventory. Assorted trendy clothing items Nina offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Nina has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, she has about 39,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 3,200 Grivnas.

Nina’s hard work – plain and simple – is the engine that drives her success. She is very consistent in her business planning. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase assorted merchandise in a recently opened vending location and expand her trade. One of Nina’s long-term plans is to launch her own start-up manufacturing and selling clothing and increase her stock turnover as a result.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and married with children. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, etc. She needs the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 8 años vende golosinas en un triciclo que ella misma ha ubicado cerca de 2 centros educativos, también ofrece frutas, refrescos y gaseosas, sus principales consumidores son los niños que salen de las escuelas, por lo que tiene mayores ventas durante el año escolar; mientras que en vacaciones opta por desarrollar otras actividades que le generen fuentes de ingreso económico. Adela trabaja todo el día para garantizar sus ganancias diarias, para el futuro desea tener un local estable en una zona comercial, donde no solo venda golosinas, sino también abarrotes y otros productos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, para ella es una nueva experiencia trabajar con un banco comunal, y lo mejor es que lo hace con personas que considera confiables para un trabajo solidario. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de cajas de gaseosa y galletas, entre otras golosinas para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and her youngest son in the home that they own. For 8 years she has been selling sweets on a tricycle that she has placed between two education centers. She also offers fruit, soft drinks and fizzy drinks. Her main clients are the kids when they come out of school, so she has better sales during the school year; in the school holidays she decides to develop other activities that also act as sources of financial income. Adela works all day to guaruntee her daily earnings and in the future she wishes to have a stable store in a commercial zone where she would not only sell sweets, but groceries and other products too. This is her first loan with MFP and for her it is a new experience to work with a communal bank. The best part of it is that she does it with people she considers trustworthy to work with in solidarity. The money she is asking for will be invested in buying boxes of fizzy drinks and biscuits in bulk, as well as other sweets to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To  increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Basita

texts.es:
La señora Basita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. Grau Cdra. 04, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos, uno que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia, quien decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo refrigerios y anticuchos en un kiosco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cosméticos, cuenta con un local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa.

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, y también útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy luchadora y constante en sus metas que desea lograr y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Dany, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Basita belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Jr. Grau block 4, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 37 years old, and a mother of 2 children, one of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she decided to start her own business selling sandwiches and meat skewers at a stand. Currently, she sells groceries and cosmetics, specialized according to her area because she sells them from her home. With a loan of S/ 3,000, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she will invest in more products to grow her business such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, fish preservatives, personal hygiene products, and cleaning products. Also, she would like to sell pens, pencils, erasers, and flashcards in order to keep her customers happy. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Personally, she is a woman who is a fighter works to accomplish her goals, and is responsible with her monthly payments. She would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, groceries, personal hygiene products, and tools to grow her business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 48 años, vive con sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace dos años vende comida por las mañanas repartiendo menús y por las tardes comida al paso en una esquina en la calle con su pequeña parrilla. Cada día satisface a sus clientes con su buena sazón, y esta actividad le permite tener las ganancias para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Para Alicia esta actividad es rentable porque la comida satisface una necesidad vital de todos, por ello es que no tiene pierde en sus ventas, además cocinar es un deleite y su mejor distracción por lo que no lo considera un trabajo pesado. Alicia tiene planes para el futuro, uno de ellos el tener un gran restaurante de comidas típicas en el centro de su ciudad. Es la primera que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha empezado a trabajar para que su banco comunal crezca en bienestar de todos sus integrantes. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abarrotes al por mayor, sacos de arroz, azúcar y aceite por bidones para aminorar sus costos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old and she lives with her kids in the house she owns. For two years she has been selling food - in the mornings giving out lunches and in the afternoon snack food - from a street corner with her small grill. Each day she satisfies her clients with her good seasoning, and this activity allows her to earn enough to maintain her home. For Alicia this activity is profitable because food satisfies a vital necessity that everyone has, and this is why she never misses out on sales. Cooking is also a delight for her and the best distraction so as not to consider it as it is hard work. Alicia has plans for the future and one of those is to have a big restaurant serving typical foods in the center of the city. It is her first loan with MFP and she started to work so that her communal bank would grow with the well-being of all its members. With the money she has asked for she will buy groceries in bulk, sacks of rice, sugar and drums of oil to reduce her costs and obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for the preparation of her dishes/Compra de víveres para la preparación de sus platos

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 23 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a vender productos y artículos diversos para el hogar, como cobertores de cama, utensilios de cocina, etc., a pedido, realiza este negocio desde hace un año. Empezó a vender en pequeñas cantidades, y ahora por su insistencia y esfuerzo han aumentado sus ventas. Recorre casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos, de esa manera deja su mercadería para cobrar día por día y con ello obtener mejores ganancias que le sirven para los gastos familiares. Andrea disfruta mucho de su trabajo, pero lo dificultoso es que es muy cansado caminar largos tramos diariamente, además de los riesgos que hay en las calles, es por ello que está planificando, para el futuro, establecerse en un local comercial. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que va a realizar en el banco comunal que integra. Con la cantidad solicitada comprará de más ollas y frazadas al por mayor para aprovechar esta nueva campaña de ventas.
texts.en:
Andrea is 23 years old and she lives with her son in her parents' house. She sells different products and articles for the home, like bed covers, cooking utensils, etc. She does this based on orders and has been doing this for a year. She started to sell things in small amounts, and now, because of her insistance and effort, her sales have risen. She goes from house to house to offer her products and in this way leaves her merchandise in order to charge day by day and therefore obtain higher earnings that will cover her families' outgoings. Andrea really enjoys her work, but the difficult thing about it is that it is very tiring walking for long streches each day, as well as the dangers that exist in the streets. It is for these reasons that in the future she plans to establish herself in a commercial store. It is her first loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic about the work she is going to carry out with the communal bank that she is a part of. With the solicited amount she will buy more saucepans and blankets in bulk to take advantage of this new sales campaign.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El señor José Dolores Z. tiene la edad de 52 años habita en el barrio Medardo Andino ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja en el Alcaldía del municipio de Ticuantepe , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , un joven de 23 años que estudia en la universidad , otro joven de 18 que estudia cuarto año de secundaria y un pequeño de 9 que estudia su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones ya que con mucho esfuerzo de ellos le ha dado estudio , don José desde hace cuatro años trabaja como albañil y por problemas económicos no ha logrado terminar de construir de su vivienda lo cual busco apoyo en nuestra institución para un financiamiento y poder cumplir sus sueños de ver terminada su casa . El financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mr. José Dolores Z. is 52 years old and lives in the town of Medardo Andino, located in the city of Ticuantepe. His wife works in the city hall of the city of Ticuantepe in order to help with their living expenses. They have three sons: a 23-year-old who is attending college, an 18-year-old that is on the last year of high school and a 9-year-old who is in elementary school. Plans for his family now include improving their living standards because, with great effort, he has already been able to provide their sons with an education path. Mr Jose has been working as a construction worker for the past four years; however, due to financial difficulties, he has not completely built his home. He has approached our financial institution so that he will have the means to fulfill his dream of finish up his house's construction. This loan will be applied to purchase construction materials to build his home.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed I. is thirty-one years old. He is married and has two children, both males. The first is in primary school while the second has yet to start school. His wife is into the palm oil production business. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Mohammed is a farmer and trades as well. He says he trades in cola nuts. He procures cola nuts from cola nut farmers in the northern part of the country and treks to other towns to sell them. He distributes to customers who retail them. Mohammed wants a loan to procure the cola in large quantities so that he can distribute them to the increasing number of his customers. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure cola nuts

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Diana Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Urb. Las Almendras S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 5 hijos, 4 que todavía dependen de ella

Se inició, con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, empezó vendiendo anticuchos, juanes, maduros y plátanos asados. Tiene más de 1 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos, ubicada afuera de su casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, vecinos, amigos y moradores de la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelará a plazo de 6 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la prepación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites, servilletas; como también implementando su negocio, comprando mas mesas, sillas, platos, vasos y vajillas así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones.

Diana Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Diana Maria belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Urb. Las Almendras S/N, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 45 years old, and a mother of 5 children, 4 of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she started selling meat skewers, a rice dish, fruit, and grilled bananas. She has been workign with the bank for more than a year. Currently, she continues with this same business that is located outside of her home where she serves her customers, neighbors, friends, and others from the community. With this loan of S/ 800, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she would like to invest in the food preparation items such as rice, sugar, oils, and napkins. She would also like to buy tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups to establish her business and make her customers more comfortable. Personally, she feels more independent and responsible with her monthly payments and she knows how to make her own decisions. Diana Maria would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oils, napkins, tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 30 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y sus hermanos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año brinda el servicio de cabinas públicas de Internet y llamadas telefónicas, empezó con pocas computadoras y poco a poco fue implemento el servicio de locutorio, aumentaron sus máquinas y ahora brinda este servicio todos los días de la semana durante todo el día. Por las tardes es donde tiene más clientes y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que después de sus estudios disponen de un tiempo para la atención. Para Carmen este negocio le permite estar al pendiente de sus hijos y generarse sus propios ingresos económicos. Entre sus planes de desarrollo a futuro está el de implementar mejor su negocio, aumentando la capacidad de memoria de sus computadoras y mejorar sus cabinas (módulos para cada computadora). Es la primera vez que Carmen está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además de estar siempre presente en las reuniones de su banco comunal. La cantidad requerida servirá para implementar su establecimiento con video juegos, para lo cual comprará dos equipos de play station.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old and lives with her 2 kids and siblings in their parents' house. For one year she has been offering an internet and telephone service from public booths. She started with a few computers and bit by bit she installed the phone service and increased the amount of machines she had and now she offers this service every day of the week all day long. She gets most clients in the afternoons and she counts on her kids' support - that they will help out after school. For Carmen this business allows her to watch over her kids and generate her own financial income. Among her plans for future developments she would like to stock her business better, increasing the computers' memory capacity and improving the booths (units for each computer). It is the first time that Carmen had asked for a loan with MFP and she commits to being punctual in her payments as well as always going to the communal bank's meetings. The required amount will serve to stock her establishment with video games, for which she will buy two playstations.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy games consoles/Compra de equipos para video juegos

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Greetings from Daphrose M. in Gasabo District, Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. Daphrose is 53 years old, married with 4 children.

This entrepreneur invests her money in buying second-hand stuff such as used small and big cans, used crates and bottles. She collects them and re-sells them in large quantity at good prices, earning approximately 30,000 Rwf per month after paying her 3 employees and other expenses. Daphrose has been working at this business for 2 years; she works every day from 7:30am to 5:30pm. She hopes to expand her business and be able to pay school fees for her children.

Daphrose is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf from VISION FINANCE COMPANY S.A., which will be repaid over 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La señora Dolly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Av. Fernando B. Terry S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 que fue motivada por su esposo, para emprender su negocio, de venta de  anticuchos y juanes. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas en paquetes de todos los sabores, marcas y tamaños, aguas minerales; y los vende a sus clientes, amigos y vecinos, en su casa propia.

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que pagará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más gaseosas en paquetes y aguas minerales, para ser vendidas por paquetes y/o unidades.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Dolly, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Dolly belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Av. Fernando B. Terry S/N, Picota district, San Martin state. She is married, 37 years old, and a mother of 3 children, all of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300 that she obtained through the motivation of her husband, she started selling sandwiches and rice dishes. Currently, she sells sodas, mostly through multi-flavored packs of different brands and sizes, and mineral water. She sells to her friends and neighbors out of her home. With this loan of S/ 1,500, to be paid in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of sodas, which she will then sell individually. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for the business. She feels more sociable, secure, and responsible with her monthly financial obligations. Dolly expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas by the bulk intended for resale

loans.name: Amankwaah

texts.en:
Amankwaah B. is forty-one years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. Two of his children are already in school – junior high and primary school. The last however, has yet to start. His wife is a seamstress by profession.

Amankwaah lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Amankwaah owns a cocoa, palm nut, and orange plantation. He does not sell the harvested palm fruits in the raw state but adds value by producing palm oil. He also procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production.

Amankwaah distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of his customers. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells hair extensions and foodstuffs. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia has a store where she sells medicine to people in her community. She also sells provisions. Cecilia is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan amount of N90,000 to purchase more provisions and medicine to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions  to sell

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy tiene 26 años, vive con su hermana mayor en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año trabaja en su propio negocio de venta de comida en un centro comercial de maderas, sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de este establecimiento. El trabajo de Deisy consiste en preparar desde muy temprano los alimentos que ha de vender durante el día.
