Ella se proyecta para el futuro, es por ello que desea tener un local propio, porque el que utiliza ahora es arrendado y ahora trabaja duro para poder adquirir su propio local. Es la segunda vez que Deisy tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una integrante muy responsable en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, con otra parte invertirá en la compra de tarjetas de telefonía, ya que notó recientemente la demanda de éstas, entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Deisy is 26 years old and she lives with her older sister in a rented house. For a year she has been working on her own business selling food in a specialst wood shopping center, and her main clients are the people that work there. Deisy's work consists of preparing the food that she must sell that day very early. She propells herself forward and this is why she would like to have her own store, as the one she uses now is rented and she is currently working very hard to be able to acquire her own store. It is the second time that Deisy will have had a loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated her punctuality with her payments, and for this reason she is considered to be a very responsible member of her communal bank. The money she has asked for will be invested in buying sacks of rice and sugar, and it will also be invested in buying phone cards as she has noticed the demand for these amongst her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food/Compra ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Sérénité Group

texts.en:
Marie N. has been in business since 1982 and has been a faithful client with Hope DRCongo since June 2008. She sells soft drinks and loaves of bread.

Marie started her business with US$ 82 in capital, selling women’s clothing and jewelry. From 1982 to 1990, her working capital increased to US$ 140 which allowed her to open a general boutique in 1990. From 1990 to 1996, her business decreased considerably because of the political and economic instability of the country.

Marie decided to close the boutique and sold sacks of charcoal from 2001 to 2005. In 2005, she hired someone to manage her business, as she was taking care of her daughter who was very sick. After her daughter passed away, her goods and money were also robbed. She closed her business for two years. She re-launched it in 2006, purchasing and selling charcoal in sacks.

In 2008, she joined one of Hope’s groups named “Sérénité”. By increasing her inventory, Marie will be able to increase sales and generate additional profits that will allow her business to grow. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of seven children, aged between 23 and 38, of whom three are students in college and four are independent. Her business makes about US$ 13 per week. Her vision is to open a beverage store and a beauty shop.

loans.use: To increase working capital to buy additional goods

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana D. is forty-three years old. She is widowed and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. According to her, she has been a widow for five years. She says her son is currently in the university while her daughter is learning a trade. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Juliana, like most of the women in her community, is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Juliana is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Chérubins Plus Group

texts.en:
Modeste M. produces and sells soap made from palm oil. He makes about US$ 20 in profit per week. He started doing business by selling prepaid cell phone minutes in 2005 with a working capital of US$ 200. From 2005 to 2007, he diversified his business by adding women’s clothing. He started selling in Mbuji-Mayi which is in central DRCongo.

Modest's business prospered, increasing his working capital to US$ 1500. In 2007, thieves broke into his shop and took of all his goods and the working capital. He closed the business and moved to Kinshasa.

From 2008 to the present he has sold cell phone minutes and soap made from palm oil with a capital of US$ 150. His vision is to open a small factory to produce soap to meet people’s need in his area.

Modeste is 53 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 12 and 30. Six of them are students and one is independent.

loans.use: To increase working capital to purchase tools and equipment to produce soaps

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji I. is seventy years old. He is married and has three children, two males and a female. According to him, all his children are married and living independently with their spouses. His wife is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in their community in the mornings.

Alhaji I. lives with his wife in a house built by his own toil in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Alhaji runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, "milo" (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is by the roadside in his community. Alhaji has been in business for over fifteen years and is well experienced. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his grandchildren the needed support that he can give them.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Glinda

texts.es:
La señora Glinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 529, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre 4 hijos, todos independientes.

Se inició en su primer negocio con S/. 50.00 motivada por su pareja, empezó vendiendo jugos refrigerios en el Mercado Central D. la ciudad. Tiene 09 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y en el mismo lugar, donD. venD. y atienD. por las mañanas a los moradores D. la comunidad.

Con el préstamo D. S/1,000.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06 meses, desea invertirlo, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprando banquitas, platos y vasos, e insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus jugos y refrigerios como frutas, azúcar, huevos, pollo y panes. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Glinda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Glinda belongs to the community bank "Los Claveles" and lives at Jr. Arica N 529, Tarapoto district, San Martin state. She is married, 51 years old, and a mother of 4 children, all of whom support themselves. With an initial loan of S/ 50 that she obtained through the motivation of her husband, she started selling juices and snacks at the city's central market. She has been working with the bank for 9 years. Currently, she continues with this business in the same place, where she sells to her customers in the mornings. With this loan of S/ 1,000, to be paid in 6 monthly payments, she would like to invest in the growth of her business by purchasing benches, plates, and glasses, as well as other items for the daily preparation of her products including fruits, sugar, eggs, chicken, and breads. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Today she feels like an independent woman who is responsible with her monthly financial obligations. Glinda expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest and grow her business by purchasing benches, plates, glasses, and other items for her food stand including fruits, sugar, eggs, chicken, and breads

loans.name: Daniel Plus Group

texts.en:
Deis K. is 32 years old, single, and has two children, 7 and 9, who go to school. He sells soft drinks. He began business in 1996 selling pork in KisaN. in Eastern DRCongo. From 1996 to 1997, with US$ 1700 he had as working capital, he started mining in KisaN.. His business fell down due to the war in Eastern DRCongo.

Deis decided to move to Kinshasa where he started a new business in 2003, selling beverages with a beginning capital of US$ 200. His business now makes a profit of US$ 35 per week. He joined one of Hope’s groups in December 2008. Deis works very hard and with determination to achieve his dream. He wants to purchase a small bus for transportation in his area. His business is located in the eastern part of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To add crates of soft drinks to meet his customers needs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Helvia

texts.es: Helvia vive con sus dos hijos en su propia casa donde tiene una tienda desde hace 8 meses, notó que este negocio era una gran oportunidad porque su casa está ubicada en una zona céntrica y transitada. Desde entonces ha empezado a ver el fruto de su trabajo, ella y sus hijos se encargan de atender a los clientes que acuden a adquirir los alimentos que ella expende, de preferencia atiende en las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a las tareas domésticas. Con este negocio Helvia se siente muy satisfecha y en crecimiento constante personal, ya que es independiente y ahora se ha proyectado a seguir adelante con su negocio hasta ser una distribuidora de comestibles al por mayor. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal que ahora integra porque notaron en ella a una mujer de gran fortaleza, responsable  y comprometida, por su parte, Helvia asume el compromiso de aportar positivamente en el desarrollo de su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de sacos de menestras, arroz y azúcar, que son los productos de mayor demanda en su tienda, cada saco de 50 kilos cuesta en promedio 70 soles. Se abastecerá con una cantidad considerable para evitar perdidas por la inestabilidad de los precios.
texts.en:
Helvia lives with her two kids in the house that she owns. It is also here where she has had a shop for 8 months, as she noticed that this business would be a great opportunity as her house is located in a central and busy zone. Since then she has started to see the fruit of her labours. Her kids and her are in charge of attending to the clients that come in to buy the foods that she sells, and out of preference she serves them in the morning and dedicates herself to domestic chores in the afternoons. Helvia is very satisfied with this business as well as constantly growing personally as she is independent and has now decided to keep moving forward with her business until she becomes a vendor of foodstuffs by bulk. It is her first loan with MFP and she was invited to join the communal bank of which she is now a member of because they saw in her a strong, responsible and committed woman. For her part Helvia assumes the committment of playing a postive role in the development of the group. The money she has asked for is to invest in buying sacks of vegetable stew, rice and sugar, which are the most in-demand products in her store, and each sack of 50 kilos costs on average 70 soles. She will stock quite a large amount to avoid losses and price fluctuation.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward N. is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. According to him, all his daughters are in basic school while his son has yet to start to school. His wife is takes care of his provision store. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Edward is a barber by profession and at the same time runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, "milo" (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is by the roadside in his community. Edward has been in business for five years. He says a severe rain storm brought down his barber shop. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is a doctor. Her main activity has been the provision of medical services for more than 15 years. Elena works in the hospital district and in the afternoon hours she works at home. She has a room that needs repair, according to sanitary requirements.

Elena is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment. She serves 10-12 clients daily. Elena has a profitable business because she does not spend much, only for water and electricity.

loans.use: purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Lucila Flora

texts.es:
La señora Lucila Flora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. Carretera Marginal Fernando B. Terry, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre de 2 hijos, los 2  todavía depende de ella. 

Se inició, con S/. 2,000.00 producto del ahorro familiar quienes la motivaron a iniciar su negocio de carpintería. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, en un local especialmente acondicionado en su propia casa, donde se encuentran todas  sus herramientas y materiales de trabajo.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que pagará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando madera en cuartones, pegamentos, y mandara a confeccionar un letrero grande, para que los clientes lo vean y así tener mas acogida y hacer sus promociones, ya que los muebles que realizan son a pedidos del cliente y también para instituciones la calidad de sus trabajos hace que tenga mucha clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio y su esposo es quien se encarga de verificar la  concesión. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy solidaria, y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Lucila Flora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila Flora belongs to the "Picota" Communal Bank and lives in the area of the Fernando B. Terry road in the Picota District of the Department of San Martin. She is married, is 54 years old, and is mother to two children who still are dependant on her. She started with S/. 2,000.00 [USD $650] in savings from her family who motivated her to start her carpentry business. She continues in this same business out of a shop in her house that she has renovated for this use, and which has all her tools and materials. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 [USD $650] which she will re-pay in six months, she will invest in the shop by buying lumber and glues. She will also make up a large sign for her shop, both so that her clients will see it as a genuine business, and to market her business. Because the furniture is built on order and also for institutions, the quality of her work results in a large clientele. She makes the decisions about the business earnings and her husband is in charge of verifying the operations. On a personal level, she tells us she is a very supportive woman, and responsible with her payments. Lucila Flora expresses her appreciation towards Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of woods, glues, and to make a large business sign

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three boys and a girl. She says her daughter has completed junior high school and has yet to continue. One of her sons is in primary school while the other two, a set of twins, have yet to start school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a pastor of one of the local churches in their community.

Doris is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Doris is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: E l señor Eliseo C. tiene la edad de 50 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa, ella es ama de casa; ellos tiene cuatro hijos, pero a su cargo tienen tres. El varón de 22 años que  le apoya en el taller de mecánica, la joven de 18 años es estudiante de secundaria al igual que el joven de 13 estudia actualmente y una de 20 años que es casada. Don Eliseo desde hace veinte años trabaja en la agricultura el rubro mas fuerte es el plátano y la piña, el inicio a trabajar las tierras ya que el compro un terreno y con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su familia han logrado establecer una manzana de piña y una manzana de plátano los cuales necesitan manteniendo y no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos. Se siente contento por que tiene la mano amiga de Afodenic que a través de sus prestamos logra tener una producción mejor que es de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Eliseo C. is 50 years old, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla area with his wife who is a homemaker. They have four children, three of whom are still under their care: a 22- year old son who helps in the mechanical workshop, an 18-year old daughter and 13-year old son who are in school, and a 20-year old daughter who is married. Eliseo has worked as a banana and pineapple farmer for the past twenty years. He started working on land that he purchased, and through his own efforts and that of his family, they have managed to establish a block of pineapple and a block of banana. These need maintenance, and he doesn’t have the resources necessary to purchase fertilizers and supplies. He feels content because he has the helping hand of Afodenic and, through its loans, he has managed to have a better crop production which is of great benefit to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase farming/agricultural supplies to improve his crop production.

loans.name: Sodjeji

texts.en:
Sodjeji A. is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has four children, all of whom are daughters. The first three of his daughters are already in school – junior high and primary schools. The last however, has yet to start. His wife is into palm oil production. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Sodjeji is a carpenter by profession and a trader as well. He trades in the palm oil the women produce in his community. What he does is to procure the palm oil in big gallons and trek to towns to sell. He distributes to customers who also retail and to food vendors. He wants a loan to procure palm oil in large quantities so that he can distribute to the increasing number of his customers. He has been in business for two years. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Luz Esperanza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Cdra. 06, Distrito D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años. 
Se inició, con S/. 100.00 y fue motivada por su esposo, para emprender su negocio, empezó vendiendo revistas, libros, bibliografías, historietas.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea Avon; y mercería, cuenta con un local  acondicionado en su propia casa, donD. ofrece sus productos en stock a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo D. S/1,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando sus productos como perfumes, colonias, talcos para cuerpo y pies; desodorantes y cremas  pedidos que los hace por catálogo para así poder ofrecerlos a sus clientes a precio mas cómodos que el D. la competencia,  también comprara útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores ahora que estamos en campaña escolar.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. 
 
Luz Esperanza, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Esperanza belongs to the "Picota" Communal Bank and lives at Block Nº 6, Jr. San Martin in the District of Picota in the Department of San Martín. She is married and is 45 years old. Motivated by her husband, she started her first business with S/. 100.00 [USD$33], selling newspapers, books, bibliographies and comic books. At present, she sells cosmetics from the Avon line of products; she has a shop in her own home where she offers her stocked products to local clients. With the loan of S/.1000.00 for which she will pay over a period of 6 months, she will invest in buying products like perfumes, colognes, body and foot powder, deodorants, and the creams that are ordered by catalogue. In this way she can offer her clients better prices than her competition. She will also buy school supplies such as books, pencils, erasers since the schools are now in session. She makes the earnings decisions in her business. On a personal level she feels more sociable, more sure and responsible with her loan payments. Luz Esperanza expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, talcs, deodorants, and creams.  Purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 40 años, vive con sus 3 menores hijos en la casa de su tía. Se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración de chocolates en molde con relleno de diversos confites que son una combinación deliciosa, ella misma los fabrica en una ardua labor que dura  casi toda la noche. Sale desde las 5 de la mañana a repartir lo que ha fabricado a las tiendas, bodegas, cafetines de escuelas, entre otros establecimientos; para ello camina casi todo el día con la satisfacción de que todo lo que produce es vendido y no le genera perdidas. Isabel está agradecida con la persona que le enseñó a realizar estos dulces que hoy le sirven para sustentar su hogar. Aunque es muy sacrificada su actividad, tiene mucha satisfacción de generarse estos ingresos y ser independiente económicamente, y debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Isabel está  planeando aumentar su producción. Es la primera vez que participa en un trabajo solidario, y está muy contenta en realizar una labor unida con su banco comunal. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de una máquina chocolatera valorizada en 1000 soles, con la cual podrá elaborar más dulces en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Isabel, 40, lives with her 3 minor children in the home of her aunt. For 2 years she has been creating molded chocolates filled with various sweet fillings, a delicious combination. She makes them herself, an arduous task that lasts almost all night. She goes out beginning at 5 in the morning to distribute what she has made to the shops, school cafeterias, and other establishments. She walks almost all day long, and has the satisfaction of knowing that everything she produces is sold, she does not suffer losses. Isabel is grateful to the person who taught her how to make these sweets that today support her household. Although she gives herself to her work, she gains much satisfaction in generating this income and in being economically independent. Thanks to the profitability of her business, Isabel is planning to increase her production. This is the first time that she has worked alone, and she is very happy to join together with her communal bank. This is her first loan through MFP. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of a chocolate-making machine worth 1000 soles, with which she will be able to create more sweets in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a chocolate-making machine

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, four boys and three girls. She says two of her children are in senior high school, two in apprenticeships, while the others are in junior high and basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is cocoa/palm nut farmer.

Juliana also produces palm oil to make some income to help her husband financially. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. Juliana distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also sells to food vendors and wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Juliana is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Ernestine in the Gasabo District of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. N. Ernestine is 46 years old and married with six children.

This entrepreneur holds a space in the Nyabugogo market, where she sells many kinds of clothes, especially bed covers, blankets and bed sheets. Ernestine has one full-time worker to help with running the business smoothly. She has been doing the same business for 26 years. This entrepreneur opens her business at 6 a.m. and closes at 5 p.m. and earns approximately 300,000Rwf per month (about $550).

Ernestine is expecting to expand her business and is requesting a loan worth 500,000Rwf from VISION FINANCE COMPANY s.a., Kiva's partner. This loan will be repaid over a term of eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elvira T. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en el Jr. Simón Bolívar Nº 612, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y es madre de  1 hijo, que todavía depende de ella.

Se inici{o en su primer negocio con S/. 300.00, motivada por su familia, empezó vendiendo útiles escolares en el Mercado. Tiene 1 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, donde vende a sus clientes fijos, transeúntes y moradores de la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, lo invirtió comprando insumos para la preparación de sándwich  como panes, pollo, mostaza, mayonesa; de jugos como  papayas, manzanas, piñas, bananas; azúcar y vainillas, también tiene proyectado ampliar   su negocio comprando mesas, sillas y otros.

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Maria Elvira, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elvira T. T. belongs to the "Los Claveles" Communal Bank and lives at Nº 612 Simón Bolívar street in the District of Picota in the Department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 35 years old and is mother to a son who is still dependant on her. Motivated by her family, she started her first business with S/. 300.00 [USD$100], selling school supplies in the market. She has been working with the communal bank for 1 year. She now earns a living selling refreshments which she sells to regular clients, passers-by, and residents of the community. With the loan of S/.800.00 for which she will pay over a period of 6 months, she will invest it by buying supplies for sandwich preparation such as bread, chicken, mustard, and mayonnaise, and will also juice ingredients such as papaya, apple, pineapple, banana, sugar and vanilla. As well, she plans to enlarge her business through buying tables, chairs and the like. She makes the earnings decisions in her business. Today she feels like an independent woman, and more responsible with her loan payments. Maria Elvira expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandwich ingredients such as breads, chickens, spices, and fruit for juices.  Purchase of chairs, tables and other items.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is 60 years old. She is widowed and has four children, two boys and two girls. She says all her children are mature and live independently. However, she lives with one of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Akua is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Akua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for barely a year and hopes to improve her living standard and give her grandchildren the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline tiene 38  años, vive con su esposo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de balones de gas doméstico, empezó a vender de manera ambulante y poco a poco ha incrementado sus ventas, ahora reparte a los principales restaurantes de su barrio, este trabajo lo realiza todas las mañanas, y es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos que le permite suplir las necesidades de su familia. Por las tardes se dedica al tejido, elaborando prendas que vende ocasionalmente a sus amistades y vecinos. Jackeline tiene grandes deseos de mejorar su negocio, adquiriendo un local comercial que le permita exhibir su mercadería. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está trabajando arduamente para mejorar, su deseo es que todos los integrantes de su banco comunal tengan ese mismo progreso con sus respectivos negocios. El dinero que solicita es para comprar más balones de gas al por mayor, los precios están estimados en 70 soles por cada balón.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 38, lives with her husband in a rented house. For 3 years she has sold domestic gas cylinders, which she started selling door-to-door and has gradually increased her sales so that now she sells to all the main restaurants in her neighborhood. She does this every morning, and it is the principal source of income to supply her family necessities. In the afternoon she does weaving, creating garments that she occasionally sells to her friends and neighbors. Jackeline greatly desires to improve her business by acquiring a business location that will allow her to exhibit her merchandise. This is the second time that she has had a loan through MFP, and she is working hard to improve herself. She desires that all the members of her communal bank have equal progress in their respective businesses. The money she is requesting is to buy more cylinders of gas wholesale, estimated at 70 soles per cylinder.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy red oil for resale

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua A. is 50 years old. She is married and has six children, three boys and three girls. She says almost all her children are mature and living independently. The last-born is currently in junior high school. She lives with her husband, a cocoa farmer, and the last-born child in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Afua is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms and adds to what she harvests from her own farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Afua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for 10 years and hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 20  años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Trabaja en su propio restaurante desde hace 2 meses, anteriormente laboraba de manera dependiente, pero la experiencia de su niñez viendo a sus padres con su propio negocio, la llevó a abrir su propio establecimiento de venta de comida, el cual está creciendo aceleradamente. Cada día cocina y atiende su restaurante vendiendo hasta 40 menús, el único día que descansa es el miércoles, porque en ese día las ventas son menores. Jaqueline quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que se ha propuesto seguir adelante con este negocio, ofreciendo a sus clientes los platos más exquisitos que sabe hacer. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte del banco comunal que recientemente se ha formado, promete ser una integrante activa y responsable. El dinero que solicita es para implementar su restaurante con mesas nuevas que le den una mejor presentación a su restaurante. Cada mesa está valorizada en 100 soles, ella comprará 6.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 20 years old, and she lives with her parents in their house. She works in her own restaurant as of two months ago. Previously, she worked for someone else, but her childhood experience of watching her parents with their own business has encouraged her to start a restaurant business of her own, which is growing rapidly. Every day, she cooks and tends to the restaurant, serving up to 40 meals per day. The only day she rests is on Wednesday, because the sales are lower on that day. Jaqueline wants to continue to grow, so she has proposed to advance forward with her business, offering clients the most exquisite dishes she knows how to make. This is the first time she has a loan with MFP, and she is very excited to be part of this community bank that has been recently formed. She promises to be an active and responsible member. The money she requests will allow her to set up new tables in her restaurants that will provide a better overall presentation of her business. Each table is valued at 100 soles, and she will buy six.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, vive en el Ricardo Palma S/Nº, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia empezó su negocio vendiendo refrigerios en un kiosco. Tiene 10 años trabajando con el Banco. 

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de Pollos a la brasa, y también brinda pensión y vende menú; en su misma casa, donde atiende a los moradores de la comunidad, y con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses,  comprará  insumos como pollos vivos en javas , papas, tomates en sacos , mostazas, salsa de tomate y mayonesa en baldes para complementa el servicio de pollos a la braza; también bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas, aguas minerales.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.

Maria Luisa, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women] Communal Bank and lives on Ricardo Palma street in the District of Bellavista in the Department of San Martín. She is married, is 35 years old and is mother to two children, one of which is still dependant on her. On her own initiative, she started her business with S/. 300.00 [USD$100] selling refreshments in a kiosk. She has been working with the communal bank for 10 years. Presently, she works selling rotisserie chickens, and she also offers room and board and a daily menu. She works out of her house where she attends to the the local community residents. With the loan of S/. 3,000.00 for which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy live chickens in cages, potatoes and tomatoes by the sack, mustards, tomato sauce and mayonnaise in buckets for the rotisserie chicken sales. She will also purchase refreshments such as sodas and mineral water. Today she feels more independent and secure, since she makes her own decisions about the business and about the income that is generated. Maria Luisa expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as live chickens in cages, potatoes, tomatoes, mustards, tomato sauce and mayonnaise in buckets, and drink refreshments

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Y. Isaac is 31 years old. He is married and has two children: a boy and a girl. The daughter is currently in the basic school while the son has yet to start. His wife is a seamstress by profession. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming.

Isaac is a tailor by profession and yet trades in palm oil as well. He produces palm oil and distributes it. He procures palm fruits from the farmers in his community and those in the surrounding towns. He distributes the palm oil to food vendors and to customers who also resell it.

Isaac wants a loan to procure palm nuts in large quantities so that he can produce oil in bulk and distribute it to the his increasing number of customers. He has been in business for four years. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 10 años vende diversos artículos, prendas de vestir, adornos, llaveros, entre otros, dirigidos a un público joven. Generalmente trabaja por las tardes, ya que durante el día atiende a sus hijos, la línea que ella vende es de acuerdo a la temporada y moda. Los fines de semana, Julia vende en un puesto comercial en la feria de su localidad que es donde percibe mayores ganancias, el resto de días lo hace en un puesto del mercado de su zona. La meta de Julia es tener varios puestos de ventas que le favorezcan en el crecimiento económico para su familia, y por el momento está muy orgullosa por lo que ha logrado hasta la actualidad. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella tiene un gran sentido del humor, el cual expone en cada reunión que tiene con su banco comunal, además se compromete, una vez más, a forjar un trabajo solidario con todos sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de mercadería al por mayor, comprará polos, llaveros, entre otros artículos según esta temporada y moda.
texts.en:
Julia lives with her husband and three daughters in a rented house. For 10 years, she has been selling various items, garments, ornaments, key chains, among other things, all aimed at a younger audience. Generally, she works in the evenings, since during the day she tends to her children. She varies her fashion line according to the season and trends. On weekends, Julia sells her products at a town trade fair where she can gain higher returns. The rest of the days, she sells at a market in her neighborhood. Julia's goal is to have several stands for selling her products in order to promote economic growth for her family, and so far, she is very proud of what she has achieved to date. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP. Julia has a great sense of humor, which she exhibits in each meeting with her community bank. She also has committed once again to forge a common bond with all of her peers. She requests the money for the purchase of wholesale merchandise to buy t-shirts, key chains, and other items according to the season and trends.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the increase of her merchandise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is fifty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to seven children, two boys and five girls. She lost her husband three years ago. She says all her children are out of school and are working. She lives with some of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Ama is into palm oil production and farms as well. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms and adds them to what she harvests from her own farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Ama wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for five years and is hopeful to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a vender ropa, sale en busca de clientes cada día y de casa en casa caminando por toda su localidad, luego reparte los pedidos que le hicieron y en días posteriores cobra poco a poco lo que dejó al crédito. Esta actividad la realiza de desde hace 3 años y aunque su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico al caminar largas distancias, Maritza se mantiene tranquila, ya que con este esfuerzo puede solventar los gastos de su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta por haber sido partícipe de trabajar en un banco comunal y tiene muchos deseos de continuar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará, al por mayor, zapatos para estudiantes en diversas tallas para la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and lives with her three children in her parents’ home. She sells clothes, and every day, she goes out in search of customers by walking from house to house throughout her town. Later, she distributes the orders she acquired, and in the following days, she gradually collects the money for what was paid with credit. She has been doing this for three years, and although her job requires much physical effort to walk long distances, Maritza stays calm, as this effort can cover the costs of her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy for having been involved in working in a community bank and is eager to continue. With the money that she now seeks, she will buy shoes for students in various sizes for the school campaign at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the increase of her merchandise

loans.name: Yánex Edilu

texts.es:
La señora Yánex Edilu, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Cdra. 12, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y es madre de 2 hijos, los 2 independientes. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo productos de belleza.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, cuenta con un Kiosco especialmente  acondicionado en el paradero de camionetas y autos a los demás provincias de la región.

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando sus productos de insumos como papayas, piñas, bananas, maracuyas, veterragas;  para la preparación de sus jugos, también comprando insumos para preparar sus tortas, cremas y como harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas y otras esencias, productos muy requeridos  por su gran cliente que son los pasajeros en transito.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, seguro y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Yánex Edilu, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Yánex Edilu belongs to the community bank "United Women" and lives at Jr. Augusto B Leguia Cdra. 12, Bellavista district, San Martin state. She is single, 47 years old, and a mother of 2 children, both of whom support themselves. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she decided to start her own business selling beauty products. Currently, she sells sandwiches from a special stand located by the bus and car stop most frequently visited in the region. With this loan of S/ 3,000, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she will invest in her business by purchasing papayas, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits for the juices she prepares. Also, she would like to purchase items to preparte sandwiches and soups, like flour, sugar, eggs, and other necesities for her big client base. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Personally, she feels more independent, secure, and responsible with her monthly financial obligations. Yánex Edilu expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase papayas, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits as well as flour, sugar, eggs, and other necesities for her sandwiches and soups.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr: Amina B. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Elle est coiffeuse à Atakpamé, une ville située à 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit acheter 2 séchoirs et aussi acheter des mèches et produits de beauté pour la revente. Elle compte sur ce crédit pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amina B., age 32, is married and the mother of a little boy. She is a hairdresser in Atakpamé, a city located 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to buy two hair dryers and also to buy some hair extensions and beauty products in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two hair dryers, hair extensions, and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la venta del platillo llamado “papa rellena”, lo hace de manera ambulante, recorriendo las calles de su localidad para vender lo que ha preparado con tanta dedicación. Se levanta muy temprano para salir a partir de las 9am con una fuente y las salsas con las que acompaña a su platillo. Cada mes Martha se abastece de sacos de papa para tener siempre el producto base de su actividad, además de otros ingredientes que ella utiliza en su elaboración. Una vez que termina de vender, Martha descansa por las tardes y permanece en su casa para atender a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere seguir vendiendo comida al paso, pero con un carrito sanguchero, que es como una pequeña cocina móvil que incluye una pequeña parrilla para diversas frituras, esto lo haría por las tardes, frente a su casa y por las mañanas continuaría con sus papas rellenas. Es la tercera vez que Martha tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una integrante que promueve el trabajo solidario, por lo que es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más sacos de papa de 100 kilos, queso, carne y demás ingredientes para la preparación de su platillo.
texts.en:
Martha, 43, lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For 24 years she has sold the dish called "stuffed potato", traveling through the streets of her area to sell what she has prepared with such dedication. She gets up very early to be out by 9am with the dish and the sauces that accompany her dish. Every month Martha stocks up on sacks of potatoes so she will always have the basic stock for her creation, as well as the other ingredients that she uses in her creation. Once she has finished selling, Martha rests in the afternoon and stays in her house to tend her children. In the future she would like to keep selling her food, but using a "carrito sanguchera" that is like a little mobile kitchen including a little grill for various frying. She would do this in the afternoons in front of her house, and in the morning would continue to sell her stuffed potatoes. This is the third time that Martha has taken a loan through MFP. She is a member who promotes self-employment because she is one of the founders of this communal bank. The money that she is requesting is to buy more 100 kilo sacks of potatoes, cheese, meat, and other ingredients for the preparation of her dish.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of potatoes for the preparation of her dish

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en:
Sampson B. is thirty-eight years old. He is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters. According to him, all his children are in basic school. His wife helps him with his business. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Sampson is a farmer and at the same time runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, Milo (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is located at the market square. Sampson has been in business for three years. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al tejido de diversas prendas de vestir, lo que más elabora son chompas, en una semana puede hacer 4, dependiendo del tamaño y la complejidad de los puntos que utiliza. Esta actividad la desarrolla en la comodidad de su casa, sin descuidar a sus hijos, una vez que termina de tejer, por medio de sus familiares la llevan a vender a otras ciudades, así obtiene ganancias por su esfuerzo. Nancy considera rentable su negocio porque  cuesta menos la lana que la mano de obra y la elaboración de sus tejidos es de manera artesanal por lo que no utiliza energía eléctrica; sin embargo más adelante quiere producir en mayores cantidades e implementar un taller textil. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a seguir trabajando de manera unida en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de una máquina de tejer, valorizada en 2500 soles, este préstamo solo cubre una parte de lo que solicita, la otra para es de sus propios ahorros.
texts.en:
Nancy, 35, lives with her husband and 2 children in their parents' house. For 4 years she has been knitting various articles of clothing. What she makes the most are sweaters, she can make 4 per week depending on the size and the complexity of stitches that she uses. She undertakes this activity in the comfort of her home, without neglecting her children. Once she finishes knitting, with the help of her friends she sends them to be sold in other cities, thus gaining earnings from her own effort. Nancy considers her business to be profitable because the wool costs less than the value of the handwork. The decoration of her articles qualifies as true artisan work because she does not use electrical energy; nonetheless, further on she would like to produce in greater quantity and start up a textile factory. This is her second loan through MFP, and she commits herself to keep working in unity with her group. The money she is currently requesting is to buy a knitting machine costing 2500 soles. Only part of the cost is covered by the requested loan, the balance comes from her own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a knitting machine

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gregoria vende nacatamales, sopas enchiladas y una variedad de platillos ricos,  desde hace siete años vende comida, su esposo la apoya siempre el es comerciante, sus dos hijos que tiene son mayores de edad. Tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles norte. El negocio en circunstancia lo ha tenido con poco inventario para preparar los alimentos debido a que cuando se enferma gasta en mucha medicina. Sus metas es poder terminar de hacer su casa ya que es insegura quiere cambiar el techo, hacer embaldosado, y repellar las paredes, lo que mas desea es tener una casa bonita y digna. Con este crédito va a comprar granos básicos y carnes para preparar sus ricos platillos También espera aumentar las ventas para obtener mejores ingresos, este es su doceavo ciclo y da las gracias Afodenic por que con sus prestamos se ha beneficiado para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Gregoria sells tamales, soups, and a variety of delicious dishes. She has been selling food for seven years. Her husband always supports her; he is a storekeeper. Their two sons are now grown. She is 50 years old, and resides in the Laureles North neighborhood. Her business has had low inventory for preparing the foods due to her illness and having to spend money on medicines. Her goal is to finish construction on her home which is currently unsafe. She wants to replace the roof, install tile, and repair the walls. Her greatest wish is to have a pretty and dignified home. With this loan she will purchase basic grains and meats in order to prepare her delicious dishes. She also hopes to increase sales in order to have more income. This is her twelfth loan cicle and she thanks Afodenic because with their loans she has been able to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and meats in order to prepare her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de acuerdo a la temporada, cuando se inicia la época escolar, como ahora, vende calzado para los estudiantes, complemento del uniforme. Cuando termina esta temporada vende zapatos para dama y así aprovecha cada ocasión y cada pedido de sus clientes, Nancy deja su mercadería en las casas de sus clientes y luego cobra día a día hasta que completen su cuenta. Los resultados de su negocio son positivos, y esto le anima a seguir trabajando en esta actividad que le permite estar en casa con sus hijos por las tardes. Más adelante quiere tener un puesto de ventas estable de zapatos y de otras prendas de vestir, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está muy animada de trabajar en este nuevo grupo, y ya tiene muy claro lo que es la garantía solidaria en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para comprar más zapatos y abastecerse en esta campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. For the past three years she has sold shoes appropriate to the season. Now at the beginning of the school year she is selling the shoes required for school uniforms. At the end of this season she will sell women's shoes, thus making the most of each and every opportunity and customer request. Nancy delivers the merchandize to her clients, and then gradually collects their payments until the bill is paid in full. She has had positive results from her business, and that encourages her to continue working. This work permits her to be home with her children in the afternoons. In the future she hopes to have a regular stall from which to sell shoes and other items of clothing, and that motivates her to keep working. This is the first loan she has requested from Microfinanzas PRISMA (MFP), and she finds working in this new group encouraging, already fully understanding the guarantee community bank members provide to one another. The money that she has requested is for the purchase of more shoes to stock up for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on merchandize

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. DesD. hace más D. tres años se dedica a la venta D. leña, empezó con pocas rajada (pedazos D. leña) y actualmente ya reparte por cantidades porque ha logrado ubicar a contactos que le proveen D. troncos para cortarlos en grandes cantidades. Cada 15 días viaja para adquirir los troncos y contratar al personal que se encargara D. cortarlos en rajadas. Nelly planea repartir cada vez más cantidad D. leña, y a su vez está analizando la forma D. emprender otro negocio para el aumento D. sus ingresos. Es la décima vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella conoce perfectamente en qué consiste un trabajo solidario en los bancos comunales, por lo que está muy contenta D. ser parte D. uno. La cantidad que requiere esta vez es para adquirir troncos en mayor cantidad, cada tronco está valorizado en 70 soles.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45, lives with her spous and two children in a rented house. For more than three years she has been dedicated to the sale of firewood, which started with logs and actually now is in large quantities becasue she has been able to locate contacts which proviD. her with trunks to cut them in large quantities. Every fifteen days she travels to acquire the trunks and contact the people who are in charge of cutting them into logs. Nelly plans to bring each time a larger quantity of firewood, and at this time is analizing the wayt o start another business to increase her income. It is the tenth time she has asked for a loan with MFP, she knows perfectly what the solidarity work in community banks involves, which is why she is very happy to be part of one. The amount she needs this time is to obtain more trunks, each trunk is valued at about 70 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia tiene 55 años, vive con su hija de 12 años en su propia casa. Se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios nativos de su localidad, como papas y quesos. Cada fin de semana viaja a la ciudad capital para vender en los diferentes mercados y también repartir a los clientes que se lo solicitan. Durante 3 años ha asumido el riesgo de perder su mercadería durante el viaje, cuando en tiempo de lluvias hay deslizamiento de tierras en la carretera, lo que le impide avanzar y los productos alimenticios se malogran, esto ocurre durante los primeros meses del año, por lo que ha decidió durante este tiempo vender en su misma localidad. Para el futuro Olimpia desea tener una tienda de abarrotes, por lo pronto seguirá trabajando de esta manera. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está muy contenta por ser una integrante más de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser partícipe activa del desarrollo del grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más productos, de esa manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprará quesos en molde, truchas y otros productos más. El monto que solicita será cubierto en su totalidad.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 55 years old and lives with her 12-year-old daughter in their own home. She sells food products native to her region, like potatoes and cheese. Every weekend she travels to the capital city to sell her wares at various markets and also to make deliveries to customers who have placed orders. For the past three years Olimpia has run the risk of losing her merchandise during the trip because during the rainy season there are landslides on the highway that prevent travel and food products spoil. As this happens in the first few months of the year, she has decided to sell locally during those times. In the future, Olimpia wants to have a grocery store, but in the meantime will continue to work as before. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She is happy to be a member of the community bank and has promised to be an active participant in the group's development. The money that Olimpia is requesting will go towards the purchase of more merchandise. In this way she will increase her working capital, will buy wheels of cheese, trout and other products. The sum that she seeks will be repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some cloth for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace un año se dedica a la atención de su tienda, su decisión de tener este negocio fue impulsada por la necesidad de generarse ingresos económicos que le permitan apoyar más en la economía de su casa. Cada día abre su establecimiento por la mañanas para vender los productos de primera necesidad que tiene como mercadería, considera que en época escolar bajan las ventas porque sus vecinos hacen más gastos en la compra de los útiles escolares de sus hijos, por lo que en estos meses obtiene menos mercadería, pero no deja de tener reservas para surtir su tienda. Atender a sus clientes es una de las actividades que Sonia más disfruta, ya que es una distracción para ella, en el futuro quiere que su tienda sea más grande y pueda tener mayor capital de trabajo. Es la primera vez que Sonia solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está segura que su banco comunal será uno de los más organizados y unido. Por su parte, Sonia hizo un compromiso de responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de mercadería en sacos de arroz y azúcar al por mayor, además de pagar los pedidos de productos que hizo con anterioridad.
texts.en:
Sonia is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in their own house. She has had a store for one year. Her decision to start this business was driven by the need to generate income to help support the household. Every morning she opens her store to sell her merchandise, basic needs items. Sales are down during the school year because her neighbors have more expenses buying school supplies for their children. She has less merchandise during these months, but she keeps reserves to stock her store. Waiting on her customers is enjoyable and one of the things Sonia most enjoys. In the future she wants to see the store get bigger and have more working capital. This is Sonia’s first loan with MFP. She is sure that her community bank will be one of the most organized and united. Doing her part, Sonia made a promise to be responsible. The loan is to buy wholesale merchandise (bags of rice and sugar) and to pay for previously ordered products. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José  Mauricio P. R. es un caballero de 28 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. José Mauricio es soltero y vive con su mamá, su hermana y su sobrino. Él tiene una finca en donde trabaja en el cultivo de hortalizas y con ganado en la producción de leche.
La lechería es una actividad que ha heredado de de su familia ya que sus padres por muchos años la han desarrollado. Actualmente José Mauricio ordeña seis vacas, actividad que le lleva la mitad de su tiempo. Dentro de sus proyectos se encuentra comprar una máquina de ordeño que le podría economizar mucho tiempo que ocuparía en mejorar algunos aspectos de su misma actividad. Don José Mauricio vende leche y queso a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos al poder adquirir productos frescos y elaborados en un ambiente de confianza por gente conocida. 
José Mauricio tiene ocho años de ser socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. En todo ese tiempo ha recibido 15 microcréditos para producir en su finca  y todos los ha cancelado responsablemente. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito de US$ 1.200 para comprar la máquina de ordeño a veinticuatro meses pagadero en cuotas fijas por mes. Su intención es intensificar la producción y poder así mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Mauricio P. R. is a 28 year old man from a rural community of Costa Rica situated 45 kilometers south of San Jose, called San Cristobal Norte. San Cristobal is a mountainous area where people make their living from such activities as business; cultivation of vegetables, coffee, and other crops; handicrafts; cattle, and many other activities. Jose Mauricio is single and lives with his mom, his sister, and his nephew. He owns a farm where he grows vegetables and has dairy cows for the production of milk. Dairy farming is a business that he learned from his family; his parents have developed the business over many years. At the present time, Jose Mauricio milks six cows, which takes up half of his time. He wishes to purchase a milking machine which would save him a great deal of time and allow him to improve other aspects of the dairy operation. Jose Mauricio sells milk and cheese to his neighbors in the community, and they have been very satisfied with being able to buy fresh products made in an atmosphere of trust by someone they know. Jose Mauricio has been a member of the group Empresa de Credito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) for eight years. This is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. During that time he has received 15 microloans in order to run his farm. He has paid off each one responsibly. At this time he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy the milking machine over 24 months to be paid in fixed installments each month. His intention is to increase production in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy a milking machine that costs $1200.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John W. is 32 years old, married and has five children. All his kids are in school. He lives with in Nkawkaw in the eastern region of Ghana. He is an achiever and a resourceful young man who serves as a pillar for his family. He loves selling goods, the business through which he makes a living.

John trades in foodstuffs like oranges, plantains, grocery products, and he has been buying and selling cocoa pods for more than eight years now. He treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of oranges, plantains and others from the farmers and retails them to his customers. For lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support his family. He wants to use part of the profit to support his kid’s education.

With the loan, he wants to purchase a bulk supply of oranges, plantains and other grocery products to enable him to scale up his sales. John belongs to a village bank called ‘Anigye’ which means ‘Happiness’. He hopes to receive GHS 900 to make business progress by restocking his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of oranges, plantains, and grocery products

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y su nieta en su casa propia. DesD. hace un año se dedica a la venta D. comida, atienD. todos los días por la mañana en un espacio fuera D. su casa que acondicionó para su negocio, su trato cálido y amable siempre atrae nuevos clientes. Teofila se levanta D. madrugada para preparar sus platos y por las tardes se dedica a la limpieza D. los cubiertos y D. todos los utensilios, además realiza las compras para el día siguiente. Teofila quiere seguir creciendo con este negocio, para ello quiere mejorar el aspecto físico D. su espacio y tener platos y cubiertos nuevos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene grandes expectativas D. impulsar entre los demás integrantes D. su banco comunal un trabajo solidario para que todo el grupo crezca equitativamente. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra D. una carpa granD. para protegerse D. la lluvia y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Teofila is 55 years old, lives with her husband and her granddaughter in her own home. For a year, she has sold food daily in the mornings in an area outsiD. of her house that she has modified for her business. Her warm and friendly market stall always attracts new clients. Teofila rises at dawn to prepare her dishes and in the afternoon she cleans cutlery and utensils and makes purchases for the following day. Teofila wants to continue growing this business and wants to improve the physical appearance of her space and purchase new plates and cutlery. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She has high expectations of driving the rest of the members in her community bank through common work so that the entire group will grow equally. With the money she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of a large tent to protect her from the rain and offer her customers greater convenience.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tent for protection against the rain

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana tiene 24 años vive, con su  esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año trabaja día a día en la atención de su bodega, debido a que su local está ubicado cerca a un centro de estudios, la afluencia de público garantizan las ventas diarias, y con ello los ingresos para su familia. Yovana trabaja todos los días para que de esa manera pueda cubrir no solo sus necesidades, sino también el arrendamiento de su local comercial. Su anhelo es tener una gran tienda donde venda diversos productos comestibles. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasmada por seguir adelante con el trabajo en su banco comunal y de ese modo seguir creciendo como persona. El monto que ahora solicita es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor, adquirirá sacos de azúcar, arroz y menestras, además de cajas de golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Yovana is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For a year, she has worked daily in the care of her winery. Her business is located close to a center of study, and the influx of business guarantees daily sales, and thus income for her family. Yovana works every day so that she can cover not only her needs but also the lease of her shop. Her desire is to have a large store where she sells various food products. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP and is excited to continue with work in their community bank, and thus continue to grow as a person. The amount she seeks will be used toward the purchase of groceries at wholesale, purchase bags of sugar, rice, plus boxes of sweets and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is forty-nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to nine children, six boys and three girls. She says all her daughters are married and live independently. The sons, however, are still in school – junior high and primary school. She lives with some of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. She lost her husband thirteen years ago.

Yaa is into palm oil production. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms to prepare palm oil. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Yaa wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for eight years and is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is 40 years old and a divorced mother with three children. Currently all but one of her children are in school. Grace has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc. in the local market of Kawabata for four years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, etc. to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. Grace also wants to use part of profit to acquire additional freezers to stock her products. She would be grateful for your support. It is her heart's desire to provide support for her children through the proceeds from her business. Grace belongs to a village bank called ‘Anigye’ which means ‘Happiness’. She hopes to receive GHS 900 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce T. is 49 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three males and two females. According to her, some of her children are currently learning trades while the rest are in junior high school. Her husband is a cocoa and palm nut farmer. Joyce lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Joyce is also into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She adds the procured palm nuts to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Joyce wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Zuhra Begum Javed Akbar Bhatti Group

texts.en:
My name is Zuhra begum and I am a 44-year-old lady. I quit school after completing the eighth standard because my father had little financial resources. I own a two-room brick house in Lahore, a city in Pakistan, and have been living in it with my family for the last 10 years. I am married to a man named J. A. B. and he is an electrician by profession. He also sells electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches). I am a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. My elder son is involved in his father’s business. The others are getting an education from a  school located near our house. My elder daughter works in an office for a monthly wage. I operate a ready-made shawl-selling business. I buy shawls from a famous bazaar in Lahore named “Azam Market and Ichra” and sell in the community. I have been doing this work for the last five years. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) for my husband’s business. 

I’m a group leader of some more women in my locality. Iram baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Kosar begum baji and Azra parveen baji each wants a loan to buy embroidery material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.  Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of nine. Currently three of her children are in school. She loves selling goods, which is her livelihood.  She has been selling foodstuffs like plantain, maize, cassava and many more at Nkawkaw for 30 years now to support her family. Her husband is a farmer.

She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of plantain, cassava, and maize in bulk from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy plantain in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Anigye’, which means ‘Happiness’. She also hopes to receive GHS800 to restock her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband take care of their home.

loans.use: To buy plantains, maize, cassava etc. in bulk

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
