Augustina B. is 35 years old; she is single and a very staunch Christian. She lives at Nkawkaw in the eastern region of Ghana with her family. She lives with her extended family in the community. She is a trader who trades in cola nuts. 

Cola nuts are mostly used by the northerners in Ghana. Most people chew them for the flavor. She treks to the villages to buy bulk supplies of cola nuts and retails them to her customers. Cola nuts have a big market share in Ghana and have created lots of opportunity for Ghana women. She is requesting the loan amount to buy cola nuts, especially their season is approaching. Augustina belongs to a village bank called ‘Anigye’ which means ‘Happiness’.

loans.use: To buy cola nuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell red oil (palm oil)

loans.name: Nazra Pervaiz Ghouri Group

texts.en:
"I’m Nazra and my husband's name is P. G.. I am a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I am an uneducated lady because I couldn’t pay attention to my education because of my mother’s health. My mother needs my care. My mother left me alone; I still miss her company. My husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this business for the past 5 years.

"I have five kids: three sons and two daughters. All of my kids are getting an education. I and my husband have decided to give our children a good education till our kids never get satisfied. For this purpose I am in the cloth -business. I buy cloth from a famous bazaar in a city named Lahore, “Azam market and Ichra”, and sell it in the community. I used my income to pay the school fees of my kids. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to repair my husband’s auto-rickshaw so that he will be able to continue his work. "I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Ashi Taj baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazia baji wants a loan to buy leather to make car seats to sell." This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Nelva Florencia

texts.es:
Nelva es socia del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Nelva es casada, tiene 43 años  dos hijos de 20 y 22 años trabajan y estudian en instituto. 
Nelva siempre se dedico a trabajar en ventas de muchas cosas pero ahora sé esta dedicando mas a  la venta de queso, reparte a domicilio a sus vecinas, en la semana  trabaja  limpiando casa  tres veces por semanas; Vende gaseosas y cerveza en su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ha organizarse en el negocio y como administrarlo, sus ventas aumentaron, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal son muy familiares y amenas.  
Nelva necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para comprar cerveza, gaseosa y queso.
El sueño de Nelva es que su capital aumente para poner una tienda y abrir una cochera en un terreno que tiene.
texts.en:
Nelva is a member of the communal bank "El sembrador". She is 43, married, with two children 20 and 22, both working and studying. Nelva always works selling many various things, but now she sells cheese, distributing it to the homes of her neighbors. During the week she also works cleaning house 3 times per week. She sells soft drinks and beer from her home. Since she has been in FINCA, she has learned how to organize her business and how to administrate it, and her sales have grown. She enjoys the communal bank meetings, they are very family-like and pleasant. Nelva needs a loan of US$275 to buy beer, soft drinks, and cheese. Her dream is to increase her capital in order to have a shop and to open a garage on some land that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, and cheese

loans.name: Maahjabeen Aslam Group

texts.en:
"My name is Maahjabeen and I’m 45 years old. I own a two-room brick house in a city named Lahore, Pakistan and have been living in it with my family for the past 20 years. My husband's name is A. and he is a tailor by profession. He runs a small shop in the community. He has a good number of customers. He charges US$ 2 for simple stitching and US$ 3 for designer clothes. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another sewing machine for my husband’s tailoring center. "I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Shama baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Ishrat Bano baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her phone shop."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Maria es conviviente tiene 46 años, cuatro hijos de 25,18,13 y  3 años los menores están en la escuela estatal.
Maria vende en la tienda de su hermana ropa interior y cosméticos por catalogo también ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas capital, se siente contenta en el Bancomunal 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de ropa interior y compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Maria es que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "El sembrador". Maria is 46, a common-law wife with 4 children of 25, 18, 13, and 3 years of age. The younger are in the state school. Maria sells underclothing and cosmetics by catalog in her sister's shop. She also sells beauty products by catalog. Since she has been in FINCA, she has accumulated more capital, so she is very happy in the communal bank. Maria needs a loan of US$275 to purchase underclothing and other beauty products. Maria's dream is that her children would become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underclothing and beauty products

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino C. García tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Saturnino no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Don Saturnino es la compra de repuestos electrodomésticos usados. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y nos dice que no ha sido nada fácil mantener este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Don Saturnino son que su negocio obtenga un crecimiento y establecerse de manera permanente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que buscar los repuestos de manera más favorable y es para inversión de su negocio ya que así podrá ofertar a sus clientes el precio que piden por los repuestos. Su deseo más grande es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana su familia pueda disfrutarlo. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 2.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Saturnino C. García is 58 years old and is married. Saturnino does not have any children. Saturnino's economic activity is the purchase of used appliance parts. For more than five years he has worked on this business and he tells us that it has not been easy to maintain this type of business. Saturnino's intentions are to grow his business and to establish it in a permanent way. The financing that he is requesting is to be used for working capital as he has to look for the parts in a more favorable way and it is to invest in his business so that he offer his clients the price for the parts that they request. His biggest wish is to make improvements to his home so that his family can enjoy it in the future. The amount that he is requesting is C$ 2.000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Doña Ana María A. B. es una señora de 52 años de edad, casada con Reinaldo Leiva y madre de un adolecente de 15 años llamado Diego. Doña Ana María vive en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850m sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Doña Ana María se dedica a la venta de cosméticos casa por casa. Su esposo le ayuda ocasionalmente con el transporte pero él también tiene otros trabajos principalmente en la siembra de café. Además don Reinaldo es guarda de seguridad en una clínica por las noches y también coordina actividades de microfinanzas con EDESA en la región sur de Costa Rica.

Doña Ana María ha solicitado un microcrédito por un monto de $1.200 y a un plazo de 12 meses para comprar y vender mercadería en su pueblo. Ella se dedica a vender casa por casa artículos como perfumes y otros artículos personales. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando ella espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder brindarle mayores oportunidades a su hijo que actualmente está estudiando en el colegio.

Doña Ana María es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana María A. B. is 52-years-old, married to Reinaldo Leiva and mother to 15-year-old Diego. Ana María lives in the Mollejones de Platanares Pérez Zeledón rural community in Costa Rica. The Mollejones community is located 150km south of San José, the capital of Costa Rica, at 850m above sea level. Some local farmers grow vegetables and coffee while others raise pigs, among other activities. There are also some organic farming and hydroponic vegetable projects. Apart from agriculture, the community has auto shops, a supermarket, small restaurants and a furniture store. Ana María sells cosmetics door to door. Her husband occasionally provides her transport but he has his own work. Reinaldo primarily grows coffee, but works nights as a clinic security guard. He also coordinates microfinance activities with EDESA in the southern region of Costa Rica. Ana María has asked for a loan of $1,200 to be repaid in 12 months in order to buy and sell merchandise in her town. She sells products like perfume and other personal items. Her business is going well but a lack of funds has prevented it from growing. With this loan she hopes to increase her sales, and thereby improve her family’s economic situation, as well as give her son, currently studying at school, better opportunities. Ana María is a member of the Bancruce Community Credit Agency, one of EDESA’s 100 member organisations in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan with the hope that she will grow both personally and economically, as well as actively participate in her community’s credit organisation.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door to door sale of cosmetics and other personal products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools and outfit his garage

loans.name: Rasoolan M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
'My name is Rasoolan and I’m 45 years old and married. I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I am married to a man whose name is M. I. and he is a ticket checker in the railway. I have two kids: one son and one daughter. My son manufactures plastic bags. My daughter reads in 8th standard. I am an older lady and my family suggests I do household work. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy plastic beans to expand my son’s plastic bag-making business.

I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth and colored thread for her boutique. Parveen Akthar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Nusrat Bano baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making plastic bags

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es socio del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Víctor es conviviente tiene 46 años, cuatro hijos de los cuales el  menor tiene 12 años y esta en la escuela estatal. 
Víctor vende hace catorce años helados en carretilla, no conseguía trabajo, entonces  sus amigos le animaron a que entre en la venta de helados y así empezó, ahora distribuye helados en las tiendas. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas facilidad para poder invertir, los prestamos le han ayudado mucho, aprendido administra su dinero, hacer puntual, cuando el no puede ir a las reuniones del Bancomunal su esposo lo remplaza.
Víctor necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para compra de helados de crema.
El sueño de víctor es tener una tienda mini-marqué.
texts.en:
Victor is a partner of Bancomunal El sembrador. Victor is 46 years old, with four children of whom the youngest child is 12 years old and is in state school. For fourteen years, Victor has sold ice cream in a truck. When he could not find work, his friends encouraged him to sell ice cream and this is how he started distributing ice cream in stores. Since he has been with Finca, he has found it easier to invest. The loans have helped him greatly, and he has learned how to manage his money and make timely payments. When he cannot attend Bancomunal meetings, he wife attends in his place. Victor needs a loan of $275 USD to buy ice cream. Victor's dream is to have a mini-mart.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of ice cream

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador. 
Teodocia es conviviente tiene 48 años, tres hijos de 23, 19 y 12 años, él ultima esta en la escuela estatal.
Cuando Teodocia se separo de su primera pareja  se vio en la necesidad de trabajar en la venta de ropa de segunda, tuvo un puesto alquilado en la Av. Grau, pero lo perdió por que su hijo estaba metido en el pandillaje y tuvo que empezar a vender ropa usada de casa en casa, para estar mas cerca de su hijo.   
Desde que esta en Finca tiene la facilidad de prestamos, que le ayudan a mover mercadería, en el Bancomunal ella aprendió a ahorra. 
Teodocia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para comprar mercadería por maleta a personas que se van de viaje, ella vende a sus vecinos y recomendados.
El sueño de Teodocia es poner un bazar de ropa.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a member of Bancomunal Sembrador. Teodocia is 48 years old and has three children of 23, 19 and 12 years. The youngest attends state school. When Teodocia separated from her first partner, she saw the necessity of selling secondhand clothing. She rented a place in Av. Grau, but she lost it when her son became involved with gangs, and she had to begin selling secondhand clothing from house to house to be closer to her son. Since she has been with Finca, she has found it much easier to borrow in order to purchase merchandise. With Bancomunal, she has learned how to save. Teodocia needs a loan of $275 to purchase clothing for people who travel. She sells to her neighbors and recommended individuals. Teodocia’s dream is to have a clothing bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing for people who travel

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es:
Ymelda es socia del Bancomunal el Sembrador.
Ymelda es conviviente, tiene 42 años,  cuatro hijos de 25,23, 18 y 15 años, estos dos últimos está en la escuela estatal.
La familia de Imelda se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, y su suegra le dio un terreno para que empiece en el negocio de compra y venta de chanchos, actualmente tiene  tres mamas chanchas  veinte crías. Ella los vende al camal. Desde que esta en Finca, su negocio cambio le va mucho mejor tiene para invertir  aprendió a ser responsable con el dinero que saca y a ser puntual en sus pagos.
Ymelda necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de chanchos vivos 
El sueño de Ymelda es que su negocio de crianza de chanchos crezca más.
texts.en:
Ymelda is a member of Bancomunal el Sembrador. Ymelda is 42 years old and has four children of 25, 23, 18 and 15 years. The youngest children attend state school. Imelda's family raises pigs. Her mother-in-law gave her land to start the business of buying and selling pigs. She has three mother pigs with twenty piglets. She sells them to the slaughterhouse. Since she has been with Finca, her business has changed for the better, and she has learned how to invest responsibly and make timely payments. Ymelda needs a loan of $275 USD for the purchase of live pigs. Ymelda’s dream is to grow her business of rearing pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase live pigs

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina  es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Clementina es viuda, tiene 73 años, nueve hijos  mayores que están casados. 
Clementina  siempre trabajo en un mercado vendiendo frutas, hasta que dejo  ese trabajo. Después de un buen tiempo decidió  vender golosinas en su casa, su negocio fue creciendo ahora tiene su tienda de  abarrotes una de sus hijas le ayuda, A la edad  que tiene de Clementina  trabajar  por que  sé  distrae.
Clementina necesita un crédito de 800 soles, para compra mercadería, arroz fideos, aceite, detergente.
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos le son de mucha ayuda para compra la mercadería que cada mes necesita.
El sueño de Clementina es trabajar para que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of Bancomunal Sembrador. Clementina is a widow, is 73 years old, and has nine children who are married. Clementine had always worked in a market selling fruit, until she left her job. After a while, she decided to sell candy in her home. Her business has been growing, and she now has a grocery store which one of her daughters helps out with. At Clementina’s age, she works to keep herself entertained and occupied. Clementina needs a credit of $275 to buy goods, rice noodles, oil, and detergent. Since she has been with Finca, the loans have been very helpful to purchase the merchandise that she needs every month. Clementina's dream is to work for her business to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, rice noodles, oil, and detergent

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.en:
Maria Ines Bordón lives in the Jhuguá Nanó neighborhood of Itá, Paraguay. At her home there, she runs a business that makes and sells tobacco cigarettes. When asked how long she had been doing this work, Ms. Bordón laughed, reflected, and finally decided it had been more than thirty years. She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase large quantities of tobacco from the vendor who grows it in a nearby barrio. The vendor only sells the tobacco in Itá two or three times per year and Ms. Bordoón said she needs to be prepared with enough capital to make a sufficient purchase. Once the tobacco is purchased, she makes new cigarettes each week and over the weekend brings them to the town of San Lorenzo to sell.

Ms. Bordón has worked hard at her business to support her five children. This is the second loan she has requested from Fundación Paraguaya and she said that she had no difficulty making payments on her first.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco in large quantities

loans.name: Akhtar M. Riaz Group

texts.en:
'My name is Akhtar and I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. My husband's name is M. R. and he is involved in a catering business. He has been doing this work for the past 5 years. I am the mother of one son who helps his father in his catering business. I manufacture plastic bags. I save my income in a committee and plan to marry off my son when it's my turn to have the whole sum. I am applying for a loan to buy required materials (tent, chairs, and table covers) for my husband’s catering business.

I’m the group leader for some more women from my locality. Gulnaz baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Razia Begum baji wants a loan to buy a lathe. Saima Iram baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.' This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy catering material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To resupply her store

loans.name: Ursina

texts.en:
Ursina G. lives in Itá, Paraguay, where she owns and operates a small store. At the store she sells items such as rice, sugar, noodles, and beverages to her neighbors and passers-by. She works at the store in order to support her eight children. Along with her husband, who works in construction, Ursina has seen her oldest son graduate from his studies and become a teacher, while another son has become an electrician, and another is currently studying law. “If you don’t support your children,” she says, “there is no way they will receive an education or obtain a good career. This is why I continue to seek credit.” Her youngest son is seven years old, and Ursina plans to continue to work hard as her son makes his way through school.

Ursina uses the loans she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to keep her store well-stocked. Ursina was one of the first clients to work with Fundación Paraguaya when it opened an office in Itá almost four years ago. She stated that she is very proud of the fact that she always makes her payments on time, and she still has all the receipts to prove it.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, and beverages for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy phone recharge cards, and to open a second phone booth

loans.name: Zahida Aslam Masih Group

texts.en:
Zahida A. M. is the group loan leader of another five women from her community. She is 37 years old and married. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, where she has lived with her family for the past twenty years. 

She has two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school close to home. Her husband, A. M., has been an auto-rickshaw driver for the past five years. Zahida runs a beauty salon from her home, where she sees a good number of customers. She uses her income to pay school fees for her kids and puts the remainder into her salon. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance lender in Pakistan), and is applying for a new loan to purchase items such as cosmetics, creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

The other members of the group will use the loan as follows:
Ailas S. Y. and Asma R. M. will use their portions of the loan to buy cosmetics and creams for their beauty salons. Violet Y. M. will buy medicines for her clinic. Mahtab Zahid would like to purchase a video camera for her movie making business. Farida K. I. will use the loan to pay the remaining installments of her vehicle named “Shahzore.” 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for beauty salon

loans.name: Shama Begum M. Humayun Group

texts.en:
Shama begum baji is 35 years old, a married lady and a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Shama baji is married to a man whose name is M. H. and he is a ticket checker in the railway. Shama baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which is located near their house.

Shama begum baji is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes to pay the school fees of her kids and to share the financial burden of her husband so that he is able to pay more attention to his work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shama baji is the group leader for another five women from her locality. Bimla baji wants a loan to buy materials (chairs, table covers, and tent) for her catering. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Naseem Sehar baji wants a loan to buy materials (cosmetics and hair dryer) for her beauty salon. Saima baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zareena baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rubina Iqbal  Raza Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Rubina Iqbal baji is 43 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is R. Y. and he drives a local 32-seat bus. Rubina baji is the mother of one son whose name is Mosa R. and he reads in 4th standard. Rubina baji runs a beauty salon in her house. She has a good number of customers. Mostly customers consist of her neighbors. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

Rubina Iqbal baji is the group leader for another four women from her locality. Nargis baji and Walayat baji each want a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy cloth and colored thread for her boutique. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a beauty salon

loans.name: Rafael Acargel

texts.es: El Señor Rafael Arcángel M. N. tiene 40 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene 2 hijos y todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Rafael es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su papa le enseño este oficio y fue así como logro independizarse y establecer su propio negocio. Los propósitos de Don Rafael son de mejorar las condiciones de su establecimiento ya que el espacio que posee no es suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que es necesaria la compra de herramientas para la elaboración de muebles. Sus deseos son de aumentar su producción en la elaboración de más muebles y así podrá ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael Arcángel M. N. is 40 years old and is single. He has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Mr. Rafael is a carpenter. He has spent more than four years in this business since his father taught him the profession and it is how he succeeded in becoming independent and in starting his own business. His goals are to improve the conditions of his establishment since he doesn’t have enough space. The money that he is requesting is for capital for his business, which is necessary so that he can buy tools to make furniture. His dreams are to increase his production of furniture and to be able to offer his family a better life. He is requesting C$ 12,000 cordobas ($625).

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Noreen M. Tariq Khan Group

texts.en:
Noreen baji is a 27 year old married lady, and a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M. T. K. who has been an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the past 5 years. Noreen baji is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of her kids are getting their education from a school located near their house. Noreen baji is involved in a clothes selling business. She buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore named “Azam market and Ichra” and sells to her neighbors and relatives. She uses her income to pay off the school fees for her kids and share the financial burden of her husband. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw because her husband currently drives a rented auto-rickshaw. 

Noreen baji is the group leader of another three women from her locality. Maryam baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw. Safia kanwal baji wants a loan to buy a video camera for making videos. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
JOVITA RAMÍREZ D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. Oscar Benavidez N° 651 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 65 años, 05 hijos, su esposo es jubilado.

	Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa y su primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, uso para fortalecer su negocio D. abarrotes, ya que antes las compras la realizaba al día, y ahora lo podía hacer semanalmente.

El último préstamo que recibió fue D. S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, ésto le permite realizar compras en mayor volumen y por enD. mas cómodo en abarrotes todo al por mayor, arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite y bebidas gaseosas que tiene buena salida en estos meses. 

Felicita a Manuela Ramos por la facilidad D. los préstamos, y recomienda a sus amigas que saquen solo lo necesario y que esté a su alcance, para no demorarse en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
JOVITA RAMÍREZ D. P., 65, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("the Fortress"). She lives in the Calleria district with her husband who is retired. They have five children. Jovita runs a small general store out of her home. The first loan that she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos (300 soles) was used to solidify her store, because before the loan she had to buy supplies daily, and after the loan, she could restock every week. The loan that she is requesting now (1300 soles) will allow her to purchase groceries wholesale (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, soda) that have a quick turnaround. Jovita is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing loans, and to her friends she recommends to borrow only what they need and what they can pay back comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and sodas to restock store

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
CLARA RAMÍREZ D. CÁRDENAS, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. 15 D. Julio N° 340 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 48 años, 02 hijos, su esposo es contador público en esta ciudad.
Ella trabaja en el rubro D. confección con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró telas, hilos y otros, para un contrato D. vestidos que tubo.
Con el préstamo que D. S/. 1,500. Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra, al por mayor D. telas, hilos, blondas, botones, cierres y otros para los vestidos que ella misma diseña, al gusto del cliente, su negocio ha crecido y tiene 2 ayudantes, D. ese modo está creando nuevos puestos D. trabajo, para sus vecinas y amigas que necesitan una labor.
Está muy contenta con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda, no le exigen demasiados requisitos y el préstamo es rápido, hasta el momento le está yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
CLARA RAMÍREZ D. CÁRDENAS, 48, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Calleria with her husband, who is an accountant. They have two children. Clara is a seamstress. The first loan that Clara received (300 soles) was used to purchase fabric, thread and other supplies to fulfill a contract to make dresses. Clara is now requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be invested in purchasing wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other supplies for the custom-maD. dresses her clients request. Her business has grown so much that Clara has hired two assistants. She is already creating jobs for her friends and neighbors who need one. Clara is very happy about with the support that Kiva partner Manuela Ramos provides: the requirements are not overbearing, and loans come through quickly. Everything is going well at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Mukhtayar Faqir Hussain Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayar baji is the wife of F. H. who has a food selling business. Mukhtayar baji has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is the mother of nine kids: five sons and four daughters. Her first two sons run a barber shop. The others are getting their education from a school near their house. Mukhtayar baji has a business sewing clothes. She does this to share the financial burden of her husband. Mukhtayar baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy ingredients(lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her husband’s food selling business. 

Mukhtayar baji is the group leader of another three women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shahnaz sultana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rehana kosar baji wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food selling business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO P. RAMÍREZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. Mariano Melgar Mz. 142 Lt. 5 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 47 años, 03 hijos, su cónyuge se dedica la construcción civil.
Está trabajando desde hace 6 anos con Manuela Ramos, y su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, invirtió en la compra de pollo y su crianza, un negocio que es rentable pero tiene algunos inconvenientes, por lo que hoy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Una tienda que está bien surtida tiene buena clientela, por ello el préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertiriá en surtir su tienda con una lista de productos que le faltan, y con productos de primera necesidad, que tienen rápida salida, así como bebidas.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la confianza y rapidez con que salen los préstamos, y que estos van aumentando a medida que uno requiera, además por las capacitaciones que dan en cuanto a ventas, atención al cliente entre otros.
texts.en:
CONSUELO P. RAMÍREZ, 47, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Yarinacohca with her husband, who is a construction worker. They have three children. Consuelo has been working with Kiva partner Manuel Ramos for six years. The first loan she received (300 soles) was used to buy chickens to raise. This business was profitable, but had some disadvantages. Today, Consuelo has a small grocery store. A well-stocked store attracts a large clientele, so Consuelo is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to stock her store with many products, including staple food products, which have a quick turnaround. and sodas. Consuelo thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for trusting her, for providing loans fast, and for the training she has received on sales and customer service, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple food products to stock general store

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
GLORIA AMPARO H. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. 28 de Julio Mz. 63 Lt. 10 Barrio Nuevo – Tushmo del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 53 años, 05 hijos, su esposo se encuentra actualmente convaleciente, debido a un accidente.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, le sirvió para comprar un poco de abarrotes y algunas verduras que los ofreció en su casa y así empezó su negocio que con el tiempo fue incrementándose.

El préstamo de S/.2,100.00 Nuevos Soles,  ha planeado invertir en compra de abarrotes la mitad y la otra mitad en una actividad que realiza todos los fines de semana, venta de pollos a la parrilla en Yarinacocha, una actividad muy rentable, con el que está sosteniendo su casa. 

Comenta que a Manuela Ramos le debe mucho, ya que prácticamente ha salvado la vida de su cónyuge, que cuando tuvo el accidente si no hubiera sido por un préstamo que le dieron no le habría sido posible comprar los medicamentos a tiempo.
texts.en:
GLORIA AMPARO H. P., 53, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Yarinacocha with her husband, who is recovering from an accident. They have five children. The first loan that she received (300 soles) was used to purchase a few basic products and vegetables that she began selling at her home. This was the beginning of a business that has kept on growing. Gloria is requesting a new loan for 2,100 soles. She will use half of the loan to purchase products to stock her store, and the other half to invest in cooking and selling grilled chicken. This weekend activity has proven very profitable, and she is able to support her household. Gloria is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. She says that her husband's life was saved when she received a loan to purchase medicine for her husband after the accident.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock grocery store, purchase chickens to cook and sell.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
MIRNA F. REÁTEGUI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su domicilio está ubicado en el AA.HH. Barrio Unido Mz B Lt 11 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, cuatro hijos, su esposo es estibador.

Hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, esto le ayudo a incrementar su capital para la compra de pollos, los cuales los comercializa luego en el mercado y a sus caseras en diferentes puntos de esta ciudad.

El préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, con el compraría pollos en los caseríos y traerlos a la ciudad para su venta es una actividad que le ha resultado rentable a ella, pero que también requiere bastante atención.

Está contenta con Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que ha recibido, no ha sido grandes cantidades, pero si ha sido valioso.
texts.en:
MIRNA F. REÁTEGUI, 36, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the Manantay district. Her husband is a cargo handler and they have four children. A year ago, Mirna received her first loan (300 soles), to purchase chickens which she later sold at the market and at other locations around the town. She is requesting a new loan of 1,000 soles to purchase chickens on the outskirts of town and bring them into town to be sold. This activity has proven profitable for her, but it also requires much time and attention. Mirna is happy with the support fro Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. The loans have been small, but valuable.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens to be sold in town

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
JULIA CÁRDENAS P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. Unión N° 401 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 38 años, 04 hijos que aun continúan estudiando a excepción del primero, su esposo se dedica al comercio de madera.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inicio su negocio de abarrotes, no fue mucho, pero si lo necesario para comprar un poco de verduras y algunos abarrotes.

El préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello comprará productos para sus abarrotes todo al por mayor, arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite y todo lo necesario para que su negocio se vea completo. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su facilidad con los préstamos, y haberle dado la oportunidad para surgir y salir adelante.
texts.en:
JULIA CÁRDENAS P., 38, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the Callería district with her husband, who sells wood. They have four children; three still live at home and go to school. Julia's first loan (300 soles) was used to start a small grocery store. It was not much, but she was able to buy basic products and vegetables to sell. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 soles, to purchase wholesale products like rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and others. Julia is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing easy access to credit and for giving her the opportunity to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wholesale rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. to stock grocery store

loans.name: Kosar Bano M. Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Kosar bano baji is a 29 year old married lady who has lived Lahore, Pakistan for the past 28 years. Kosar baji is married to M. N., who has a decorative embroidery business. He prepares embroidered dresses and sells them at the clothing markets. Kosar baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are enrolled in school and getting an education. Kosar bano baji has a wish to give her children a good future but without education it is impossible. So, she sells bangles because they are popular with women who want to wear them for occasions and every day. She is applying for a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. 

Kosar bano baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Bilquis baji and Khursheed baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy another snooker table for her game shop. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Ghazala baji wants a loan to buy vehicles spare parts to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.es:
Julie es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Julie es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Julie vende licor de caña que reparte a tiendas, negocios, en algunas oportunidades sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente, el licor lo adquiere en la ciudad de Andahuaylas.
Julie necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licor de caña.
Los sueños de Julie son comprar una casa, tener su negocio en un local propio.
texts.en:
Julie is a member of the Willows Community Bank. Julie is married, is 40 years old, and has 3 children. She sells sugar cane liquor (rum) that she distributes to stores and businesses. Sometimes her sales are on credit and are covered every week. She buys the liquor in the city of Andahuaylas. Julie needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar cane liquor. Her dreams are to buy a house and to have a business in her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar cane liquor

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Nuñez Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Núñez esta conformado por María P. Núñez y Milagro del Socorro Z. P. ambas poseen las mismas actividades económicas como la venta de comida la edad de Doña María es de  61 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña María nos cuenta que la ayuda de los financiamientos ha obtenido buenos resultados y se encuentra satisfecha ya que no ha sigo una gran cantidad pero con esto ha podido salir adelante. En cambio la Joven Milagro tiene 28 años de edad. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como lo es la elaboración de comida. Ya que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de granos básicos, carnes y otros. La cantidad que solicitan ambas es de C$ 2.500 córdobas cada una.
texts.en:
The Solidary Group Núñez is made up of María P. Núñez y Milagro del Socorro Z. P.. Both sell food. Ms. María is 61 years old and is single. She has said that this funding has given her good results, and she is satisfied since she hasn’t taken many loans, but she has still been able to go forward. On the other hand, the young Milagro is 28 years old. She has spent more than four years making food. This money is for capital for work, which she needs to buy basic grains, meats, and other things. They are asking for C$ 2,500 córdobas each.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Katti Olga

texts.es:
Katti es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Katti es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Katti tenia un salón de belleza que cerró porque estaba estudiando docencia, Katti tiene proyectado reabrir su negocio e implementar con el servicio de locutorio. Katti vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Katti necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra del locutorio.
Los sueños de Katti son terminar su carrera, obtener su titulo profesional, tener un salón de belleza bien equipado y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Katti is a member of the Willows Community Bank. She is married, is 36 years old, and has 2 children. Katti has a beauty salon, which was closed because she was studying teaching. Katti aims to reopen her business and also have a calling center there. Katti sells cosmetics through catalogues. Katti needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will be invested to pay for the calling center. Her dreams are to finish her career, earn a professional degree, have a well-equipped beauty salon, and offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a calling center

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Teofila es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Teofila es Técnica Dental, tiene un laboratorio dental en su casa, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleados, brinda servicios a diferentes consultorios dentales.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de material dental.
Los sueños de Teofila son que su hija tenga una buena educación, mejorar el local de su laboratorio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Willows Community Bank. She is single, is 23 years old and has one child. Teofila is a dental technician. She has a dental laboratory in her house, and she has two employees. She offers different dental consulting services. Teofila needs a loan for 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of dental supplies. Her dreams are for her daughter to have a good education, to improve the setting for her laboratory and to have financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dental supplies

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: BENJAMIN TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, CUENTA CON INMUEBLE PROPIO EN DONDE VIVE CON SU ESPOSA GLENDA DE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y SU HIJITA CAROLINA DE  2 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE. BENJAMIN SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SUS SERVICIOS EN EL RUBRO DEL TRANSPORTE COMO TAXISTA, CUENTA CON BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, SU ESPOSA VENDE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA POR CATALOGO. GRACIAS A LA ANTIGÜEDAD QUE TIENE EN EL RUBRO Y LA BUENA ADMINISTRACION DE SUS INGRESOS, EL CLIENTE LOGRO TODO EL PATRIMONIO CON EL QUE CUENTA A LA FECHA. EL CREDITO FUE PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA, EN DONDE PLANIFICO MEJORAR EL PISO DE SU VIVIENDA, CUYO PRESUPUESTO ES $US 1.500.-, EL YA CONTABA CON $US 500.- DE EFECTIVO Y EL SALDO FALTANTE FUE LO QUE SOLICITO. ES EL TERCER CREDITO AL QUE ACCEDE Y EN TODO EL TIEMPO QUE TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS SIEMPRE DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD EN EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 31 years old. He has his own home where he lives with his wife Glenda, 30, and his young daughter Carolina, 2. Benjamin works as a taxi driver and has quite a lot of experience in this. His wife sells beauty products by catalog. Thanks to the length of time he has been working and good management of his income, he has been able to achieve what he currently has in assets. This loan is for home improvements and he plans to make improvements to the floor, which will cost US $1,500. He has US $500 and is requesting a loan for the rest. This is his third loan and in all the time he has worked with Fundación Agrocapital he has always proven to be responsible and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Parveen Siddique Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 45 year old married lady who has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. Parveen baji married S. M., who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji is the mother of one son whose name is Riaz M. and he runs a boutique. Parveen baji helps her son in his boutique by preparing embroidered dresses which her son displays in his boutique. Parveen baji did not learn this art from anyone, but believes it was a gift from God. Her son feels proud to be her son. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy materials (clothes, colored thread and sketches) for her son’s boutique. 

Parveen baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Adfarina baji wants a loan to buy cricket products (bat & ball) to sell. Mussarat zareen baji and Alvina baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe making business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for boutique.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Martina es conviviente, tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, Martina tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende verduras. Además Martina compra leña de los productores que luego vende a diferente hornos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Martina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Martina son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación al ultimo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the Willows Community Bank. Martina has a partner, is 59 years old, and has 5 children. She has a stand in the Magdalena Market where she sells vegetables. Also, Martina buys firewood from the producers and later sells it to different people with ovens in the city of Ayacucho. Martina needs this loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested to buy firewood. Her dreams are to improve her business and to offer a good education to the last of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Brigida De

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE BRIGIDA ESTA COMPUESTA DE DOS PERSONAS ELLA Y SU HIJA DE 15 AÑOS DE EDAD. BRIGIDA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA FIJA DE LA EMPRESA SOBOLMA EN EL CARGO DE AYUDANTE DE GUILLOTINA, ADICIONALMENTE Y CON LA AYUDA DE SU HIJA COMERCIALIZA TODO TIPO DE DULCES Y GOLOSINAS FUERA DE UN KINDER QUE FUNCIONA EN EL LOCAL DE LA CRUZ ROJA. LA COMPETENCIA ES MEDIA  YA QUE EN LA ZONA  HAY OTRAS PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN  A LAS MISMAS ACTIVIDADES. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO COMO CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN SU NEGOCIO DE DULCES. ESTA ES SU CUARTA OPERACIÓN DE BRIGIDA EN LA INSTITUCION CON UN BUEN CUMPLIMIENTO DE PAGO EN TODAS LAS ANTERIORES.
texts.en:
Brigada's family consists of two people, Brigada and her 15 year old daughter. Brigada is a full time employee of the Sobolma company. She works as an assistant paper cutter. Additionally, with her daughter's help she sells all kinds of sweets and candies . She sells them outside of a kindergarten that is taught on the premises of the local Red Cross. There is an average amount of competition because there are other people selling the same things in that area. The loan would be used as working capital for her sweets business. This is Brigida's fourth transaction with the institution, and she has a good history of paying back her previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lillian Maria

texts.es: Lillian María Z. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica  a la que Doña Lillian se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio ya que inicio con muy poco inventario pero poco a poco con la ayuda de una amiga decidió solicitar un financiamiento y fue así que su negocio logro prosperar. Los propósitos de Doña Lillian son de mantener siempre activo su negocio ya que es la base fundamental para su manutención. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de carne, gaseosas, golosinas y otros. Los deseos de Doña Lillian son de convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 14.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Lillian María Z. is 44 years old and is single. The economic activity that Lillian does for a living is that she has a small grocery store. For the past four years she has had this business, which began with very little inventory but little by little with the help of a friend she decided to apply for a loan and it was through this that her business has been able to prosper. Lillian's objectives are keep her business always active as it is the fundamental way that she supports herself. The loan that she is applying for will be used for working capital to purchase meat, soft drinks, sweets and other things. Lillian's wish is to turn her small grocery store into a distributor. The amount that she is requesting is C$ 14.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nelly De

texts.es: NELLY ES UNA SEÑORA MAYOR QUE YA TIENE A TODOS SUS HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD E INDEPENDIENTES, ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN LA CASA DE UNA DE SUS HIJAS. TRABAJA COMO OPERARIA DE COSTURA EN UNA SASTRERIA DE LA ZONA, ADICIONALMENTE EN SU DOMICILIO REALIZA TODO TIPO DE CONFECCIONES Y ARREGLOS DE VESTIMENTAS DE MANERA PARTICULAR. LA COMPETENCIA ES MEDIA EN SUS ACTIVIDADES. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN NUEVO TELEVISOR. ESTA SERA SU TERCERA OPERACION DE CREDITOS CON LA INSTITUCION, LAS  ANTERIORES LAS CANCELO CON TOTAL NORMALIDAD.
texts.en:
Nelly is an older lady and her children are grown and live independently. Right now she lives in the home of one of her daughters. She works as a sewing machine operator in a tailoring shop. She also makes confections and alters clothing in her home. There is some competition in her activities. The loan will be used to buy a new television set. This is her third loan with this institution, having repaid the others on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television

loans.name: Vivian Harlen

texts.es: LA SRA. VIVIAN HARLEN TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA,TIENE UNA HIJA QUE VIVE CON ELLA, CUENTA CON CASA PROPIA. LA SRA. VIVIAN HARLEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES DE YAMBAL Y AVON POR TODA LA CIUDAD HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO POR LO QUE CONOCE BIEN EL NEGOCIO. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA EN LA ZONA YA QUE ELLA CUENTA CON CLIENTES FIJOS QUE LE HACEN LOS PEDIDOS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE OPERACION YA QUE TIENE VARIOS PEDIDOS POR REALIZAR. LA CLIENTA HA TENIDO ALGUNAS FALLAS EN SU ANTERIOR CREDITO POR PROBLEMAS CON SU VEHICULO QUE LO TRABAJA SU ESPOSO, ADEMAS EL MONTO DESEMBOLSADO EN EL ANTERIOR CREDITO ERA MAS ALTO, PERO DESPUÉS CUMPLIO CON NORMALIDAD SUS CUOTAS.
texts.en:
Vivian Harlen is 30 years old, married and lives with her daughter in their own house. Vivian Harlan has worked selling Yambal and Avon cosmetics and perfumes for quite some time. She sells all over the city, so her business is fairly well known. The competition in the area is low, so she has a fixed clientele that makes orders. This loan is for the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes to increase her operational capital, as she has many orders to fill. The client had some failures in previous credit due to problems with the vehicle her husband uses for work, but the amount of that credit was higher and she was able to complete payments normally.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: REMBERTO TIENE 26 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERO, NO TIENE HIJOS Y VIVE EN SU PROPIO DOMICLIO. SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS CON SU PROPIA VAGONETA EN EL AREA URBANA EL MISMO QUE PERTENECE A UN SINDICATO DE TRANSPORTE "OBISPO SANTISTEVAN". CUENTA CON MAS DE 4 AÑOS EN EL RUBRO DEL TRANSPORTE. SIENDO SU ACTIVIDAD ESTABLE DURANTE TODA LA EPOCA DEL AÑO POR CONTAR CON PARADA FIJA, DE FORMA QUE LA COMPETENCIA NO LE AFECTA. EL CREDITO LO DESTINO PARA ARREGLOS EN SU VAGONETA Y LA COMPRA DE MEDIO PAQUETE DEL MOTOR. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2007, CON 3 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, LA MISMA QUE TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS
texts.en:
Remberto is 26 years old. He is single, with no children, and lives on his own. He works transporting passengers in his own minibus in the area. He belongs to the transportation union Obispo Santistevan. He's been working in transportation for more than four years. He has steady work throughout the year because he has a spot at a taxi stop, so he's not affected by competition. He will invest his loan in repairs to his minibus and the purchase of a motor package. He's been a client since 2007, and has made punctual payments on his three loans with the organization. He also has experience with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his minibus

loans.name: Razia M. Ilyas Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 39 year old married lady and citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years. Razia baji married a M. I., who drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has 5 years of experience. Razia baji has six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son has a utensils selling business. The others are getting their education from a school near their house. Razia baji’s first two daughters have a sewing clothes business. Razia baji taught them how to sew clothes, and now her daughters can independently sew clothes. Razia baji saves her daughters' income and plans to marry them off when she collects enough. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to help them sew clothes. 

Razia baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Another Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Nazia baji and Maqsoodan baji each want a loan to buy clothes for clothes selling businesses. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes López tiene 53 años, su estado civil casada. Doña Mercedes tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Mercedes es la elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales, hielo y bolsitas. Hace más de catorce años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que cada día busca el objetivo de enfrentar los gastos del hogar y tratar de mejorar cada día económicamente. Los propósitos de Doña Mercedes son de ampliar su negocio ya que le gustaría comprar una refrigeradora y elaborar más productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son de contar siempre con la ayuda de los financiamientos ya que estos son de gran ayuda para ellos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mercedes López is 53 years old and is married. Mercedes has three children, all of whom work. Mercedes' economic activity is the production and sale of natural drinks, ice and little bags of beverages. She has worked on this business for more than fourteen years and everyday seeks her objective to confront her household expenses and try to improve economically. Mercedes' goal is to expand her business as she would like to purchase a refrigerator and produce more products. The loan is for working capital as she has to invest in the purchase of more products for her business. Her wish is to always be able to rely on the help of loans as these are of great help for them. The amount that she is requesting is C$ 5.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celia Irma

texts.es: CELIA IRMA TIENE 26 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ZONA  COSMOS 79, DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS ATRÁS. CELIA TRABAJA EN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO QUE ES E SU PROPIEDAD, CLARO QUE LA CASA DONDE SE UBICA EL NEGOCIO ES DE SUS PADRES. CUENTA CON 6 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, CELIA OFRECE UN EXCELENTE TRATO A SUS CLIENTES Y RESPONSABILIDAD, SU TIENDA DE BARRIO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PLENA AVENIDA PRINCIPAL DE LA ZONA. EL CREDITO SERÁ DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE LLANTAS PARA SU MOVILIDAD. CELIA NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURO DE INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Celia Irma is 26 years old, married and has been living with her family in the Cosmos 79 zone of La Paz for the past 6 years. Celia works in her own local shop, which of course is in her parents’ house. She has 6 years of experience and whilst there is competition in the market, Celia treats her customers well and responsibly. Her shop is right on the main avenue in the area. The loan will be used to buy tyres for her vehicle. Celia does not have a bad risk or credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tyres for her vehicle

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: RUBEN DARIO DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD SE ENCUENTRA CASADO, SU ESPOSA (32 AÑOS) ES LA CODEUDORA DEL CRÉDITO. LA PAREJA VIVE EN CASA QUE ES PROPIA JUNTO A SUS 2 HIJOS. RUBEN TIENE INGRESO COMO ALBAÑIL CON BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN LA ZONA Y SU ESPOSA TRABAJA EN SU VENTA DE ABARROTES. ACTUALMENTE HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA DE ALBAÑIL POR LO TANTO TIENE BUENOS INGRESOS Y LA VENTA DE ABARROTES ES LA UNICA EN EL BARRIO. EL CREDITO ES PARA AMPLIACION DE SU VENTA DE ABARROTES YA QUE TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA POR LOS VECINOS. ESTA PAREJA SON EXCELENTES CLIENTES EN LA INSTITUCION Y NO TIENEN CREDITO EN OTRA INSTITUCION FINANCIERA.
texts.en:
Ruben Dario is 33-years-old and married. His wife is 32-years-old and will co-sign the loan. The couple lives in their own home, together with their two children.

Ruben makes a living as a builder and has considerable experience in the area. Since there is currently quite a demand for his work, he makes a good income. His wife runs the only grocery store in the neighbourhood.

This loan will be used to expand their grocery sales since there is plenty of demand. They are excellent clients of Agrocapital and do not have any loans with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for grocery sales

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: JULIA  DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN LA ZONA ROMERO PAMPA, JUNTO A SU FAMILIA, DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS ATRÁS. JULIA TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO DONDE VENDE ABARROTES, POR OTRA PARTE COMERCIALIZA EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DESDE HACE 18 AÑOS ATRÁS, POR LO QUE CUENTA CON BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. POR OTRA PARTE SU ESPOSO ES TRANSPORTISTA PROPIETARIO CON EXPERIENCIA DE 2 AÑOS. EN LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES COMERCIALIZA "AZUCAR, ARROZ, FIDEO, HARINA BLANCA Y OTROS". SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, JULIA CON EL BUEN TRATO QUE DA A LOS CLIENTES Y SU EXPERIENCIA HACEN FRENTE AL MISMO. SU PUESTO DE VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN PLENA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. JULIA DESTINARÁ EL CREDITO A LA COMPRA DE UN MOTOR PARA EL MINIBUS DE SU ESPOSO. JULIA NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURO DE INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Julia is 33 years old and has lived in the Romero Pampa area with her family for four years. Julia has her own business where she sells groceries, and she has also sold at various city markets for the past 18 years, so she has plenty of experience in this field. Her husband has two years of experience as a driver. In the grocery store, they sell sugar, rice, noodles, white flour and other items. There is, of course, competition in this market, but with her good customer service and experience, Julia holds her own. Her sales post is in the main plaza. Julia will use the loan to buy an engine for her husband's minibus. Julia has no bad history in the Risk Center nor the Infocred Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase engine for minibus

loans.name: Uzma Khanum Ahmad Ali Group

texts.en:
Uzma khanum baji is a 34 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 11 years. Uzma baji completed her education until 10th standard, but she couldn’t study further because her parents married her off to A. A. who is a tailor with 5 years of experience. Uzma khanum baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are enrolled in a school which is near their home. Uzma baji is also involved in a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and relatives. She charges $2 per dress. She uses her income to pay off the school fees for her kids, because her husband bears the household expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so that he is able to sew more clothes. 

Uzma baji is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shazia tabassum baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Gulshan majid baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy books for her book shop. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto mayor de edad con 47 años, vive en la Avenida Florida, se encuentra casado, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en taxi. Trabaja con una movilidad que es de su propiedad. Roberto trabaja para su esposa y sus dos hijos. Tiene una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. La familia vive en casa que es propia.El destino del crédito es para inversión en su movilidad. No tiene antecedentes negativos.
texts.en:
Roberto, at the old age of 47, lives on Avenida Florida and is married. He works as a taxi driver, and owns his own cab. Roberto works for his wife and their two children. He has 10 years of experience in this field. The family lives in a house that they own. The loan will be used to invest in his cab. He has no negative credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: El grupo " Gardenias " esta representado por la señora Elena María y compuesta por 14 miembros los cuales residen en la misma zona. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) se dedica al comercio D. productos como los abarrotes, cosméticos, celulares, peluquería, refrescos, comida, zapatos, verduras y a actividades como el transporte público D. pasajeros.  A pesar D. la competencia que existe en el mercado las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y las ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y D. esa forma brindar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. debido a trabajos anteriores en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, todos los socios (as) saben el manejo D. los fondos así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para un financiamiento.
texts.en:
The "Gardenias" group is represented by Elena María and consists of 14 members who live in the same area. The majority of the members work selling products like groceries, cosmetics, cell phones, hair care, soft drinks, food, shoes and vegetables, as well as activities like public transport. Despite the competition in the market, the partners know how to succeed thanks to their experience and their drive to get their families ahead. The funding will be used for the purchase of materials, inputs and tools to improve their incomes and thus give their families a better quality of life. Most of the partners have experience in solidarity groups in their previous work with institutions just like Fundación Agrocapital. All of the members know how to manage the funds and understand the necessary responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Jose Celestino

texts.es: Don Jose Celestino es un pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado al cultivo de arroz secano, junto a un hijo atiende la actividad productiva y su esposa se dedica al cuido de sus 3 hijos menores que asisten a 4to y 6to grado de primaria; don Jose diariamente muy temprano acuda a su jornada en sus areas de cultivo, es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria COPACSELES, a traves de la cual estaria participando en la construccion de un trillo arrocero que le permitiria obtener mejores ganancias de sus cultivos, siendo este un sueño proximo a cumplirse, para lo cual el solicita este credito y asi accesar a este colectivo como socio del trillo de arroz.
texts.en:
Jose Celestino is a small agricultural producer devoted to the cultivation of rainfed rice. He carries out this work along with his son, and his wife takes care of their three younger children who attend fourth through sixth grade in primary school. Every day, Jose goes to his planting area very early. He is a member of the agricultural cooperative COPACSELES, where he would take part in the construction of a rice threshing machine, which would allow him to obtain a better wage from his crops, making a dream close to reality. He seeks this loan so that as a member of this group he can have access to the thresher.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribution for thresher construction

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: FRANCISCO DE 58 AÑÓS DE EDAD, SE ENCUENTRA CASADO. SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS EN TAXI. PERTENECE A LA COOPERATIVA DE TRANSPORTE OBISPO ESTEBAN, ES DECIR SE ENCUENTRA AFILIADO A LA MISMA. ÉL ES PROPIETARIO DE LA MOVILIDAD QUE CONDUCE. LA FAMILIA VIVE EN UNA CASA QUE ES PROPIA, SU FAMILIA CONSTA DE ÉL SU ESPOSA Y SUS 2 HIJOS (HOMBRE Y MUJER). FRANCISCO TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 24 AÑOS EN EL RUBRO DEL TRANSPORTE POR LO QUE LA COMPETENCIA NO ES MUY RELEVANTA PARA EL DESARROLLO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA USO PERSONAL. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years old and married. He works as a taxi driver. He belongs to the transport cooperative Obispo Esteban. He is the owner of the cab he drives. His family, which consists of his wife and their son and daughter, lives in a house they own. Francisco has 24 years of experience in this field, so competition is not an issue for his business. This loan is for personal use. He does not have any negative history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Umm-E-Kalsoom M. Younas Group

texts.en:
Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is 45 years old, married, and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady, as she couldn’t get an education because of her parents meagre financial resources. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is married to M. Y., who has an artificial jewelry making business. He has had this business for the past 10 years. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. All of her kids are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji has a dream to see her children in a good position. To fulfill her dream she helps her husband in his jewelry making business, so that her husband sells more jewelry in the famous bazaars of Lahore and earns a good income. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (beads) for her husband’s jewelry making business. 

Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is the group leader of another four women from her locality. Sakina baji and Rehana baji and Samina baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines to sew clothes. Shafqat baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for jewelry making.

loans.name: Jesus De Coña Coña Group

texts.es: El grupo " Jesus de coña Coña " esta representado por la señora Lilian y compuesto por 13 miembros los cuales residen en la misma zona. Una mayoría de los socios (as) se dedica al comercio de productos como  venta de repuestos de auto, proveedora de mercaderia Uyuni, libreria, material medico, reposteria, CD, ropa y cosmeticos.  A pesar de la competencia que existe en el M. las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y las ganas de sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremneto de mercaderia  y la compra de materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y de esa forma brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a trabajos anteriores en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, todos los socios (as) saben el manejo de los fondos asi como la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir con su obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Jesus de Coña Coña" group is represented by Lilian and is composed of 13 members who live in the same area. The majority of the members sell products like auto parts, Uyuni souvenirs, books, medical materials, baked goods, CDs, clothing and cosmetics. Despite the competition in the market, the partners know how to succeed thanks to their experience and their drive to get their families ahead. This loan will be used to increase merchandise and purchase materials, inputs and tools to improve their incomes and thus provide a better quality of life for their families. Most of the partners have previous work experience with solidarity groups with institutions like Fundación Agrocapital. All of them know how to manage funds and understand the responsibility required to make their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Maria Zulema

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ZULEMA ES BUENA CLIENTE, CUMPLIDA CON SUS PAGOS, DESPUES DE UN TIEMPO LA SRA. HA DECIDIO SACAR ESTE CREDITO DE FORMA CUIDADOSA, MIDIENDO ELLA MISMA SU CAPACIDAD. LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA DOS DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA MANTIENE A SU HOGAR, ESTA SEPARADA Y SOLO TIENE A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y JUNTO A SU PADRE, QUIEN LE COLABORA, MANTENIENDOSE CON EL PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO, ES UNA FAMILIA MUY UNIDA. ANTERIORMENTE ELLA SUFRIO UN ROBO DE MAQUINARIA  PERJUDICANDOLE EN GRAN MEDIDA, PERO PASADO EL TIEMPO HA LOGRADO RECUPERARSE Y SUPERARSE,  HASTA EL PUNTO DE TENER CONTRATOS E INGRESOS SEGUROS.  EL ANHELO DE ESTA FAMILIA ES DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UN PROPIA VIVENDA.
texts.en:
Zulema is a good client that has repaid her loans. After some time, she has decided to request this loan, herself carefully measuring her capacity to repay. This is her second individual loan. She supports her household; she is separated and takes care of her small, school aged daughter as well as her father, who helps her with the business. Together they are a very close family. Previously, she suffered a robbery of her machinery, which greatly harmed her, but with the passage of time has managed to recover and overcome this harm to the point of having contracts and secure income. The desire of this family is to get ahead and have their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of khaki and rainproof fabric

loans.name: Karina
