texts.es: KARINA DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES. NO TIENE DEPENDIENTES O HIJOS. PARALELAMENTE A SUS ESTUDIOS ELLA SE DEDICA A COMERCIALIZAR ARTICULOS DE USO PERSONAL COMO MAQUILLAJE, JOYAS Y OTROS. CON LOS INGRESOS QUE GENERA ESTA ACTIVIDAD AYUDA CON LOS GASTOS EN SU CASA Y TAMBIÉN LE SIRVEN PARA PAGAR SUS ESTUDIOS. TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 3 AÑOS EN ESTE RUBRO. Y SI BIEN LA COMPETENCIA ES ELEVADA LA DEMANDA ES IGUAL YA QUE SU PRINCIPAL MERCADO ES EL FEMENINO. EL PRESENTE CRÉDITO ES PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old, single, and currently lives in her parents' home. She does not have any dependents or children. Along with her studies, she sells personal products like makeup, jewelry and other goods. With the income she generates, she helps with the household costs and also pays for her studies. She has three years of experience in this field. If the competition is high, the demand is equal, since her principal market is female. The current loan is to increase her merchandise. She does not have any negative history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Santa Rosa D. Lima",  presentan  como nexo consanguíneo la señora Nivery Nagako   y la  señora Maria Abigail son hermanas, pero tienen sus ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas hacen pan para vender y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras  se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, a la  elaboración D. muebles D. madera y a la venta D. comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su entusiasmo y experiencia. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar la calidad  D. los mismos para poder hacer frente a la competencia. Efectivamente las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos y fidelidad con su grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the Santa Rosas D. Lima Communal Bank present as a familial nexus Mrs. Nivery Nagako and Mrs. Maria Abigail. They're sisters, but their earnings are totally independent. The members of this bank carry out different activities: some make and sell bread, promote cosmetics, and make clothing. Others build wooden furniture and sell food. As in all commercial pursuits, there's always competition of supply and demand, but these partners know how to get ahead thanks to their enthusiasm and experience.

This loan will help them diversify their products and to purchase the supplies and materials needed to improve these products in order to better compete. These partners have experience in solidarity groups and are now in their second cycle with our institution, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments and fidelity within their group.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Bismarck  es un joven trabajador que se desempeña como comerciante de verdura en el mercado local, anteriormente obtuvo un crédito con el que logro repellar su casa, ahora espera ser beneficiado nuevamente con un credito para la construccion de una habitación y así mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar ya que el interés que presta AFODENIC es bajo, por esta razon le gusta trabajar con esta intancia, su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y bonita para su familia pues es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Bismarck is a young worker and he sells vegetables at the local market to support his family. He recently received a loan and he was able to put stucco on the outside of his house with the money. He is now asking for another loan so that he can add a room to his home. He wants to use the loan to better the life of his family. The interest rate for the loan through AFODENIC is low. Bismarck's biggest dream is to provide his family with a dignified home.

(Translated by Danny of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom

loans.name: Grupo Solidario La Honestidad Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario la Honestidad esta conformado por Doña Jahirinza Auxiliadora Bermúdez y Ana Maria L. ambas poseen diferentes actividades económica como Doña Jahirinza tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, su actividad económica es la comprar y venta de cosméticos hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que necesita invertir el financiamiento en capital de trabajo. Doña Ana se dedica a la venta y compra de prendas de plata hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que Doña Ana dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios pero con lo poco que obtenía no compraba lo suficiente es por eso que logra unirse con su amiga y solicitan el financiamiento para mantener activos sus negocios. la cantidad que solicita Doña Ana Maria es de C$4.300 cordobas y la cantidad que solicita Doña Jahirinza es deC$ 5.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
The "Solidario la Honestidad" Group is composed of Jahirinza Auxiliadora Bermúdez and Ana Maria L., each of whom have different economic activities. Jahirinza is 31 years of age and has 3 children who she supports. For more than 3 years her economic activity has been the purchase and sale of cosmetics which is why she needs to invest the loan in working capital. For more than 5 years Ana has worked buying and selling articles of silver. She started this business with her own funds but little by little she could not get enough, which is why she joined with a friend to apply for a loan to keep their businesses active. The amount that Ana Maria is requesting is C$4.300 cordobas and the amount that Jahirinza is requesting is C$ 5.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Manantiales Group

texts.es: Las socias de  la banca comunal "Manantiales", están representados por la señora Sonia y presentan un parentesco familiar entre la señora Asunta y Sonia que son hermanas, pero tienen ingresos independientes una de la otra, todas residen en el mismo barrio la Urbanización Gallito y el Recreo, tienen diferentes negocios algunos ya establecidos y otros ambulantes como la venta de cosméticos, pan, tienda de abarrotes y venta de comida, el socio participante es chofer con movilidad propia, todos tienen un movimiento económico diario. En cuanto a la competencia se puede decir que ellas están conscientes de la misma y saben como hacerle frente, comentan  que la administración del crédito, favorece para mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia. El crédito que se les otorgó esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas, para las promotoras aprovechar las ofertas  y el socio para participante para comprar repuestos para su movilidad. Efectivamente las socias comentan que ya tuvieron créditos anteriores  en otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación Agrocapital y a otras van cursando su segundo ciclo juntas por lo que cuentan con capacidad para ala administración de fondos así como la voluntad y honestidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the "Manantiales" communal bank are represented by Sonia. They include relatives--Asunta and Sonia are sisters--but they each have independent incomes. They all live in the same neighborhood, Urbanización Gallito and Recreo. They have different businesses, some established and some mobile, like the sale of cosmetics, bread, groceries and food. One of the partners is a driver with his own vehicle, so all of them have economical daily transport. As for the competition, they are well aware of it and know how to face it. The credit helps improve their business and improve the quality of life for their families. This loan will be used to supply their stores, take advantage of sales, and for the driver to purchase spare parts. The partners have had previous loans in other financial institutions similar to Agrocapital, and some of them are now in their second cycle together, so they have abilities in the administration of funding, as well as volunteerism and honesty to meet their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Las Estrellas",  esta representado por el señor Freddy Estik y presentan un parentesco familias entre la señora Felicia y la señora Ana María que son hermanas, pero que cuentan con ingreso totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas confeccionan y venden ropa interior en el mercado, venta en snack, comida y otras se dedican a lavar ropa a domicilio. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero los socios del grupo saben como manejarla gracias a su esfuerzo y a su experiencia para salir adelante. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos con materiales y maquinaria D. mejor calidad para hacer frente a la competencia. los socios (as) tienen experiencia trabajado con grupos solidarios en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital, por lo que conocen lo que se requiere para adquirir un financiamiento y poder darle a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The members of the "Las Estrellas" communal bank are represented by Freddy Estik, and incluD. family relations between Felicia and Ana María, who are sisters, but each of them has a completely independent income. The members of this bank have different activities--some make and sell underclothes at the market, some sell snacks and food, and others wash clothing at home. As in all fields, there exists competition in supply and demand, but these partners know how to manage it and get ahead thanks to their effort and experience. This loan will be used in the diversification of products, and for better quality materials and machinery to one-up the competition. The members have experience working in solidarity groups similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and they know what's required to obtain funding and be able to improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: El Quior Group

texts.es: El grupo "El Quior" esta representado por la señora Maria Ysabel y cuenta con un parentesco familiar entre la señora María y la señora Leticia ellas son primas pero ambas tienen su ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias del banco comunal se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como, venta D. comida, promotoras D. diferentes marcas D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrotes, artesanías  y al trasporte publico D. pasajeros. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero los socios (as) saben como salir adelante. El crédito otorgado esta destinado a ampliar el stock D. productos para sus negocios y a la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar la calida D. los mismos.  La mayoría D. las socias han trabajado con fundaciones o organizaciones financieras por la cual tienen experiencia en grupo solidarios y analizan las diferencias por lo cual ellas se encuentran el segundo ciclo y satisfechas con nuestro producto.
texts.en:
The "El Quior" group is represented by María Ysabel, and includes relatives--María and Leticia are cousins--but each has their own independent income. The members have different economic activities, including food sales, promotion of various cosmetic brands, groceries, handicrafts, and public transport. As in all fields, there is competition in supply and demand, but the partners know how to succeed. The loan will be used to increase product stocks for their businesses, as well as the purchase of materials and inputs to improve business quality. The majority of the members have worked in financial foundations or organizations befO., and thus have experience with solidarity groups. They analyzed their differences and are now in their second cycle, and they're satisfied with our product.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Justino Alonso

texts.es: El Señor Justino Alonso Narváez Méndez tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don Justino es la compra y venta de ropa en general. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, expresa que la misma necesidad lo ha impulsado a buscar una nueva fuente de ingresos ya que don Justino labora como mesero en el restaurante TIP- TOP por lo que el sueldo que gana no es lo suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos. Los propósitos de Don Justino son de mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio que posee para seguir manteniendo a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que se comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos. Sus deseos son de tener un hijo y poder darle educación escolar con el objetivo de salir siempre adelante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Justino Alonso Narváez Méndez is 38 years old and is married. Justino's economic activity is the purchase and sale of assorted clothing. For more than three years he has had this business and he says that need has motivated him to look for a new source of income as Justino works as a waiter in the TIP-TOP restaurant but with the salary he earns it is not enough to cover his expenses. Justino's intentions are to continue his economic activity as it is the only means that he has to continue supporting his family. The loan is for working capital with which he will buy clothing for ladies, gentlemen, children and cosmetics. His wish is to have a child and be able to give him an education so that he can get ahead. The amount that he is requesting is C$ 10.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es: Las socias D.  la banca comunal "Porvenir", están representadas por la señora Nievas todos los miembros del grupo se conocen entre si gracias a que residen en el mismo barrio.  Existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre carolina y Justina ellas son primas pero cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Las socias desempeñan diferentes actividades comerciales la mayoría D. ellas con negocios ya establecidos como tiendas D. abarrotes, venta D. ropa, comida, cosméticos y a diferentes actividades como el servicio mecánico y refinería D. aluminio, cada uno tiene ingresos diarios. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma es por esta razón que necesitan fondos para combatirla. El crédito que se les otorgó esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas, comprar material D. trabajo y compra D. herramientas para el mejor desempeño D. su funciones. Una mayoría D. las socias ya trabajaron en un primer ciclo en el cual demostraron honestidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Porvenir" are represented by Señora Nievas. All the members of the group know one another because they live in the same neighborhood. Carolina and Justina share a blood relationship; they are cousins but work with incomes totally independent of each other. The members carry out different commercial activities; the majority of them work with already established businesses like grocery stores, clothing sales, food, cosmetics, and other activities like mechanic service and metal refinery. Each one makes a daily income. With regard to the competition, they are aware of it and this is why they need financing to fight it. The loan is planned to be used to boost store stocks, buy work material, and purchase tools to improve fulfillment of services. The majority of the members worked in the first loan cycle and demonstrated honesty and responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Benturo

texts.es:
El socio Buenaventura; es natural del distrito de saylla, este distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro.

El socio Buenaventura, tiene 73 años de edad, él es casado y el ayuda a su esposa con su restaurante de chicharronería, mientras su esposa cocina y sirve los platos, el socio le ayuda con la atención de las mesas, él hace la función de mesero y se encarga personalmente de atender al público en el restaurante; El invertirá el dinero como capital de trabajo, el necesita comprar insumos para el restaurante.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado para así él poder seguir apoyando a su amada esposa, del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a native of Saylla, a district located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. He is 73 years old, married and helps his with with their restaurant specializing in fried pork rinds. While his wife cooks and serves the meals, Benturo helps her set up the tables and functions as a waiter. He is personally in charge of tending to customers in the restaurant. He will use the money as working capital and purchase ingredients for the restaurant. He is grateful and values the loan because it allows him to continue supporting his beloved wife. In the same sense, he promises to repay the loan in total in the agreed upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Imar Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Imar esta conformado por María Josefa E. y Mayra del Socorro R. Hernández ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como las siguientes Doña María tiene 43 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña María es brindar atención en un cafetín hace mas de siete años que se dedica a este negocio en el caso de Doña María su mas grande sueño es mejorar su propiedad ya que esta tiene muchos defectos que no ha podido mejorar. La Señora Mayra tiene la edad de 50 años, Doña Mayra tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Mayra es una pulpería. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y con la ayuda de su amiga María Josefa decidieron realizar financiamientos por lo que estos le proporcionaron la ayuda necesaria para salir adelante con sus negocios. Por lo que ahora ambas solicitan un financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así puedan invertir cada uno en sus negocios. La cantidad solicitada por Doña María Josefa es de C$ 4.000 córdobas y de su amiga Mayra del Socorro es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
The Imar Solidarity Group is made up of María Josefa E. and Mayra del Socorro R. Hernández, each of whom works in different economic activities. María is 43 years old and has 3 children. Maria's economic activity for more than seven years has been working at a cafe. In the case of María her biggest dream is to improve her property as it has many defects that she has not been able to improve. Mayra is 50 years of age and she has 3 children, all of whom work. Mayra's economic activity is a small grocery store. For more than 5 years she has worked on this business and with the help of her friend María Josefa they decided to apply for loans because these would provide them with the help necessary to advance with their businesses. This is why both of them are now applying for loans for working capital to be able to invest in their businesses. The amount requested by María Josefa is C$ 4.000 córdobas and her friend Mayra del Socorro requests C$ 10.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE,  ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA NUEVE DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE DE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MEDICAMENTOS, ELLA VIAJA A DISTINTAS FERIAS EN EL DEPARTAMENTO DE LA PAZ, JUNTO A SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE VITAMINAS, ANALGESICOS Y TONICOS RECONSTITUYENTES, SUEROS, ETC LLEVANDO LA VENTA BASICA DE MEDICAMENTOS A LUGARES POCO ACCESIBLES. LA SEÑORA Y SU ESPOSO TIENEN UNA HIJA EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SON CLIENTES DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD QUE TIENE EL ANHELO DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO, ESTAN CONSTRUYENDO SU POCO A POCO.
texts.en:
The Señora is an excellent client. This is her ninth individual loan. She works in the sale of medications. She travels to various fairs in the department of La Paz. She and her husband sell vitamins, analgesics and medical tonics and serums, etc., bringing the sale of basic medicines to places that are difficult to access. The Señora and her husband have a school-age daughter. They are clients with very good attitudes who are eager to better themselves and to have a better future, something they are building little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials for Her Home

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha, nació en el distrito de  saylla, este distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en auto.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, ella está casada y tiene 3 hijos de(17,14,12 años de edad); ella tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes, en el tercer paradero del distrito de saylla; la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder implementar su tienda, ella está a cargo de su tienda abarrotes desde hace 12 años.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y ella se compromete a pagar el total del préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member Martha was born in the Saylla district which is located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 40 years of age, is married, and has 3 children (17, 14, and 12 years of age); she has a small grocery store in the third region of the Saylla district. The member needs this loan to buy merchandise and, that way, to be able to improve her business. She has had her grocery store for 12 years.

The member is grateful for the granting of the loan and she promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to improve her grocery store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos; nació en el distrito de Saylla de la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 45 minutos de la misma ciudad en auto, carretera asfaltada.

El socio tiene 28 años de edad, el vive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos, (2 y 4 meses); el socio Juan Carlos, trabaja en la compra y venta de palos, troncos, madera; el viaja hasta la selva de Perú y alrededores en busca de palos para construcción, una ves encontrados el los compra y los transporta para su futura venta. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mayor número de palos y madera, para así poder abastecerse de mercadería para este año.

El socio agradece el préstamo adquirido para la realización de sus proyectos y valorando mucho el apoyo se compromete a la devolución del mismo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member Juan Carlos was born in the Saylla district in the province of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car via paved highway.

The member is 28 years of age, lives with his spouse and has 2 children (a 2 year-old and 4 month-old); the member Juan Carlos works in the purchase and sale of sticks, logs, wood. He travels to the jungle of Peru and its surrounding areas in search of sticks for construction. Once he finds them, he buys them and transports them for future sale. The member needs this loan to invest in the purchase of a larger number of sticks and wood so that he will be able to stock up on merchandise for this year.

The member is grateful for the loan for the realization of his projects and he values the support. He promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital for the wholesale purchase and sale of sticks

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
El Sr. Erasmo Q., llegó a las oficinas de Emprender por recomendación de un cliente antiguo, don Joaquin Nina Bautista, siendo ambos vecinos y familiares,
El Sr. Erasmo Q. no tiene deudas en el sistema financiero, es una persona joven, tiene dos hijos y una esposa que trabaja en construcción  como ayudante, tambien en otras actividades, para ayudar en el mantenimiento del hogar
Es su primer crédito en Emprender, tiene un transporte publico el cual consume mucha gasolina, por ello solicita el credito para cambiar a gas natural vehicular.
texts.en:
Señor Erasmo Q. came to the Emprender offices on the recommendation of a former client, don Joaquin Nina Bautista, his neighbor and relative.

Señor Erasmo Q. does not have any debts in the financial system. He is a young person with two children and a wife who works in construction as a helper and also in other activities to help support the household.

This is his first loan with Emprender. He works in public transportation which uses a lot of gasoline. It is for this that he requests a loan to convert his vehicle to natural gas.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert his vehicle to natural gas

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita, nació en el distrito de Saylla de la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 45 minutos de la misma ciudad en auto, carretera asfaltada.

Ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada; tiene 7 hijos, 6 de ellos mayores e independientes, ella aún vive con su menor hijo de 16 años y aún ella lo educa, nuestra socia  actualmente lleva a la ciudad de Puno fruta para vender y este viaje es muy pesado para ella, por lo que la socia desea comprar un pequeño terreno en el distrito de Saylla, para poder poner su negocio de venta de chicharrones (plato típico a base de chancho acompañado con papa doradas, choclo y ensalada).

La socia está muy feliz y agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y está comprometida a pagar el total de la deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member Margarita was born in the Saylla district in the province of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car via paved highway.

She is 49 years of age and is married. She has 7 children. 6 of them are adults and independent. She still lives with her youngest son who is 16 years old and even though she is educating him, our member currently brings fruit to the city of Puno to sell and this trip is very difficult for her. This is why this member wants to buy a small piece of property in the district of Saylla to be able to open her business selling "chicharrones" (a typical pork-based dish accompanied by golden potatoes, corn, and salad).

This member is very happy and grateful for the provision of the loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a small plot of land

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: Rosa Amanda López tiene 55 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Rosa tiene 5 hijos y todos sus hijos estudian y trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Rosa es la venta de comida. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio ella nos cuenta que ofrecer este tipo de servicio le gusta en negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y esta dirigida por ella personalmente. Los propósitos de Doña Rosa son de mejorar la calidad de sus comidas por lo que sus clientes buscan la buena comida. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para obtener las compras de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, leña y carbón. Los deseos de Doña Rosa son de darle las mejores condiciones a su negocio para que este se ampliara con la ayuda de los financiamientos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Rosa Amanda López is 55 and married. Doña Rosa has 5 children, all of whom study and work. Doña Rosa sells food for a living. She has done this for more than 12 years, and she tells us that she likes offering this type of service. Her business is located in her home and is managed by her personally. Her goals are to improve the quality of her food because her customers look for good food. This loan will go towards working capital so she can obtain basic grains, vegetables, meat, firewood, and charcoal. Her dreams are to improve her business so she can expand it with the help of these credits. She is requesting 10,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni, nació en el distrito de Saylla de la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 45 minutos de la misma ciudad en auto, carretera asfaltada.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad y es casada; ella tiene 2 hijos, (14 y 9) años de edad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, y un depósito de cervezas en su casa, ella está construyendo su casita en material noble con el dinero que le ingresa de su negocio de abarrotes y de la venta de las cervezas, ella invertirá el préstamo otorgado en la compra de mayor número de cajas de cerveza para tener mayor ingreso y así seguir mejorando su casa.


La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y está comprometida a pagar el total de la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member Marleni, born in the Saylla district in the province of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car via paved highway.

Our member is 33 years of age and is married. She has two children (14 and 9 years of age); she has a small grocery store and beer stand in her home. She is working on her home using quality materials with the money she earns through her grocery store and sale of beer. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a greater number of cases of beer to be able to increase her income and to continue improving her home.

The member is very grateful for the provided loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provisioning of her store and beer stand

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis acaba de cumplir 48 años de edad, convive por más de 26 años con la madre de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su actividad es la agricultura, heredó algunas chacras de su padre con plantas de granadilla, cultivos que no requiere de mucha inversión, ni fertilizantes, solo de abonos orgánicos; pero sus cosechas son perennes. Después de cada cosecha comercializa los productos, pero, solo eso no le es muy rentable, por ello que también cultiva ruda y otras hierbas para mate.  De ese modo cubre los estudios de sus hijos. Adicionalmente tiene un negocio de compra y venta de gasolina y petróleo, aprovechando la ubicación de su casa en la carretera central, sus clientes son los mismos chóferes de camiones de carga pesada, lo que le permite captar mayores ingresos. Desde entonces Luis se siente satisfecho de combinar la agricultura y su negocio de combustible porque le permite acumular mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar y la educación de su hijo. El es un cliente muy activo, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado responsablemente todas sus cuotas, es muy responsable con su banco comunal y está muy contento por los ahorros que deposita cada mes. Con el dinero que solicita va a incrementar la cantidad de combustible que vende, ya que sus clientes han aumentado en todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Luis just had his 48th birthday. For more than 26 years he has lived with the mother of his 4 children. One child still lives at home with them. His business is agriculture. He inherited some small farms from his father. Passion fruit grows on the farms. Cultivating them does not require much investment or fertilizer. He only uses organic manure. After every perennial harvest he sells the produce, but it is not very profitable for him. He therefore grows medicinal plants and other herbs for teas. This way he can pay for his children's studies. He also has another business. He buys and sells gasoline and petroleum products. He takes advantage of the location of his house, which is located on the central road. His customers drive heavy duty trucks, which increases his income. Luis is happy to combine agriculture and the petroleum business because it allows him to increase his earnings, which go toward his home and educating his children. He has been very active with MFP; this is his 5th loan. He has always made all of his payments responsibly. He is very conscientious with his community bank, and is pleased with the savings he deposits every month. His customers have increased with time, and with this loan he will grow his petroleum products business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increas the amount of petroleum products he sells

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 29 abriles, lleva conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 8 años, de los cuales tiene una hija de 7 años, viven en la casa heredada de sus suegros. Desde hace 8 años y todos los días se dedica pastar sus animales como: vacas, carneros y cabras, mientras que su esposo cultiva sus chacras, sembrando mayormente papas. En los días de cosecha Ana empieza a preparar el menú a las 5.00am hasta las 8.00am y en seguida acude a la chacra para recoger las papas, preparar la carga y finalmente comercializarla en el mercado. En esta época, a sus vacas las sujeta a una estaca y a los carneros los ata de las patas para evitar  que se dispersen y puedan perjudicar cultivos ajenos. Ana está muy contenta de criar animales y cultivar sus plantas, ahora quiere incursionar en la venta de leña, por contar con terrenos de muchos árboles, a lo que piensa sacarle ventaja y captar más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. La permanencia de Ana en MFP ha sido por 5 préstamos consecutivos, y en todo este tiempo a demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, está muy contenta con las políticas del banco comunal y tiene el cargo secretaria donde en cada reunión se encarga tomar apuntes en el libro de actas. Con el dinero que ha solicitado comprará fertilizantes para su chacra, así como corderos pequeños de buena raza, con la finalidad de que crezcan, engorden y los pueda revender a mejor precio para ganar mucho más de lo invertido.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. Ana is married and she has been with her husband for nearly 8 years. She has a 7 year old daughter. They inherited the house that they live in from her in-laws. Ana has been making a living taking care of her farm animals for the past 8 years. She has cows, sheep, and billy goats. Her husband cultivates a type of vegetable called a "chacra" and he also grows potatoes. During harvest Ana begins to prepare meals for her family at 5 o'clock a.m until 8 o'clock a.m and afterwards she gathers the potatoes and the vegetables and prepares them to get them ready to sell at the marketplace. Before she leaves to go to the market she ties up her cows and her billy goats to posts so that they will not escape and ruin her neighbors' cultivations. Ana is really happy with raising her animals and cultivating her plants, and now she wants to start selling firewood. She wants to take advantage of having a lot of trees around her home. With the firewood sales she wants to improve the quality of life for her family. Ana has received 5 consecutive loans through MFP and she has shown that she is punctual in making the payments. She has been really happy with the policies of the communal bank and she is in charge of taking notes during each of their meetings. With this loan she wants to buy fertilizers for her vegetables, and buy more baby sheep of a good breed. Her plan is to raise the animals to grow and get fat and then resale them at a better price so that she can earn more money.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and small billy goats

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua el señor Marvin V. se dedica a su actividad agropecueria en una comunidad llamada San Cayetano donde a diario se esfuerza por salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.

La razón única por la que el señor Marvin ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la actividad agropecuaria como lo es la compra de terneras para su desarrollo y crianza. Esta le servirá de mucho beneficio porque al dedicarse a la crianza de ganado y a la vez a la agricultura logra continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the community of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, señor Marvin V. works as a farmer in a town called San Cayetano. Her strives every day to get ahead and provide food for his family, which is made up of his wife and kids. The only reason señor Marvin has come to Ceprodel is to receive the benefit of a credit so he can purchase calves to raise. This will benefit him a lot because if he raises livestock and farms at the same time, he can continue to support his home which needs his help so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 29 años, conviviente por más de 12 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus suegros. Desde niña trabajó en el labrando de la tierra, sus chacra temporales están ubicadas en las alturas de su pueblo, toma de 1 a 1.30 horas en carro llegar. La especialidad es la siembra de papa de mesa o de colores, a estos productos le presta mayor dedicación su esposo, mientras que Clara, por motivos de educación de sus hijos, optó por mudarse a la ciudad, solamente en los meses de cosecha regresa a la chacra para coger, seleccionar las papas y finalmente  preparar la cargas en sacos de 50 kilos para enviar a los mercados. Clara dice estar muy contenta con su producción de las papas, orgullosa nos muestra. Ahora que vive en la ciudad se propuso vender mazamorra (crema dulce de maíz morado) en horas de la tarde. Y con el tiempo tiene planes de dedicarse a la compra y venta de carnes rojas, aprovechando la buena crianza de carneros en su pueblo, está segura que le resultará este negocio, pero sin descuidar sus  cultivos. Ella es una cliente muy activa, tiene el cargo de presidenta en su banco comunal, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo a demostrado pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, y lo que más le agrada es la solidaridad de los integrantes a su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y de un carnero tierno que comprará con la finalidad de que madure y pueda comercializarlo a mayor precio. De ser posible también adquirirá ollas y azafates para el preparado de sus mazamorras.
texts.en:
Clara, 29, has been in a common law marriage with the father of her 4 children for over 12 years. She now lives in her in-laws’ house. She has worked the land since she was a girl. Their temporary fields are located in the heights of her village. It takes about 1 or 1.3 hours by car to get there. Their specialty is planting different types of potatoes. Her husband spends more time on these products. Clara, wanting an education for her children, decided to move to the city. She only goes back to the field to help during the harvest months. She picks, selects, and prepares the potatoes in 50 kilo sacks to send to the markets. Clara is very happy and proud of her potato production. Now that she lives in the city, she proposes selling “mazamorra” (a sweet cream from purple corn) in the afternoon hours. Over time she has plans to buy and sell red meat. By taking advantage of the good cattle raising in her village, she is sure that this business will happen and without neglecting their crops. She is the president of her community bank, and she is a very active member. This is her second loan with MFP, and in all this time she has shown that she makes her payments on time. What she likes the best is the solidarity of the group’s members. The loan is to by fertilizer. She will also buy a ram to raise and sell at a greater price. If possible, she will also buy pots and trays to use in preparing her “mazamorras”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a ram

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda F. raises pigs. She is 46 years old and has two children. She started her business 24 years ago. She raises pigs because she loves the work and earns a lot of money from the business. Aside from pigs, she and her husband own 3 1/4 hectares of land, which her husband manages in order to support their family needs.

Gelinda has three pigs and would like to increase the size of her business with a loan from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000. She will use the loan to buy more piglets and pig feed.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and own their own businesses. Gelinda enjoys the use of the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and two sacks of hog starter feed.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar A. makes a living growing rice. He is 41 years old and currently has no children. His wife, Edna A., works overseas. They are working very hard to build a good future for the children they plan to have. Edgar started his business 21 years ago. He started working a one-hectare farm, which he tilled to earn money to meet their needs. Now, he works a farm more than twice that size, and hopes to expand it even more in the near future.

He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and other items he needs for his farm. If he can secure this loan, he believes that his farm will definitely produce a better harvest -- and this will allow him to buy more land for him and his wife.

CEVI is committed to help Edgardo grow his business by providing him with credit, training and insurance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other items for his farm

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en: Uk C. is a leader of a group of borrowers consisting of four members. She, 58, is a mother of six children:  three of them are married and live separately, while the others who work as laborers and planters are under her care. Uk C. is married to Yuth, 67, who is local farmer. Since 1998 she has also been a local farmer, and she owns a field where she plants cashew nuts. Recently, she decided to to get a cart to increase her income. So C. is taking out a loan to buy a cart to transfer the cashew nut seeds. The other members of the group are: Chhouk S., 37, who works as a local farmer, is taking out a loan to buy a cart for transporting vegetables to the market; and Ni S. M., 26, and Hou P., 26, who are both local farmers, are applying for loans to buy cashew seeds in bulk. They all live in Kampong Cham Province.  P. was not available during the photograph so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a cart for transferring cashew nut seeds.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. owns a small duck farm. She is 46 years old and has eight children. Merlinda started raising ducks 30 years ago, and has continued to do it because she thinks it is the most profitable business opportunity available to her. Today, she has 400 ducks. She and her husband, Nilo Crisostomo, manage their business as a couple, and a good deal of the income they earn goes to pay tuition and book fees at their children's schools. They are happy to have their ducks because it allows them to provide for the needs of their family.

Merlinda is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings. She will also use a portion of the loan to transport her ducks to her regular customers. 

CEVI is proud to help Merlida by providing the credit she needs to manage her business. Merlinda also receives training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo H. makes a living growing rice. He is 46 years old and has two children. He started his business 19 years ago, and is happy because it is going well and allows him to provide for needs of his family. He is applying for this loan to buy more fertliizer for his farm. Alfredo believes that this purchase will allow him to increase the size and quality of his crop, and further increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en: Mrs. Edeliza L., 19, has 1 child and is married to Roger, a farmer. Her early marriage prompted her to earn a living. She strives hard to help her husband so that they can provide for the immediate needs of their family. She manages a variety store in her village, and once she became aware of the micro-finance institution HSPFI, she immediately joined and received an initial loan of PHP5000. Limited stock and increasing demands from her customers proved that this amount was insufficient. Now, she is in need of additional capital amounting to PHP 11000 which will be used to purchase more grocery items for her variety store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her variety store.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Wendelina

texts.en:
Wendelina T. is a resident of Zone 1, Kabakungan Claveria Misamis Oriental (Southern Philippines). She is married to Eduardo T. and is blessed with 9 children, of which 4 are married and 5 are her dependents.

Her husband is a farmer, so to be able to sustain and pay for their daily expenses she has to help through her fish vending business. Her primary customers are her neighbors and people from nearby villages. She plans to venture into another business like food vending in the near future, as she likes to cook food. For her second loan cycle, she wants to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 for additional fish vending capital.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel I. is married and presently resides in Mahayahay, Waterfall Balingasag, Misamis Oriental Southern, Philippines. As a husband and a father, he wants to provide a better life for his family.

He is a fishermen, and fishing is his family's source of living. Recently, the family was in financial difficulty since their small boat needs to have a repair. So to be able to survive, he found some other ways to earn. Currently, he is the fish-cage caretaker with a PHP 200.00/day salary. He wants to obtain a loan from Kiva's partner HSPFI in the amount of PHP 12,000.00 for the repair and maintenance of his boat.

loans.use: Boat repair and maintenance

loans.name: Maylen

texts.en: Maylene A. is a twenty-six year old single parent with two children. She strives to make a living to support her children. Currently, she owns a small stall in Baliwagan market in the Southern Philippines where she displays her parents' vegetable products, this is her parents way of helping her. Her future plan for her children is to let them finish their studies, and would consider this her greatest personal achievement, if reached. She is now applying for a loan of $175 for additional business capital to purchase additional stock for her stall, such as spices, oil, salt and vinegar.

loans.use: to purchase spices, oil, salt and vinegar for sale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 29-year-old resident of Sibalom, Antique. She is married and blessed with three children. 

She makes a living raising ducks. She started with only 10 birds that lay eggs -- a small number, which is why she supplements her income by raising hogs. Mary Ann has applied for this loan to increase her egg production by buying 100 additional ducks. 

Mary Ann had her own farm and an incubator. She dreams that one day she will be able to own her own home and make enough money so that her chlldren can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy 100 ducks

loans.name: Baby Jean

texts.en:
Baby Jean M. is engaged in public transport using a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle). Her motorcycle was acquired through installments (monthly); at this time she has already finished paying and owns this motorcycle. Because her tricycle's franchise number and registration are expiring, her current loan will be used for the renewal of the annual registration and maintenance of the motor. She is engaged also in hog-fattening for additional income.

At the age of 32, she is blessed with 2 children. Her husband was a family driver but when she acquired the motorcycle he stopped and has been a driver of her own.

Baby Jean plans to have a jeepney (a local bus) to have more income and send her children to school to earn a degree.

loans.use: renewal of franchise and registration of motorcycle

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya F. owns a small rice field in their village. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. She started her business 20 years ago. She uses her 3/4 hectare farm to grow rice and support her family well. Gilbert Fajagutama, her husband, is a farmer. Together they work hard to clothe and feed their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will definitely help Ligaya increase her yield. In that way, she believes that she could easily pay for the books, tuition and other miscellaneous school fees of her children.

CEVI gives Ligaya credit to run her business. She also receives training and insurance coverage to help her small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus S. is thirty-one years old and married to Loida S.. They have two children. As head of the family, Jesus tries to provide for his children's basic needs. The couple ventured into the buying and selling of dried fish for a year. Jesus started this business with his own small amount of capital. Then he was introduced to, and joined with, the micro-financial program of HSPFI. He received an initial loan of $110 with which he was able to purchase a larger volume of dried fish to sell. Due to increasing demand, he needs additional capital in the amount of $175.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh ThịThảnh năm nay  50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Thời gian đầu chị Thảnh vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đến nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị Thảnh còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay  với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để mua thêm thực phẩm , bia, nước ngọt... để đầu tư vào hàng ăn nhằm phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn yêu cầu của khách hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi T. is 50 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1996. Initially, Mrs. T. borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Currently, apart from income from livestock raising, Mrs. T.'s family gets extra income from running a restaurant. These are the businesses that bring the income for her family which is VND6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy additional foods, beers and beverages to invest in the restaurant to serve the needs of the customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for the restaurant

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Bích  năm nay  44 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành.Năm 1998 chị Bích tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị không chỉ mở rộng chăn nuôi mà còn có thêm vốn để đầu tư trồng rừng. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng rừng hàngtháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của hai con đã đi làm với tổng thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua giống cây về trồng.
texts.en:
Mrs Ta Thi B. is 44 years old. She has three children, two of them are grown up. In 1998, Mrs B. joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to raise cows. To date, after 10 years of participation in the Fund, her family not only has expanded livestock raising but also has had money to invest in growing forest. Currently, in addition to income from livestock raising and forest growing, her family receives financial support from the two grown up children, which brings the family total income to VND 6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to invest more in raising livestock and buy small plants to grow

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in raising livestock and buy small plants to grow

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Nhì năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đàng tuổi đến trường tại huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán than. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán than của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi N. is 49 years old. She is living with her husband and two school age children in Y Yen district, Nam Dinh province. In 2000 she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and trading coals. Currently these are the businesses that bring the main source of income for her family, which is VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to invest more in the coal trading business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in the trading coal business.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Nhàn năm nay 50 tuổi, chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại bên cạnh nguồn thu  từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc làm mộc của hai con nên cuộc sống khá ổn định với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 10 con lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi N. is 50 years old. Her husband unfortunately died at young age. She lives with two grown-up children. In 2001, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. Currently, in addition to income from pig raising, her family also receives income from furniture making business of her children, therefore the living condition is fairly stable with an income of VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy 10 more pigs and foods for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 more pigs and foods for them.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Tuyết  năm nay 39 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại chị Tuyết đang làm nghề tráng bánh cuốn và sản xuất bún tại nhà. Anh Thiềng chồng chị ngoài thời gian giúp đỡ vợ vận chuyển hàng hoá cho các cửa hàng ăn anh còn tranh  thủ đi làm thuê để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập ổn định 4.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Tuyết đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 17000.000đ để đầu tư mua thóc về dự trữ phụcvụ cho công việc sản xuất bánh cuốn và bún của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi T., 39 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2000. Currently, Mrs. T. produces rice pancake and rice noodle at home. Mr. Thieng, her husband, helps her to deliver the foods to the restaurants and does casual work to get extra income for the family. With a stable income of VND4,000,000 per month, the condition of living of Mrs. T.'s family is increasingly improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND17,000,000 to buy rice as stock for producing rice pancake and rice noodle.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice as stock for producing rice pancake and rice noodle.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly F. is forty-seven years old and married to Edipolo F.. They have three children. Edipolo hauls sand and gravel in their village, but his income is insufficient for their needs. Beverly wanted to find ways and means to help her husband support the family. Through her own initiative she joined the program of HSPFI and received an initial loan of $110, which was used to purchase grocery items for her variety store in the village. She was very determined that her store would succeed until her children finished their studies. Now she is in need of more funds amounting to $250 to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her variety store.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hồng năm nay  50 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống tại huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam định cùng chồng và hai con. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2002 và  vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và làm mộc . Đến nay sau 6 năm tham gia Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã có 1 xưởng  mộc chuyên  sản xuất bàn ghế và đồ dùng gia đình với thu nhập 5.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 khối gỗ về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi H. is 50 years old. She lives in Y Yen district, Nam Dinh province with her husband and two children. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002 and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs and making furniture. To date, after 6 years of participation in the Fund, with effective use of loan, her family has a furniture workshop specialized in making tables, chairs and other home products with an income oof VND5,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy 2 cubic meters of wood for the furniture-making business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By wood for furniture making business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Tỏ năm nay  44 tuổi,  chồng chị đã mất , chị đang sống cùng  hai con tại thị trấn Lâm huyện Ý Yên Nam định. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2002 và  vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và làm mộc . Đến nay sau 6 năm tham gia Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã có 1 xưởng  mộc chuyên  sản xuất bàn ghế và đồ dùng gia đình với thu nhập 5.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 khối gỗ về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi T. is 44 years old. Her husband has died. She lives with two children in Lam commune, Y Yen district, Nam Dinh province. She has participated in TYM Funce since 2002 and borrowed money T. raise pigs and make furniture. T. date, after 6 years of participation in the Fund, with effective use of loans, her family has a furniture workshop specialized in making chairs, tables, and other home products with a monthly income of VND5,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she wishes T. borrow VND 20,000,000 T. buy 2 cubic meters of wood for the furniture making business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2008.Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ sản xuất kinh doanh đồ gỗ và lương lái xe của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 34 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, the business that brings the main source of income for her family is making and trading furniture. Together with the salary of her husband who is a driver, the total income of the family is VND 4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 9,000,000 to invest more in the business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for furniture making and trading

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Thúy năm nay  51 tuổi.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do chồng mất sớm, hai con còn nhỏ thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở rộng sản xuất, chăn nuôi và học thêm nghề may. Hiện nay  ngoài chăn nuôi chị và con gái  may găng tay và may quần áo cho các cơ sở may. Thu nhập của gia đình hiện nay  đạt 4.5 triêu đồng/tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua máy khâu và vải về làm may.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 51 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family's economic situation was very difficult as her husband had died and she had two small children. The main source of income was from farming and livestock raising. To date, after 10 years of participation in the Fund, she proactively borrowed money to expand the farming and livestock raising business and learn to be a tailor. Currently, apart from raising livestock, she and her daughter make gloves and clothes for garment workshops. The family's income is at VND4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy sewing machine and textiles to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and textiles to make clothes

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Bính năm nay  55 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2005. Sua khi tham giaQuỹ Tình thương có thêm vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán. Hiện tại  chị thường xuyên đi lấy hàng ( đồ điện tử)từ Hà Nội về bán lại cho các đại lý trong huyện. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu 4.500.000/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngo Thi B., 55 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2005. After joining the Fund and receiving loans, her family has invested in trading. Currently she frequently buys electronic goods from Hanoi to resell to the shops in the district. This is the business that brings to her family an income of VND 4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to invest more in the trading business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in trading business

loans.name: Irshad Bashir Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is forty-four years old, married, and has been a citizen of a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last nineteen years. She is an uneducated lady. Her parents were very poor and they had a large family. Irshad is married to a man whose name is B. M., and he runs a bakery in the community. He has been running this shop for the last ten years. Irshad baji is the mother of five children, four sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Irshad baji is a self-made woman. She is involved in a vegetable-selling business. She does this work to pay her children's school fees. Her family is very happy because of her loving support. Irshad successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy bakery materials (bread, eggs and butter) for her husband’s bakery shop. 

She is the group leader of more women in her locality. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Noreen baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe-making business. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bakery items

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Phương năm nay  56 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Những năm đầu tham gia Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng sau đó nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi không đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao cho gia đình nên sau đó chị đã vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh buôn bán tại chợ. Thời gian tới gia đình chị đang dự định đầu tư vốn mở thêm của hàng kinh doanh đồ điện tử tạo  việc làm cho con trai vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ.
Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị đạt 4.5000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi P., 56 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. In the first few years after joining the Fund, she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock, but she realized that livestock raising is not a profitable business for her family, therefore she borrowed more money to invest in trading at the market. The family's income currently is VND 4,500,000 per month. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 as she plans to open an electronic trading store to create job for her son.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a electronic trading store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hồng năm nay 46 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu nhưng  đến nay gia đình chị đang đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng ăn và sản xuất đồ gỗ cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại địa phương. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu  chính của gia đình chị với thu nhập  4.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ  một phần chị dùng để đầu tư cho cửa hàng ăn, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thêm gỗ về đóng bàn ghế bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi H., 46 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Initially, she borrowed money to invest in scrap materials collection, but currently her family invests in running a food stall and making furniture to supply to the consumers in the area. These are the business that bring the main source of income for her family, which is VND 4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000. She will use one part to invest more in the food stall, and the remaining part to buy wood to make tables and chairs to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in the food stall, buy wood to make furniture
